description:
Philz Coffee was on my list after one of my favorite food bloggers posted about a mint mojito iced coffee that she got there while visiting SF. There are several locations around the city and one really close to our Airbnb in the Castro. My boyfriend and I stopped in while wandering around the neighborhood. I ordered the mint mojito and he got an iced Mocha Tesora. Each had different ways to customize them including the level of sweetness and creaminess. We both ordered them as-is and sat down to people watch while our drinks were being made. The girl at the counter taking orders and making drinks was really nice and patient which made for a great first experience. The menu is a bit overwhelming as it's pretty large and there's a lot of info there to take in.

We got our drinks fairly quickly and let me tell you - they were amazing. The mint mojito sounded so strange to me but it was creamy, minty, and refreshing without being overly sweet. It was super cooling and perfect for the warm afternoon. The Mocha Tesora was like the best hot chocolate you've ever had - it seriously tasted like a melted chocolate bar with a bit of coffee. These aren't serious coffee drinks but they are really fun for a special treat. They also offer (of course) plenty of coffee and tea options.
author: Katy C.

description:
I can't speak to the speciality drinks at Philz because I was lame and only ordered an iced coffee, BUT this place is great. I will be back for a mint mojito coffee soon even though it sounds like something I will not like because that is what everyone else ordered and they all had enormous smiles on their faces. And it was packed! The line was long but moved quickly.

I love the way you order at Philz because you go right up to your own personal barista, explain to them what you would like, and then you walk over to the cashier and pay. Somehow this seems like the best possible way because you know your barista will understand what you want rather than a potential miscommunication with the person taking your order that might not also be making your coffee.

The coffee shop was packed and there was nowhere to sit if I had wanted to sit down, but thankfully I was on the go! The flavor of the iced coffee was great! Strong and refreshing - you could really get the notes from the beans they use. They had yummy looking treats, toasts, etc. at the front as well if you are looking for something to eat.
author: Bri T.

description: Service and coffee is absolutly amazing here! So many unique coffee blends! And of course the Mint Mojito and kouign is a must try!! The mint mojito is an iced coffee with crushed mint in it and topped with a mint leaf.  Such a refreshing drink and the mint is not too over powering - you can still taste the nice strong flavor of the coffee. The kouign was really nice and flakey and it was even better that they offered to have it heated up. Great place for a quick pick me up!
author: Paula C.

description: Cool staff. Chill spot. Decor is great.  Even has outside seating that is lovely as well!
author: Thuy N.

description: This is probably the most fun Philz Coffee location. It is in Castro District, so parking is a bit of a challenge. The inside is super colorful and has a welcoming atmosphere. Every staff member I interacted with was extra friendly. They were some of the nicest baristas I have ever met.
author: Roxanne F.

description:
Friendly service, my first time at a Philz coffee.
This being in the Castro District was really nice. I loved their decors and everyone was just so friendly. You first order your drink at the baristas and pay after at the register. (I went straight to the cashier)
My coffee was good, a tab bit on the strong side but I enjoyed it. I needed a waker upper. I will def come back and check out their other coffees.
author: Maricel J.

description: As a coffee snob, I have to say that Philz is seriously life-changing.  I love that they outline tasting notes for each type they offer, and that they brew each cup individually right in front of you. So heavenly. The staff is really sweet and they have you try your drink after they make it to make sure you like it. Wow. Wish we had Philz on the east coast!!
author: Taya A.

description: I moved away from SF 6 years ago and, still, Philz is the main thing I miss (other than burritos, but that's obvious). Ecstatic iced with honey and cream was always an excellent mood boost at the start of my day. I wish they would come to the east coast. pleassssse come?
author: M J.

description: Awesome Philz location. I've been to a lot of Philz, and this one has the nicest and friendliest employees. I went post-lunch time on a Wednesday, and it was pretty packed with people working on their laptops. I took two out-of-towners here (in order to impress them), and they really enjoyed the decor, service, and drinks. As always, I ordered the mint mojito, and it was fantastic.
author: Thu P.

description:
Philz as become a staple of my morning routine, as a struggle with this god damn low carb diet... Excusez mon français. Everyone their is very friendly.

 Philz sells pour over coffee, which is both delicious and low calorie (assuming you avoid the really good stuff with sugar). You can get your drink with stevia (Hooray!) and Heavy Creme. If your on a LCHF diet, Keto, or something like that, this is a coffee place you can go to. 

They also have a nice table with outlets for those who are carrying around a laptop. The Wi-Fi is free, but isn't that great. I would suggest connecting to the xfinity hotspot in the area if you have Xfinity.
author: Bryan M.

description:
I always love to get the iced mint mojito to at Philz. Highly recommend, so good!

This is a festive location in the heart of the Castro. Nice little outdoor seating area.

I came about 10 minutes before closing but the staff was still friendly and helpful.
author: Monica G.

description:
Guess Philz has turned a corner...literally. Yes, my review was in dire need of updating since my original review was referring to the location on 18th and Sanchez when it was next to the laundromat. Funny how I thought $2.50 for a Large was quite pricey back then. A decade later, it's up the block on Castro looking all modern and cookie-cutter like the rest of the Philz chain. I don't mind the change or the relocation since this block of Castro is relatively quiet even on the weekends. Enter and the purple unicorn and rainbow decor touches tell you that you're in the Castro.

There's a community table up front and a counter with seats as well, but most people like to hang out on the bench against the side wall where all the little cafe tables are (photo: http://bit.ly/2pMiIN5). Most of the time I've ordered a now $4.50 Large Silken Splendor with its mellow flavor mix of dark cocoa, nuts and butter with just a hint of milk. And a $2.50 Chocolate Chip Cookie with Coconut was an impulsive purchase for a lifetime on the thighs (photo: http://bit.ly/2oosOma). However, Jamie W. and I turned our own corner on our most recent visit.

He ordered a Philz Iced Tea, while I went for the Herbal Mint Tea with real mint leaves thrown in for good measure (photo: http://bit.ly/2pcsMlV). No sweeteners, no milk, not even a cookie. We were so good it hurt as we watched others devour pastries with abandon. They'll be sorry someday...if there is a God. Anyhow, I like this newish location and only wish there was a bit more seating space just to hang for a while. The Castro has changed quite a bit over the years and not necessarily for the better, but I like seeing the rainbow regalia in here to remind me what a great 'hood it could truly be.

COFFEE/TEA - 4 stars...still a grand cup of coffee and also a satisfying cuppa tea
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...Castro casual, only wish it was more spacious
SERVICE - 4 stars...they know what they're doing here
TOTAL - 4 stars...just around the corner and up the street
author: Ed U.

description: Best service for coffee, tea, and delicious treats!  Philz is definitely my "go to" to start the day, or an afternoon "pick me up".  Best handcrafted coffee in the Castro!
author: Matt A.

description:
The best coffee I've ever had and also unique flavors with quality taste. I would recommend everyone to try this, coffee-lover or not. 

I got the mojito iced coffee, and it was very refreshing. Tasted exactly like a mojito (without the alcohol) and some coffee--it sounds strange but if you love mojitos like I do, you'll love this coffee. 

They also had a pumpkin spice ice coffee and that was also delicious if you like pumpkin spice. 

I also tried my friends tavosa blend which is the most popular and the smoothness spoke for the quality of the coffee. 

The barista was very friendly and even saw me trying to get a good picture of my mint leaf on top of my coffee and offered me another that was prettier. 

The layout of how you order and pay is a little strange, you order first at the first counter you see then turn around and then pay at the other counter that has a few pastries you could choose to add on.
author: Moani H.

description:
Mmmmm. Silken Splendor!!  Cinnamon roll. Clean place. Clean bathroom!  Super sweet staff. Good energy. Good music. 
Winner. 
Clap! Clap! Clap!
author: Thomas D.

description:
Friendly baristas (yay!), quick service (yay!), uncomfortable seating (boo!).

There is a variety of seating options here - from communal tables to bar seating (people-watching YAAAAS).

But.

The chairs.

My butt.

Hurt.

"My PhilzOnCastro Poem" by Nic Z.
author: Nic Z.

description:
I love Philz coffee!!!! I've had the honor of meeting Phil himself and he's awesome! I was in the neighborhood with my friend and wanted to hit this place up for my fave, Mint Mojito! 

We came around 5:30 on a Wednesday and there wasnt a line,score! We were greeted by a nice barista and my friend asked for a recommendation since it was his first time. He ordered a Mocha and I went with my classic the Mint Mojito.

Our orders came up quickly and my friend noticed his was hot instead of cold like he asked for. The barista said he'd fix it but my friend said it was fine and decided to drink it as is. Might want to double ask hot or cold to the customers just to make sure.

Cute location with seating outside. I can imagine it gets very busy during the morning and late afternoon.  

Friendly service and quick. I'll be back!
author: Evangelina B.

description: This is one of those "MUST try" type of places, if you enjoy coffee, if it's your first time, or if you're Experienced , I found the taste to be extremely tasty, with a subtle mocha taste and a flavour of coffee that makes my taste buds scream with you, and my mind wakes up ready for the day ahead ;)
author: Nahum S.

description:
Casual coffee shop located in the Castro.  They have a row of seats and tables located in front of the bar area for people to use(either to study or just want for their drinks to be ready. 

They play music at a decently loud volume so if you need to concentrate or study, it might be difficult without headphones.  They play popular radio hits, so if that isn't your thing then it might be better to find a more chill area to enjoy your coffee.

There is also plenty of foot traffic from people coming in as this place is quite popular. It might be difficult to find seating, but most seem to just pick up their drinks and go.
author: Jacky C.

description:
You'd think it would get better. I mean, the coffee is okay despite overpriced, but the service continues to be, well, odd here. It's so user-unfriendly. I've been here before and I still never know where to go to start placing my order. Especially when they're all chatting together, admittedly about pour over versus French press. But get over it. Yes you're a fancy coffee place in the Castro. But how come other Philz have so much less attitude and are so much easier to navigate?

I only come here when someone else really insists.
author: Tim P.

description: Just made it to san fran and had to stop at philz coffee. Might of just been that I really needed a cup of coffee but this coffee might have been the best coffee i've ever had. make your way to philz!
author: Elena W.

description: What can I say it's Philz and I pretty much give five stars to all the Philz in town. However, this one definitely has a strong neighborhood vibe, ample space to get some work done and a constant supply of friendly neighborhood pups coming for a visit. I love the vibe at this Philz and its definitely one of my top!
author: Justin S.

description: My all time favorite Philz location. Best atmosphere, kind staff, inviting as hell. My ideal morning looks like a soulcycle class, iced mint mojito or mocha, and a walk around the Castro. Don't sleep on Philz.
author: Cody J.

description: Amazing staff! They make sure that the costumer's coffee is at their best for! Best coffee than Starbucks
author: Salie E.

description: Delicious, good quality coffee beans. They specialize in pour-overs, but I use the beans for delicious cold brew at home!
author: Susan S.

description:
This is one of my favorite Philz Coffee locations. It's still got that neighborhood vibe like the Mission one and not too crowded. Newer ones like the Front St or downtown ones have a more polished, commercial, and less soul. The Castro one has a little bit of flavor decorated with rainbow chalk drawing, plush My Little Pony dolls, Harvey Milk poster lining the waiting area. The line hasn't been too crazy unless it's a weekend mid morning right before lunch time. Like the other Philz, you wait in line, go up the next open barista to place your order, then exit the line to the cashier to check out and go back to wait until your coffee is called.

A modest and small interior, I mostly grab it to go but it's comfy enough and possible to hang out. There are a few small tables with a long bench in the ordering area, some working tables close the front, and outdoor seating. Toast, pastries from Starter bakery, yogurt, and granola for quick bites.

Ah yes, but what really makes it is the coffee, which is consistent across all locations. Philz is what made me realize drip coffee could be good and distinctly flavorful. So strong, but so great and flavorful. The baristas add cream and sugar for you (not self serve) so you can't calibrate it yourself but if you tell them how you want it (light, medium, heavy) they err on the conservative side and can adjust.

My favorites:
Philtered Soul - Rich and chocolately, hazelnut flavor. My favorite of the Philz, I get this as a special treat.
Jacob's Wonderbar - Dark roast, nutty, full-bodied, it's my daily morning coffee at my office.
Tesora - Mild, slightly acidic, a neutral crowd pleaser.
Philharmonic - Fruity medium roast, slight cardamom but not overwhelming.
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee - Refreshing, cool, slightly sweet and creamy. Beverage innovation really.
author: Truc N.

description: My favorite go-to for strong yummy coffee.  The waiting is ok for me because I know they made that cup of coffee I ordered (the way I want) just for me me me.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: I found the coffee really blah! But then I don't understand why there's a mint leaf in my coffee either. Not for folks who appreciate coffee as it really should be.
author: Dee N.

description: Some of the most friendly and attentive baristas in SF! The staff has changed over a few times yet they always make me feel welcome and comfortable. The coffee and tea are very straightforward. No espresso. The baristas are always happy to make suggestions. If you don't like it, they'll remake it. Personally I haven't had a coffee yet I didn't enjoy there!
author: William W.

description: So if you like good coffee and live in the city, you will have certainly been to Philz. I just thought they deserved a big thumbs up because how many coffee places do you leave thinking "I love this place"? The pain of it used to be the line just to order and then wait some more. But I installed their new app and I simply order my coffee from 5 minutes away, walk in, and it's waiting on the counter, done and done. It is a little pricey compared to a pour-over at Starbucks, but it's certainly a treat...
author: Tom B.

description: Same drill at Philz! Order, pay and wait. The staff are spunky and fun. And the vibe is different than most other Philz locations as it is more lively and compact. Love the bulletin boards.
author: Kayli T.

description:
My boyfriend and I needed an afternoon pick me up after visiting Dolores Park. I was really excited when I found out that Philz was so close so we took a nice leisurely stroll to grab coffee. It was about a 10-15 minute walk and we enjoyed the nice SF weather :)

I got the Iced Mocha Tesora and it had a delicious chocolatey flavor that didn't overpower the coffee taste. Yummy! I had a few sips of my bf's iced Mint Mojito too. It was good and refreshing but it's not really my cup of tea (or shall I say coffee? haha) because I'm not a big fan of mint. I've also tried the iced Philtered Soul at another location and that one has a great hazelnut taste :)

The baristas are friendly and service was great. This location has a lot of charm and character, and I loved the smattering of cute unicorns in the store! I'm sure we'll be back again whenever we're in town :)
author: Marianne E.

description:
Albert was very nice and explained their menu to me. which was much appreciated.

However, when I got to the register I had a terrible interaction with Sadie.  I walked up and said "good morning how are you doing?"  she didnt respond.  Then I said "I would like a turkey sandwich and Albert is getting me a large coffee". she told me the total was $10. I handed her my credit card.  she swiped it. and then she just walked away. I stood there for a minute expecting she was coming back to say "thank you" or to hand me a receipt. or ask me to sign something.  she did nothing. just walked away leaving me standing there. 

I awkwardly asked someone else behind the bar if I needed to sign or if I was done.  he said "youre done" 

horrible service which actually made me feel really awkward and very unwelcome.
author: Brian S.

description: Every location is fantastic, but I would just like to say that this is by far the best coffee in the whole world. I wish I had one closer to me in Sonoma County, but I've driven to SF for the sole purpose of having it. A must stop destination if you're given the chance.
author: Kasey R.

description:
This was the very first Philz Coffee location that I have visited. And it is safe to say, all of the other locations after that did not match up. 

Since it was my first time, of course I had to order their infamous Mint Mojito! Employees were very friendly. This location is in Castro and I love the decor here!
author: Michelle S.

description: You know what you are getting with Philz... his own take on coffee! Huge selection of roasts and beans, fantastic staff, quirky ordering system... so no surprises compared to all the other philz around the place! Solid caffeine hit with good service...
author: Reg B.

description:
I live in Washington DC, and frequent my local Philz Coffee nearly 3X a week and have the best experience each and every visit.

While in San Francisco for vacation, I visited this location 2X. It was interesting how vastly different the culture is at this location compared to Philz in DC. No employees are smiling, no employees are eager to serve you or even greet you, and the turn around time for your order is drastically slower than my usual experiences. 

The coffee remains my favorite on Earth. The food was hot and yummy, but the customer service was just depressing here; Especially when you're accustomed to it being so much better.
author: Adam L.

description:
So I've counted. I've nice been to eight Philz locations now hahha. 

This might be my favorite location to date! They have bumpin' music and the staff here are soooo much FUN. Britney Spears' I'm a Slave 4 U comes on and the baristas break out in dance and sing. 

This place just puts a huge smile on your face. Had brunch at Kitchen Story down the street and got a bad cup of joe. ): Next time I know better! I got to Philz right before 11am on a Sunday and the line wasn't  too bad. It moved very quickly and we got our drinks fast too! 

There's one big communal table and a bar like sitting area. Towards the back there is booth seating, but only fits one person. 

There are a few chairs outside if you prefer to sit outside, but there really was no more seating available when I visited.
author: Dianna C.

description: They have have amazing coffee that is brewed one cup at a time. I love their iced mint mojitos, they're always so tasty and they use real mint! This location in particular is pretty good and the atmosphere is pretty fun. The staff is always friendly whenever I frequent this location.
author: Kunzu K.

description: They always ask me, when they give me my coffee: "Let me know if it's not perfect."  I love their coffee and fun staff.
author: Robert D.

description:
Look guys, Philz will never ever let you down.

You want good coffee? Philz
You want a chill, dope coffee shop ambience? Philz
You want friendly customer service? Philz

I recently moved to the Castro, and I've already made Philz my second home. Tasty, high quality drinks, plenty of seating, a comfortable work/socializing environment-- what more can a girl ask for?
author: Nicole A.

description: My friend and I stopped here to grab some coffee while in the area. It's right on Castro and we expected it to be little busy due to the area and it was. However, the employees were so fast and attentive, we were pretty much in and out. We both got the iced mint coffee thangs, which were bombdotcom as always. Overall, it was a great experience and the fact that we got princess parking (parking spot up front) made our experience even better! To be completely honest, this location will not be my go-to for Philz coffee because I'm usually not in the Castro area that often but, it's definitely worth a stop! My experience here, overall, was awesome and I highly recommend stopping here if you need a coffee fix!
author: Misty T.

description: Omg it's unicorn and rainbow themed! Haha :) love it. Great place to grab some caffeine. Thanks for always being perfect philzzz!
author: Angela D.

description:
Yay, coffee that lives up to the hype! I've always seen pictures of this mint leaf in creamy iced coffee, but have never gotten the chance to try it. I was excited that I was able to come to NorCal and try it!

I ordered the regular-sized mint mojito iced coffee, made creamy and sweet, as should be. Minus one star because the guy forgot to make my order and all my friends who ordered after me all got their drinks. We waited for like 5 minutes and realized that they probably forgot about me so I got in front of him to wait and he finally made my drink.

Other than that, the coffee was creamy and sweet. It was just made so there was a warm, yet cold taste. I loved the hint of mojito because it adds a little character to the coffee. Yum!!
author: Mary T.

description:
They have moved & revamped the place to Castro between 18th & 19th! The interior is pretty cool, a couple single seats and two communal tables.

The space is much larger than before, wifi is great here and it's pretty chill. The seating can be a bit awkward, but it's not bad! My fav. is ofc the iced mint mojito. I go crazy for this drink and it always leaves me happy & satisfied.

I'm going to be a regular here! :)
author: Melanie T.

description: I lied - I like Blue Bottle more than Philz.
author: Ellen C.

description: This place makes a better pour-over than I can make at home (for now). They're able to get a ton of flavor out of their coffee and it's not bitter or sour at all. Delicious!
author: Gavin S.

description: Pretty small place, but great atmosphere. Their coffee is excellent but a bit expensive. They also have great desserts though many times they are sold out.
author: Maeve G.

description:
Philz is always a "great cup o' coffee." I, however, have started to visit #Phiz with the desire and expectation of "more." Like the #Philharmonic, I crave the energy and enthusiasm of their Berry Street location; unfortunately, that isn't to be found here. Please don't misunderstand me - the same professionalism, quality of product and focus - at the newly designed location, remains. Missing was the "conversation" and the desire by this particular team to "engage." 

Yes - I'm emotionally needy. Talk to me. Make me feel "valued." The OLDER Philz use to do that. This one treated me like a #SwipeLeft Tinder entry. 

#SadNick
author: Nick S.

description:
So I heard so much hype around philz coffee and it's iced mint mojito coffee. I ordered it sweet and creamy and I am officially hooked!! 

Most coffee drinks would make me feel heavy after drinking a tall size, but not this one! The coffee drink is very light and refreshing with a touch of mint flavor. I highly recommend. 

To order, you walk in and wait for the next available barista. You tell them what you want and then you then pay at the cash register on the left side and then stand in the waiting area for your barista to finish your drink. You take a sip and she will ask if you like it or want to change it in anyway. If no, then you're off on your merry way.
author: Kay N.

description: The coffee speaks for itself. So delicious.  Highly recommend the Philharmonic.  Cool place friendly people.
author: Jon C.

description: The drinks are okay, but overpriced. The environment of the shop is pretty nice but I must say the method to place an order is just odd. And the employees are nothing special as far as I've seen and in fact I've observed some bad customer service and plain rude interactions. I just go there when someone else is paying or sometimes if Starbucks is too busy I'll just bring my coffee here to enjoy in my nondescript tumbler. Don't tell!!
author: L. A.

description:
Philz = Happiness 

The pour over coffee is strong and full of flavor. The bereasta will make it as sweet and creamy as you want... They somehow make it perfect every time!
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Dancing water black as night.

That was a recommendation made to me by my friend...and it was probably one of the best decisions I've listened to as of late. As far as chains go, Philz is right up there, if not on top. This location is pretty trendy compared to a few other Philz in the city. Definitely doesn't have the charm of a more cozy coffee house but it's still a great location to grab a quick coffee and explore the rest of Castro/Market/Mission Dolores - all within walking distance too!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Wow...  what horrible customer service, or lack there of. I came in tonight around 7:30PM. My friend wanted to grab a cup of coffee and suggested Starbucks, I suggested we go to Philz as I was craving a Gingersnap Iced coffee. It was empty apart from a few lingering customers endlessly typing on their laptops. I greeted my friend then made my way to the ordering area and waited patiently for either of the two employees to greet me and call me over. Let me state that I was the only person waiting in line and the only person standing in the middle of the room so I highly doubt they could've missed me. One of the employees was a young girl with whitish highlights and the other was a tall dark haired guy. 

At first I thought they might be busy finishing other people's drinks, but after a good five minutes it dawned on me that they were avoiding directing their sight towards me. A girl with a ponytail stood by the restroom and was witnessing me waiting patiently. She kept looking at me and back at the two employees behind the counter. 

I finally decided to sit down to join my friend. When the girl got out of the restroom, she made her way behind the counter. Oh, so she works there! Instead of alerting her fellow coworkers to attend me, she followed suit and ignored me as well even though she also saw I was clearly waiting to be attended. As I continued talking to my friend, one of the employees drops off a coffee to a gentleman working on his laptop a few feet away from my friend and I. Nice! I'm glad he got to enjoy his coffee. None of the employees approached me to ask me I still wanted to order. Sure, I could've gone up to them, but it's their responsibility as employees to provide customers with the proper attention they expect to receive when making a purchase. Next thing I know, the girl with the ponytail makes her way towards our table and tells us they're closing in ten minutes. 

I work at a restaurant and no matter what, I give customers the proper attention they deserve even if it towards the end of my shift and I just want to get out of there. I'm absolutely shocked that I was treated this way, more so when the guy next to me got his coffee. I highly doubt it required two people to make it and don't understand why I couldn't be attended. 

So...! I walked out of there without my iced coffee I was oh so eagerly craving and a sour mood. Good job employees at the Castro Philz! You sure are dedicated workers!
author: Diego T.

description: Even though we have Philz in LA now, I still love stopping by to grab a mint mojito iced coffee in SF. It's sweet, creamy, and hits the spot. However the customer service here was slightly lacking and did not feel very welcoming so minus a star for that.
author: Cheyne T.

description:
Considering my tastes i thought i would like the gingersnap latte more but the mint mojito latte was so refreshing and tasty!
Would definitely recommend the mint mojito for those who have never tried it . Its super unique and i have not tasted anything quite like it before. I believe i got it normal and it was just right for me ~
author: Julia K.

description:
This is my favorite gourmet coffee house.

The Blue Mountain roast is dreamy.  As a matter of fact, ALL of the gourmet coffees are delish!!

They have many types from bold to light.  I love that they explain on their menu the taste you're going experience from the coffee you ordered.  Cinnamon...Citrus....Chocolate...yum!!

Once you order your type of coffee, the lovely baristas make it as sweet or non sweet as you want. 

i've never experienced a coffee place that the baristas take so much pride in what they do.  You can taste that pride in every cup of deliciousness they do.
author: Lisa L.

description: Great place awesome coffee, I just did not like that the employee who makes the drink told me to pay after I ordered like I never been to a Philz coffee in my life.
author: Demario P.

description: Barista's are talented and lovely people.  -1 Star for the music being a bit too loud for any sort of work to be done!  I'm torn because I want the staff to have a good time but couldn't make a single business call that day!
author: Linh L.

description:
One star for delicious coffee. Another star for friendly, helpful employees. ..and one more star for nice decor and location. 

Three stars taken away for not having lattes. I mean what coffeehouse have you ever heard of that doesn't make lattes?  What's the point of a coffeehouse? If I just want a cup of regular coffee I could just make it at home. Oh and a large at $4.50. Very pricey.
author: Daniel S.

description: Who knew you can be a coffee snob with a world full of burnt and sugar-filled Starbucks. Night and difference in taste... and because of Philz, I'm now a full-blown coffee snob and proud of it! When things are good, they are amazing and I hope Philz doesn't try and whore itself out like Starbucks, ruining their superb quality they currently have. #coffeesnobsunite :-P
author: Robert E.

description: First time at the SF location and I am in love. Got the popular mint mojito iced which is lovely to drink on a sunny day. Highly recommend.
author: Nicole Anne S.

description:
Some days you wake up with a craving for a MINT MOJITO so massive that you can't resist. Do you know what I'm talking about? It's always devastating though when you take 5 sips and you find that your cup is already empty.

It's cool how their baristas are always asking for feedback. They'd ask if it's not the way you want your coffee & seem to be willing to remake it for you.
author: Yad L.

description: Location is excellent, decor is on point, and baristas are the best! I got my usual, iced gingersnap. I'm from SoCal, but everyone always says that the NorCal locations are better. Idk if it was the atmosphere, the workers, or the actual coffee, but I agree! The only thing is that the price is more expensive in SF than LA but that makes sense ($5.50 in SF for a large of my drink). Pretty decent seating for such a small place. Philz is the best no matter where you go, so definitely stop by if you're around!
author: Rachel B.

description:
Service at the Castro Philz is sometimes hit and miss. Coffee is delicious as always.

Today I got the Ecstatic Iced Coffee and it was perfect. Sweet and creamy is how I like it.

This store is smaller and there's not a lot of seating. Most people take it to go and you can always go drink it in Dolores Park, or one of the steps across the street.

Don't forget the baklava with your coffee :).
author: Billy S.

description: First time at this location and it didn't disappoint me. My boyfriend and I had seats near the window and had views of Castro St and it was fine for us. There's a good amount of seats at this location, but nonetheless, it gets crowded (but what Philz location doesn't right?). Ordered my usual iced Philtered Soul and they made it to perfection! Definitely coming back to this location if I am certainly in the area!
author: Chazmine D.

description: This is a standard Philz, as far as menu goes. The workers all seemed happy and leading to a buzzy atmosphere. Honestly, we were just looking for a coffee shop with enough table space for studying. Philz had much more dedicated workspace than the Starbucks down the block. If you're looking for a place to do work, this is a winner (although a bit noisy).
author: Lauren C.

description: Philz coffee is usually a hit for me because their mint mojito iced coffee usually satisfies my caffeine addiction, but sadly this location in the Castro didn't do it for me. The mint mojito and hot chocolate drinks were both watered down and quite flavorless. Aside from the drinks, the baristas were friendly and personally walked up to each guest 10 minutes before closing to alert them of the time. The store is filled with rainbows and clouds screaming happy unicorns and smiles. Would I drive out here to grab a cup of coffee again, probably not. My local Starbucks will suffice.
author: Amy T.

description:
"You've never had Philz?" That's what my friend yelled at me as we were finishing breakfast in the Castro. "I'll seriously walk way out of my way to get a cup of their coffee before work..." Wow. It must really be good then.

As we arrived, you could see a long line coming out of the shop. Good sign. After listening to what other patrons were ordering, it seemed like this mint mojito coffee was the must have, so I followed in their footsteps and ordered myself a small cup to go.

I like that there aren't a ton of options to choose from and they stick by the ones they offer. When you order, you place your request directly with your barista and proceed to a register to pay your bill. Super easy and really streamlined. Plus, it gives you a chance to converse with your coffee person before settling on a specific blend or beverage. After talking through my cup of mint magic, I went with soy and saw him stick a huge amount of mint into a cup that he was preparing. Didn't see that coming.

When I got my drink, I was surprised when the cold versions still end up in a hot cup. That's okay, still tasted amazing. Just as everyone had proclaimed before me, it's super refreshing and a fantastic caffeinated drink to have on a warm day. When it's cold, I'm sure the hot version is just as delightful and I'll have to consider that when I make my way back to these parts from another coffee outing with friends!

They're really proud of their neighborhood and the locals that come in. You'll see a ton of peeps studying, working or just perusing social sites on their laptops, but I really love the community photos placed all over the walls. Everyone from hipsters to bears, sweaty people that just came back from yoga to casual student just looking to study can be found here. It's really a mixed bag and it has a lot of great energy.

Thumbs up, Philz! You have a new fan.
author: Ryan C.

description: Philz never disappoints. Friendly barista, hip interior, and even a vegan donut to accompany my coffee! This location was awesome in the Castro. Plenty of space to get some work done, though it is a bit loud. Also highly suggest the vegan donut warmed up.
author: Emily H.

description: Awesome coffee place. Friendly staff. Must try the flavorful cardamom infused Turkish roast.
author: Muna A.

description:
I've come to this Philz for a couple times. There is usually a line but the wait is acceptable. As always, Philz makes their coffee only after you order it, and it's always super caffeinated so they keep me awake for many hours after... 

Totally subjective, but I don't really like the taste of their blends. That said, I do like the energy and friendliness of Philz (most locations) in general. So even though I'm not a fan, I do visit Philz once in a while. Overall a solid coffee franchise.
author: Joseph L.

description:
If you're looking for local and good coffee, Philz is the way to go. I know most people who live in San Francisco love to come here often, so you know it's good coffee.

There's a starbucks right around the corner, and there's more people here at Philz than at the starbucks. If you're in town, or just visiting, get your morning coffee at Philz then start your day!
author: Jack L.

description: Our barista was amazing genuinely nice person passionate beyond belief about the coffee and very well educated and entertaining too. The coffee was a well-educated person's delight.
author: Elise G.

description: So my brother and I visited this place. I ordered one coffee -less creamy and less sugar, and my brother ordered a regular mint mojito (regular cream and sugar). The Barista confused the two and made the mint mojito less sugar and creamy. When I went to tell him- he did indeed take the coffee, add some cream and sugar but it wasn't the way it should taste. My Brother and I came all the way from east bay to get a good coffee, and we were thoroughly disappointed. Most cafes, when they see a dissatisfied customer just re do it. I wish they'd have redone it. We paid $8 for 2 coffee and eventually shoved it down the trash can. It spoilt my mood and I'd contemplate again if I wanted to visit ANY other Philz coffee again.
author: Meena C.

description:
Love.  That sums up my sentiments for this place.  This location in particular - the best of all Philz (also the original).  There's always a line when we pop in (at a minimum my husband and I stop in on Fridays for a coffee on our way to work, and many times on Saturday or Sunday morning as well) - but the line moves pretty quickly.  Plus, all of the employees behind the counter are super nice, and interact with the customers.  So you don't feel bad waiting (particularly once you have that cup of joe in your hand!)

I just tried the donuts this location has to offer this weekend - I tried the yellow and purple donuts, I think they were lemon poppyseed and blueberry.  Both were delicious cake donuts with a thick icing on top.  I preferred the lemon poppyseed one as it had more flavor - I wasn't picking up much blueberry (or other fruit flavor) on the other one, but both were still fantastic.  Will definitely be getting these baked goods again!
author: Rachael S.

description: I have loved Philz Coffee for years. All the coffee is so tasty, much more smooth and flavorful than at other places. I can drink Sumatra all day long, esp since it's decaf. Jonathan the barista is the best; so friendly and gets my order right every time. My favorite cafe!
author: Jason J.

description: I have always heard good things about Philz Coffee and never got a chance to try it until today. It really did have a coffee house type of feel when you entered. The girl who took my order was really helpful with giving me recommendations because I am not a huge coffee fan. Overall the experience was good. Still not a huge fan of coffee, but definitely would bring my coffee loving friends here
author: Deedee C.

description:
This place is not for me.  You can't add your own amounts of cream & sugar, the baristas do it for you.  But if you like coffee with way more sugar than you want, or if you like mint in your coffee, then you might enjoy this place. 
And the lines are interminable.
author: David S.

description: Seriously the best coffee I ever had. I usually go for black coffee, but I couldn't turn down the iced lattes here. I had two in one visit, it was that good. I loved the novelty of the mint mojito drink. I don't even like mint in my food or drinks but I couldn't get enough of their mint mojito. I had to come back to Philz almost every day during my trip to try a new drink. I still think about it when I try lattes from other cafes, but really nothing compares.
author: Jenny X.

description:
As the reigning duchess of Philz Coffee Castro, I'm shocked that I haven't written a review. Philz basically turned me into a coffee drinker. It started with a Mint Mojito Iced Coffee back in 2007 when we moved to the neighborhood. Perfectly innocent. I was doing my laundry and needed a refreshing beverage. Soon, we were asking the baristas advice on the best variety to fresh press at home and visiting them one a day, sometimes twice on weekends. 

I'm a bit strange in that I basically only drink iced coffee these days as hot coffee tends to make me sleepy, so their Ecstatic Iced Coffee or Mint Mojito Iced rock my world. Whenever I'm sick I get the Istanbul Treat which is basically a combo of green/black teas that they serve up with honey, mint and cream and it's instant comfort.

I'm nervous for their big move around the corner to Castro, but excited that they'll have more space to work.

Oh and pro tips:
-This coffee is strong. Until I got used to it, it would make me jittery!
-Trust the baristas, they know their stuff and they can recommend something to your tastes, even if you know nothing about coffee.
-The have dog treats by the register. My dog's name is Audrey and she will sit if you offer her one.
-order on the right, pay on the left, get out of the way
-Yes, you want the mint (but don't put your grubby hands on it yourself)
author: Nikki M.

description: I have never had such rude service at Philz before. This was my first encounter with everything going wrong. Why? I honestly don't know. I normally have good intentions when going in. I understand it was about 6-7am or so but there was no need for that. This women was 5'2/3', Caucasian, short hair, and was wearing a beany. I walked in told her her what I wanted and mentioned that I wanted light ice. She then explained to me that the estatic is really hot so it will melt the ice. So i replied, light ice?" And she had this attitude and said never mind..... really? She then continues to make my drink and adds a bunch of ice and it was so watered down. I explained, it was water down and she asks "you want me to remake the drink?" And again with an attitude. Uh, yes. It taste gross! I've been to the one on gilman in Berkeley but never had that problem on a weekly. When paying $5.50 I expect the service to be awesome and it's Philz Coffee. I honestly don't know what was wrong with her this morning, but she needs to change her attitude. I ended up not drinking my coffee because I'd rather write a review  then have her remake it for the 3rd time.
author: Mouang S.

description:
Philz Coffee is hands down a legend in San Francisco, and this Castro location is my favorite amongst all the stores in the bay. Not only is the coffee fresh and top-notch, but the convenient location and friendly staff really seal the deal for me. 

The favorites? Mint Mojito Iced coffee which is packed to the brim with fresh mint leaves, giving it a crisp and aromatic taste, and the Mocha Tesora. Others that you might want to try? Gingerbread Iced Coffee and the Philharmonic. They're all packed with flavor, aren't watered down and give you that jolt of energy only good coffee can provide. 

A note, however. The iced coffees are decadent, sweet and quite creamy. I typically order mine with almond milk and cut the sweetness by asking for it "lightly sweetened" which helps bring out the natural coffee flavor a bit more but still enjoying everything the mint mojito promises
author: Jay P.

description: I love the coffee, mint mojito is awesome!!! Friendly staff, not a lot of sit space inside though.
author: Ramin A.

description:
One of our favorite coffee shop, along with some other Phylz locations ;)

Great Chai, one of the few places that does it from scratch without sugar... Great hot chocolate too, without sugar and with almond milk is the best! 

Also great coffees according to my wife who is the coffee pro, but I love their mocha for sure!

Great service/atmosphere!
author: Laurent C.

description:
15.10.12.  FIRST visit at new location!!!

This ACTUALLY relocation

BEAUTIFUL

The old tiny place was on 18th

Large  wide foldable window
  Bug comes in at nite
  Attracted by light
  Should get bug screen 

No need to talk about drinks ...
  Same great hand crafted ...
author: S.K. Y.

description:
I love Philz in Palo Alto, South San Francisco, and Cupertino, so I knew this would be no different. The store is a bit dark and on the small side - four or five tables inside and two or three tables outside. There's on outlet close to the window, so if you're staying long, make sure you charge your electronics!

We wanted to get the Mint Mojitos, but the barista mentioned that they are almost out of mint, so he'd rather make us something that was top quality. Way to be upfront and honest! My friend got the Iced Mocha, and I got the Gingersnap Iced Coffee. I always get half sweet/cream so it's not too *sweet*. Both drinks were delicious!
author: Christine S.

description: Love Philz coffee. We had the cold chocolate caramel something which was perfect.  Bad form and I found it quite convenient for the owners or managers to have the bathroom out of order on Pride Sunday.  This should not have been acceptable.
author: Grace G.

description: Good coffee, great staff - not sure if the cream they use is super healthy ...but who cares as long as it tastes great!
author: Naja P.

description:
Mint Mojito iced coffees are the best. I'm sure there's other good coffee here, but that's all I've ever gotten because they are so good.

Normally a big fan of their breakfast burritos, but ordering food at Philz Castro can be a rough experience. The burritos always come out tasty, but there seems something off with the process.

Today I ordered 2 burritos. There's no where good to stand and wait for food, especially on busy days. 

When I and another person stood in the wrong part of the "food waiting area" - again this is imaginary, there is no clear place to wait for food - we got chided.

When they called out "Jeremy" for two burritos, I stood up. When the cashier handed the burritos to someone else, who'd ordered after me, I was confused and probably looked annoyed. 

The cashier told me I needed to wait, then turned around and muttered loudly enough for me to hear her let out a frustrated, "Jesus Christ."

I get it's busy. I'm sure I'm an annoying person when I'm frustrated. It's also not fair of me to expect a busy person to recognize that I have the same name as another person with a similar order. But waiting 20 minutes for fast food, watching people behind you get the same food earlier, and then get mildly cursed out and then scowled at when I'm handed my food ... was not the most fun experience.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Amazing coffee shop! I'd totally go again. 1000% recommended. It was a little overcrowded though.
author: Maureen B.

description:
Here's the thing:  If you prefer to drink ESPRESSO beverages, Philz is NOT your coffee joint!  They do American-style coffee, not espresso. 

And don't let the friendly baristas try to convince you that they can make you something that approximates a latte, because they can't.  It will taste like regular ol' joe with milk.  Not a latte, nothing like that.

And should you make the mistake of asking them to make you that "latte-ish" beverage iced?

It will taste watery.  Boo.

I would give Philz one star for having lured me in with the promise of something they couldn't really deliver...but they were so nice, and the beverages my friends got were apparently lovely, so three stars it is!

But seriously?  If you want a real latte, head across the street to Reveille.
author: Amy L.

description: Great coffee, but best part is the friendly staff. When I'm not all there yet and need my coffee, they're very patient with me. :)
author: Sumilu C.

description:
For 8 years now, I've been drinking Ambrosia. When I feel like I need a little more of a pick-me-up, I add some mint. There just really is no better pour-over coffee around.

One of my favorite things about this place is that the baristas really seem to care. They ask you to take a sip of your coffee before you head out, to make sure it's perfect. And if it's not, they'll work to fix it.
author: Mariko F.

description: I have been wanting to try Philz for the longest time. Had the Silken Splendor and it tasted just as described (dark chocolate, nutty, butter)...it was the perfect coffee blend! Philz Coffee is brilliant and unique unlike other coffee shops where they brew one cup at a time. Will return again soon!
author: Anna G.

description: Finding a bad Philz location is like finding a purple unicorn while good Philz are like blue unicorns. Sorry, this mint mojito is like crack. And if you're in the Castro district and reading this review, there's a good chance that you know what I'm talking about. I digress. Philz is the closest thing to a drug that you can buy in the Castro. I'd tell you to ask my friends but they've been strung out on it for months. Or is it years? I've lost track of time.
author: Joshua F.

description:
Staff ok. Great location.  Too many Borgs sitting working while nursing an empty coffee cup
While real customers look for seating.  Coffee ok. Prefer my coffee wth a conversation.
author: Michael D.

description:
great place to stop and rest
nice selection of coffee
author: Melissa F.

description:
This is the most snobbish coffee place I've been to. They ONLY do  single drip.

Instructions:
1. Enter - quietly. 
2. Stay behind the red line till called to place your order at the counter . Don't talk to us unless spoken to.
3. Order one of ~18 different blends of coffee - large or small (don't use # ounces).
4. Don't EVER order latte, tall, vente, or use any "Starbucks" words.
5. Wait 10 min till your type of coffee is called by blend (even if you can't remember what it was) before approaching the counter again (they can't be bothered with your name).
6. Don't EVER go up to ask if it's ready yet. 
7. Quietly and meekly sip your coffee and don't ask questions. 
8. Leave quietly.

On the plus side the coffee tasted good.
author: Larry R.

description:
Love this place, and there is finally Wi-Fi :-D
The coffee is literally AMAZING

The pastries are very yummylicious but they are just a bit too expensive, but hey any coffee shop these days has way overpriced shizz

They open at 6 which is perfect to me. Flirty peoples behind the counter...
author: Styn V.

description:
I wish they have Philz Coffee in Las Vegas.

Philz can you make Philz Coffee a franchise?

This location has lines that go around the block.
author: Shenni C.

description: Best coffee hands down. Each cup is made to order and fresh tasting. My favorites are the philharmonic, tesoro and the iced mojito! All so good
author: Alex S.

description: The location and the atmosphere of this please are great. It's so cozy inside. The service and the baristas were awesome. However this location makes the mint mojito very bitter. On 2 occasions, I'm not sure why they can't make it as the rest of the branches. If I come back to this location again, I would order regular black coffee.
author: Ahmad A.

description: Never disappoints me. I really enjoy their coffee. Mint mojito iced coffee is good. I also like their Jacobs Wonderbar.
author: Young Y.

description:
After my updated review of  Philz 18th St. Castro location of "not so welcoming experience," I was shortly contacted by Mgr. Lily who was so kind to invite me to have coffee with Phil to further discuss what happened.  So for this reason, I am bumping my two stars to three and hope that Philz remain true to their mission which says:  

---- "Our Mission is to better people's day. We take this seriously and believe we have a very important job. Customers take time out of their day to visit us; this is very valuable to us and we are humbled by it. This gives us the opportunity to make a positive impact on our customer's day. We do this by serving an amazing cup of coffee and delivering really great customer service. When this happens, our hope is that customers leave the Philz experience happier. We believe happy people are contagious, and the more happy people in the world the happier the world is. While we may not be able to make the world happy at once, we are determined to do it one community, one cup at a time."
author: Edwin R.

description:
Hmmmmm upon reading these reviews I'm thinking I'll definitely have to head back and give this place a second chance. I was so tempted to get the mint mojito iced coffee and now I know I should've! Instead I got a plain regular iced coffee. Very plain in taste, nothing to special in my humble barista experience. I would've preferred a darker roast with all that cream and ice. It really wasn't that special for a whopping $5 something or whatever it is. 

One thing I'd really like to know is if that Jamaican Blue Mountain Coffee is authentic..a fellow barista told me its the best dam coffee in the world but nearly impossible to find the authentic thing. If anyone has tried it and can vouch for it please let me know. I'm a little hesitant to pay $10 for a large coffee if I'm gonna be as disappointed.
author: Deanna W.

description: I moved from SF in 2008 and don't recall this being there at all!  I was visiting and took my boyfriend to see the Castro before heading over to Dolores Park. I had stop for a coffee here for I was dragging. I got a donut, which looked good, but really it wasn't that good...ah well. The coffee though is the best I've had! The guy who was waiting on me was really friendly too and kind...and i appreciated that!   This place is awesome!!
author: Selena N.

description: Super excited to discover a Philz on 18th Street in the Castro...came here on the urgent request of my sister who lives in NY and is a complete Philz Coffee fanatic- she cannot get enough when she comes out to visit. Purchased two bags of coffee with ease...even took the suggestion of a new coffee purchase from the barista.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
Delicious coffee. Kouign Amann was ordered slightly heated. This resulted in the pastry sticking to the napkin it was picked up with. 
The Kouign Amann was delicious with the exception of the napkin bits stuck to the bottom.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Philz Coffee has been raved about by my SF peers. 

My eyes have been opened and I must applaud this chain for its iced mojito and ginger snaps coffee drinks. Quite innovative and delicious.
author: Tunaidi A.

description:
My first time at Philz and I am beyondddd in disbelief of how amazing this place is. The hype is definitely real lol. Staff here are very welcoming and genuine. Minimal seating indoor and outdoor but no biggie. 
I ordered the iced mint mojito coffee and it's definitely something different and worth trying.  It tasted like absolute perfection. You could really taste the richness of the coffee as well as a kick of mint. It's kinda hard to explain but yeah.... SOO glad they're bringing Philz to SoCal!!
author: Diana T.

description: I've been to at least five other Philz Coffee locations in my life, and it has taken me years to finally end up at the Castro one. This is absolutely my favorite one, not because of the abstract art around the room, but because of the service that embodies everything Philz is about. There are two coffee stations, so it might take a little longer to get your beverage, but there are tables inside and on the patio for you to wait. This is also where I learned what "Philz Way" means... medium sugar and medium cream. Did you know that?
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Tank (hot, burly ginger with beard and cool piercings) is the best thing ever.
So attentive, so sweet and not overbearing whatsoever.  I go in there just to see this delightful human being and to feel his love and warmth, along with his consummate professionalism and service.  He truly make the BEST Tesora in the entire SF Bay.
author: Susie S.

description:
Thank you to former Atlanta OG Yelper Lauren S. (http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=wwsTBKSWhtE2rc1alEkyJA) for introducing me to Philz Coffee in San Francisco.  I'm no coffee connoisseur, but I can tell this place serves some great coffee.  Not only that, but the service is phenomenal.  I was originally going to rate this shop four stars, but Jerry's outstanding service bumped it up to five.

Philz Coffee has over a dozen locations in the Bay Area including one at Facebook's headquarters.  The original Philz Coffee location is in the Mission.  This location in the Castro is, oddly enough, connected to a laundromat.

Each cup at Philz is individually hand-prepared using hot water and coffee that's filtered directly into each cup.  The coffee at this small chain is the result of many years of research by Phil himself.  At the Castro location, I counted six dark roasts, eight medium roasts, four light roasts, and five decaf coffee blends on the menu.  There are also other caffeinated beverages and tea (e.g. black, green, chamomile, etc.).  The coffee cups come in two sizes: small ($3) and large ($4).  You can also buy a pound of bagged coffee for $16.

There are a multitude of coffee variations.  Fortunately, the menu is easy to read.  The blends have creative, sometimes funky names, but the descriptions are spot on, so I'd start there (at the descriptions).  If you're still having trouble deciding on what cup of coffee to get, the workers are very good at asking you questions to find your personal preferences/tastes and then recommending you an appropriate coffee.

I was recommended the SwissWater Peru, the flavors of which are described as cedar, earthy, and smoky.  It fit the bill and was enjoyable and refreshing.  I was happy.

At one point, someone in our party accidentally burnt themselves with spilt coffee.  Jerry came over and offered some burn cream/ointment, the same one the employees use.  That was really nice of him.

Philz is a small, hippie coffee shop with very limited seating inside and out.  I estimate there's only enough seating inside for 10 people, maybe less outside on the sidewalk patio.  Free Wi-Fi is available.  The coffee shop shares a restroom with the attached laundromat.  If you want to use the restroom, you have to pick up a plastic flower watering can that looks like an elephant.  The restroom key is attached to it.  It's funny and awkward, which is the point.

So, many thanks to Jerry and roommate Matthew (I hope I didn't get them mixed up) for being such cool and friendly hosts and welcoming us into the shop.
author: Daniel B.

description: One of my favorite coffee places in the Bay Area. Got two filtered souls, with cream and sugar, cost $6. Smooth and creamy and delicious. Their coffee is like crack without the jitters. The two baristas are super friendly. They have about 5 small tables inside. Nice place to just chill and relax, read a book, and meet all the fabulous and interesting people in Castro.
author: Cherry D.

description: Heard Philz name, passed a couple of Financial District locations and finally stopped at the Castro location following an F line ride. Did NOT know it was almost exclusively a pour-over business. But, had plenty of time and sprang for the Tesora recommended in reviews. Applaud the baristas' good cheer and expertise but the brew was lighter than expected and lacked distinctive taste until too cool to enjoy.
author: Bruce B.

description:
This place was great! I heard about it on yelp (where else) and decided to check it out. The employees were very helpful. Plus they have a large selection of milks! (Almond milk is hard to find at cafes!) 

I had the mint mojito iced coffee and loved it! 

I got it with a little less sweetener and it was perfect. 

The only thing is the bathroom was dirty (yuck) and for some reason their iced drinks are served in the regular hot coffee cups... I really prefer a nice plastic cup for my iced coffee! But it tasted fantastic and that's what really matters.
author: Kayla N.

description: Ummm this place is amazing.  Philz, can you come to NYC please?? I started with their Mint Mojito iced coffee and was immediately hooked.  Had to have Philz every day while we were in SF and multiple times a day.  I mean, their mint mojito iced coffee has ACTUAL MINT LEAVES. (Mind Blown).  And don't get me started on the Mocha Tesora - if you like chocolate even a little bit... its at least worth a try.  No sugar necessary!!  I tried some of other regular blends but those 2 were the standouts for me.  Counting down the days when Philz will re-enter my life....
author: Anu K.

description: The coffee here is awesome and pure. The customer service is top notch. We were given individual recommendations be Steve and it was much appreciated. Teresa also was super helpful and upbeat. Thx so much!
author: Christina F.

description:
I've been a loyal customer since I moved to San Francisco. I've always had a great experience until today.  I stopped in this morning around 815-820 and ordered a large Silken Splendor, medium sweet.  Went to pay and waited like normal. At 833, I walked up to the young lady I gave my order to and she asked if I ordered the black coffee.  I told her no, that I ordered a large silken splendor medium sweet. She says to me that my coffee is ready. I asked her if that's what they normally call the Silken Splendor and she said yes. In addition to that, she didn't even make it medium sweet. 
I would have spoken to someone there but I had a longer wait because I was unfamiliar with the new method of calling out coffee drinks already made me late to my MBA class, which resulted in having to spend more money to have to get to SFSU downtown less later.
I spent more than I wanted on just a coffee. I received poor service and I don't even know if she actually made the right coffee...in fact it wasn't the Silken Splendor, medium sweet that I normally have. Ugh. Philz.
author: Perry P.

description:
WHOA! I had no idea they moved from 18th street to Castro! This location is a beaut. It is way bigger than the original location and more patron friendly. They have outdoor and indoor seating, and it also looks like they *may* have an order ahead option. (At least that is what it looked like.)

If you're in the area and want a nice cup of (strong) Joe. I would stop by Philz Castro!
author: Melissa S.

description:
Nice little spot with great and lovely baristas.
I got a mint mojito ice coffee and it was sooo goid and refreshing!
author: Natan G.

description:
Friendly barista, good strong coffee.

I would recommend Jacobs wonderbar, philtered soul and mint mojito are all good choices.
author: G C.

description:
Drip coffee to perfection.

Philz does a great job of balancing all the right tones and flavors, so I shouldn't be surprised that my mint mojito iced coffee last week was just what I wanted. I asked for less sweetness because I didn't want to be left parched, and it lasted me a good two hours while I set out to do a little work.

A couple notes about this location: Wifi is great and stable. Outdoor seating is a great option, but because it's in the shade, make sure the temperature is hot enough or bring a blanket. The bathroom is actually located in the laundromat.
author: Ben W.

description: This is the location where I first found Philz and subsequently fell in obsessive love. Location is tiny but don't let that steer you away. The folks are always friendly, happy to help. I went basic bitch and got the mint mojito - it is absolutely delicious but almost everyone who comes here gets it. They a lot more than just this drink; I highly recommend an iced Philtered Soul when it's warm out. To die for.
author: Autumn Y.

description:
Alright, alright, Philz. You win THIS round of SoCal v. NorCal. I'm dreaming about my Mint Mojito RIGHT NOW as I'm sitting on a bus back down to Los Angeles. 

SO legit that a healthy amount of mint sprigs were chilling in my cup, surrounded by coffee and ice goodness. So refreshing! 

Ugh, I want one RIGHT NOW. 

Awesome staff, awesome little shop, awesome that they customize each drink and have their own set of beans. Just awesome, awesome, awesome. 

See you when I come back!
author: Kathleen T.

description: The barista took the time to explain how Philz coffee is made and how it's different from traditional espressos and coffee drinks. She explained the different kinds and customized my coffee for me. Then the manager, Michael, offered me some free coffee made to train employees. I offered to take them to the nearby dog groomer employees and he loved that. When I told him I was an author and looking to have a small gathering, he said he'd take good care of us even though the store was small and busy. Delightful product and wonderful people!
author: Toby N.

description: Love the iced mint mojito, I always get one when I come visit from LA. Staff is always super cool too. Will always come back. :)
author: Andrew M.

description:
Everyone always hypes about this place, so I guess I'm part of it now! The interior for this particular location is very hipster. There are chairs and tables around and a bench along the wall while you wait for your order. 

The drinks:
Overall, all of the drinks had great flavor! You can definitely taste the yummy coffee or espresso in the drink. 

DANCING WATER. This was my favorite drink! It had a nutty chocolate flavor to it and was very tasty. It wasn't overly sweet and you can taste the medium roast coffee. I would recommend this drink for sure! 

MINT MOJITO. This one was also very good and different from drinks I've tried. You get a kick of the mint flavor. It's interesting, so if you want to try something different, I would get this one. 

The person making our drinks was really awesome! I wish I caught his name. He made great conversation with our ridiculous order (we ordered 4 drinks and didn't know what we wanted. I was ask on the phone trying to get an order (sorry that was rude of me) but he was very kind. He also let us taste the drinks to see if it was sweet enough! Super cool 

The price was very reasonable too! $3 for a small and $4 for a large. (More or less depending on the drink). 

**AWESOME NOTE: bring your own thermos and you pay for a small!! Awesome. Great way to promote reduce, reuse, recycle. Love it! 

Come try and get on this band wagon cause it's definitely worth it!
author: Samantha N.

description: Best way to start the morning... The team is awesome very friendly.. Ambiance is welcoming. It's a busy place but you don't feel rushed.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I've first experienced Philz in Downtown SJ. I've been craving it since. Today, I was in SF and decided to stop in with my friend. She bought us drinks while I waited in the car (since there was no immediate parking). 

She got me the Mojito, which is what they're known for I guess. It was exactly as I remembered. A bit on the sweet side, but let the ice water it down just a hint, and it balances out nicely. 

I don't enjoy drinking coffee, but I'll have a mojito from Philz!
author: Kaje Y.

description: I love this Philz. Highlights: great tunes, super friendly people, solid amount of seating, and of course, delicious coffee.
author: Emily R.

description:
What can I say? Philz is just a staple for anyone who lives in the SF Bay Area. My biggest dilemma here: choosing between Mocha Tessora or Mint Mojito. I order both without sugar, and they are just amazing!

This Philz is new -- it moved from a couple blocks away on 18th -- and is gorgeous. There's ample seating both inside and outside, the staff is wonderful, and like every other Philz I've been too, it's incredibly clean.

I am a huge supporter of Philz Coffee, and I must say that I am in love with the striped rainbow walkway that guides the line! It's a beautiful touch for the Castro location (just like the crosswalks at 18th/Castro)!
author: Mike D.

description:
Update 10/22, the second time I've been since reno - used to be almost every day.  One of the oft-cited defenses for relocation was because the line got so long in the small store; here you have more stations, and a longer line than I ever saw at the other place! Musak playing doesn't help! And the beautiful mint "bouquets" have not returned. Then there's the planning that didnt happen with the sidewalk seating, resulting in neighbor complaints that pushed a reconfiguration. After a long wait my coffee was handed to me with a lid so no time to adjust, not cool!  So it seems you didn't know what you had! Please learn from this and ask customers for feedback before your next renovation, to guide new installations as well !



Oh Phil, love the coffee and the baristas, but why oh why did you lose the intimate, quiet feel in your new location? It's big, sterile and loud; with those acoustics anything but quiet background music is painful. Also would be helpful if you could get a couple of dedicated free parking spots outside as you had at the other location. Your store design aesthetic is going in the wrong direction, IMHO, bring back the unique, cozy, neighborhood cafe feel, please!
author: Teresa M.

description: New location is nice big and airy with nice view of cute baristas and fun birthday boys that dance to Christina Aguillara music! That's the best way to start the day. And of course the best mint mojito. Yum yum
author: Karen T.

description: I know my taste buds are not fun of  mint  flavored  food, they just don't taste  right for me. But  Philz Coffee's Mint mojito is an exception. Its sweetness, the caffeine, cool in mouth.  So refreshing making it so addictive.  That is how  mint flavored  coffee drink should taste like.  Now I'm a fan.
author: Shirley W.

description: Terrible service.  Coffee was good as usual but the service was awful - two young girls who weren't into serving their public.  I won't be going back here again.
author: Maile N.

description:
-- 11/100 reviews for 2016 -
Can you honestly hate me for loving this location better than the Santa Monica location back at home? I'm in love with the vibes and location at this Philz Coffee.

Sad to say, I am NOT a coffee lover but i would never pass up a Mint Mojito iced coffee. it's so creamy and I would drive it to the last drop!

Staffs were all friendly and I would love to try their pastries and baked goods if I have the stomach to whenever I stop by a Philz coffee. If there are any recommendations for non-coffee lovers or nothing too strong in coffee flavors, please let me know!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Who could say no to Philz?

I was in the area and there was a Philz nearby, so I decided to grab a cup of joe.

The barista was exceptional. I couldn't decide what I wanted. The last time I had coffee at 4 pm, I couldn't sleep for the rest of the night and had to go to work like a walking zombie. The barista told me that the darker the roast the less caffeine. The philtered soul and the mint mojito are a couple of my favorites. This time I decided to give Jacobs Wonderbar a try. I got no cream and just a little sugar with it. It was delicious! Just what I needed. The barista even asked how it was and was very willing to add more sugar or cream if I needed any.

Great experience at this location with awesome baristas.

P.S they do have a bathroom, it's back in the laundromat. You just have to grab the key attached to the giant elephant watering can.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Went on a Tuesday afternoon, every seat was occupied by keyboard warriors who believe their $4 coffee entitles to them to hours of a coworking environment complete with free wifi and power. It would be nice if there was actually space for others to enjoy their tea and pastries for 5 minutes.
author: Derek I.

description:
I write this as a review for all Philz locations as it's a growing local chain:

Best. Coffee. Ever.

Not inexpensive. But the quality makes it a nice treat.
author: Shannon V.

description: I know that Philz bro. The coffee here gives me good feelings in the morning, which rarely happens to this night owl. They have magical formulas here that will jolt you awake and other sweet brews to slowly bring you to the land of the living. Order first, pay, and sip.
author: Alexander W.

description: So I cheated on Blue Bottle and came here to try the Gingersnap Iced Coffee. Interesting flavor that  I really enjoyed. I was with friends and also took sips of various other drinks, everything was delicious. Will definitely come back here upon every visit to the Castro!
author: Hugo C.

description:
If you live in the Castro and don't know Philz then you're either indifferent to coffee or you're an out-of-towner, staying in an Airbnb. Either way, I have one advice for you my friend: get out of your sticky, small apartment, onto the streets of San Francisco, and get an education from the ground up. 

On coffee. 
Good coffee. 
Probably the best coffee you'll ever taste. 

And then tell me again that where you are from the coffee is so much better and you always go to Starbucks and they know how to do it and stuff. Go away. THIS is your coffee. This is Philz. This is San Francisco. And this is the Castro.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Oh Philz, why are you not in NYC?
During my visit to San Francisco, I was strongly recommended to try Philz; I was skeptical, I didn't believe in the magic of Philz. But after an afternoon hiking Twin Peaks, a relaxing cup of iced coffee before dinner seemed like a great idea-and it was. 
One sip of the mint mojito iced coffee and I was a goner. Everything was perfect - sweetness, mint-iness, coffee acidity. This drink is perfection. My only regret is that I didn't visit Philz earlier before I flew back to NYC. Wait for me, I will be back :')

The mint mojito iced coffee is definitely a drink you have to try if you go to Philz!
author: Helen L.

description:
If there's an omnipotent ruler to all of coffee, it must be Philz.

It was love at fist taste when I had my first cup of my staple order, Jacob's Wonder Bar Brew (sweet and creamy) - bold, earthy and has a punch. I've always described it as "heart palpitation" coffee. 

Just thinking of it makes me want to have one right now... and it's 11:16pm right now, mind you! hahaha

honorable mention: Ambrosia and Mint Mojito
author: Jan R.

description:
Always great for a drop by for some coffee if you need it. Quick service, small location area. Not that much seating. 

I'm overall not the coffee drinker but every chance I get I'll drop by for a mint mojito. It's yummy, cold, and for those who don't like the taste of ground coffee you don't really taste it.
author: Corie L.

description:
Broke. 

As I was washing my hair this morning with my Bumble & Bumble shampoo, I couldn't help but wonder, what can I do to save money? 

Guess I can cut down on my going out? 

Hmm... maybe. I slather on my Rhonda Allyson moisturizer and sunscreen, while listening to Madonna on my iPhone 4. 

Maybe I can cut down on my shopping? 

But as I stood there in front of my closet, thinking "I don't have anything to wear!"  I can't cut down on shopping! I hate my life. So, I grab the first thing I see, my $80 anthropologie top (it was on sale!), paired that with my $70 Express slim fit jeans and pulled on my $160 Enzo Angiolini boots. 

I know! I should set a budget and give myself an allowance every week. Is $200 spending money enough? Oh gawd, brunching alone is already $40 - $50. Not to mention, my weekly Nopa late night eats.

* rides Muni to the Castro * 

Ugh, I hate Muni! but I saved money by not taking a cab right? that could've easily been $10.

Shoot. Don't know why I'm sooo tired today. I need an energy boost. 

Philz! Philz!  woohoo! Rarely do I need coffee, but when I do, I'm really picky about it. Four Barrel is the shit! Blue Bottle is great too. I'll NEVER drink that crappy coffee at work even though it's free. Puh-lease.

"Can I get a small iced mint mojito coffee please?"

This is so delicious, especially on a warm day like today. Handcrafted, one cup at a time, with cream and sugar, on the sweet side. I love the generous amount of mint leaves in my coffee cup, it's absolutely refreshing. 

I think I should just start packing my lunch to work. There's no way I'm giving up Philz after having this cup. $4 mint mojito coffee is way cheaper than buying lunch at the cafe, even if I make this a habit everyday, I'll still only spend $20 per week. Well ok, $25 because I HAVE to tip! the baristas at this location are super nice and so friendly!

Yup. Waaay cheaper. Not to mention, totally worth it.

* Slings Michael Kors bag over the shoulder and walks out into the glorious SF sunshine *
author: Janice C.

description: It's all about 2 words: Philtered Soul. My boyfriend and I are one of their biggest fans. All of the branches that we've been to so far are amazing, like the one on 24th Street or the one close to ATT park. And if you drop by here, don't forget, it's all about their coffees, not the pastries. So don't expect to get very good quality pastries from here, but the coffee, I have to say, is nothing short of amazing.
author: Mina R.

description:
Meh. Not a fan.  I love a simple cup of Joe. None of that bs flavoring. Trendy, overrated, over priced. (Late post: 06/07/15)

I'd like to add though, over my shoulder, a snooty stranger, wannabe coffee drinker, blurted out that light brew has more caffeine.  Apparently he hasn't done his homework.

Common Misconception:

Light Roasted coffee has more/less caffeine than Dark Roasted coffee.

There are a couple of dueling misconceptions about light roasted coffee concerning the caffeine content. Coffee drinkers weened on the specialty coffee of the 1970's and the famous oily black beans of the era, tend to believe that Dark Roasted coffee packs more punch. Indeed it may from a perspective of pure intensity, but that doesn't mean it carries more caffeine. Then there are those who have come of age in the Third Wave of coffee and are happy to report that in fact Light Roasted coffee has more caffeine since dark roasting burns out all the go-juice.
