The truth is, however, that the caffeine content in one coffee "bean" is the same no matter if it is Light or Dark roasted. The difference in caffeine content comes from the volume of coffee used when brewing. Light Roasted beans are SMALLER than their Dark Roasted counterparts because their cellular fibers haven't been blown apart and expanded. So if you measure your coffee using a scoop, then yes, you're getting more caffeine when you used a Light Roast because more beans can fit in that scoop. However, if you weigh your coffee (like most coffee pros) the caffeine content should be the same.
author: Mia Z.

description:
I'm back in visiting San Francisco and I always find myself visiting this famous coffee shop. 
What makes this place so special and unique?

Jacob Wonderbar and  Philitered Soul are my favorite coffee blends. I love that the barista makes sure that you love your drink before you take it. 

Of course, their infamous Mint Mojito coffee. It is a tad bit too sweet for me, but this is everyone's must try drink here.
author: Lei L.

description:
Employees ask for feedback and cared that I loved my drink. They were helpful, kind and patient even with a line to the door. 

My mint mojito iced coffee was perrrrfect  

Location is small with 4 tables inside and 3 outside. Though the line was long, I still managed to get a seat.
author: Monica R.

description: Every Philz taste different.  They're all good, but not always consistent. This location was is my favorite, and taste THE BEST out of all the ones I've been to.  The staff is also AMAZING.  If this isn't out of your way, head here for your Philz craving!
author: Christine L.

description:
After walking to their previous location, I had a moment of panic and was afraid the Castro Philz coffee had closed.  Thankfully, I quickly learned they had just moved to a new location.

The coffee is still the same.  Proprietary blends with descriptions of flavour.  Philz way for coffee (the default) is with cream and sugar.  Normally, I turn my nose up at coffee that tastes like candy (or I use lots of sugar and cream to make the coffee palatable), but here it seems like a perfectly normal thing to do.

The hipster staff are still the same as the old place, and friendly as ever.  Also quite competent.

The one thing I don't love is the new space.  It feels more like a cold stone creamery than a local coffee chain.  All of the dive characteristics and frankly character of the old place are missing, and the new setting is rather clinical.
author: Ian P.

description: After reading positive reviews, my fiancé and I went in to try this place out. We were excited by all the different coffee choices and were trying to make sense of the menu. Unfortunately, the barista at the counter was so rude to us before we even had a chance to order that we ended up walking out and getting our coffee elsewhere.
author: Elana R.

description:
I wanted a cup of iced coffee one day, so I tried Philz. I was confused about how to order and I already knew I wanted the infamous mojito ice coffee but the barista answered my questions quickly and fully. I told him I wanted the mojito ice coffee and the mojito iced coffee was what I got.

Ice, coffee and mint leaves. The drink was very refreshing for a warm day and was just sweet enough that I could taste the coffee.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Elixir for the gods. The coffee is so smooth. Mint mojito for a hot day, a good solid cup of the Tesora for the cold days. I raved so much about this coffee to my bf he bought me a Philz gift card for xmas. He da best.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Came here while visiting San Francisco with a friend. He recommended I get the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. It was disappointing at first to hear that there was no alcohol in it but delightfully surprised how good the combination of mint with coffee was.

The cool thing about this drink is that you can chose the milk type you want, the level of sweetness and of course the size. 

The SF location is small, so there is no place to sit as this place is packed. More of a to-go place unless you are lucky and can snag a seat.Philz is very popular so expect a line, especially in their SF location.
author: Laura B.

description: We walked into the cafe and walked over to the girl to order. She immediately tells us to wait at the "cloud" when there was no line and talked to us like we were children. There is no need to be rude. All she had to say was wait and we will help you when you are free
author: Alex D.

description: Trendy and comfortable.  Excellent and friendly service.  Coffee just so-so especially if you enjoy it black.  Loud music.  Lots of noisy customers and workers.  Fun to people-watch.  I'll go back when I'm in the neighborhood, but prefer something more sedate with better tasting black coffee.
author: R L.

description:
Mint mojito!!! I literally salivate at the thought of one!! I love mint and was recommended to Philz solely for that purpose and upon the first sip entering my mouth, I felt like I was entering a world of bliss-- my senses tingled, my eyelashes fluttered.. I was in awe!

And the quality of service was impeccable. We had the sweetest baristas who recommended drinks and explained the authenticity of the philz individual cup- style drip brewing. 

An overall magical experience!
author: Kiran G.

description: I've never felt so.... well taken care of until I received my order, which I wasn't allowed to take until I took a sip in front of the barista to give him the 'OK' that my drink was perfectly made. You'd think that with giving so much attention to one person's drink that a line would be out the door- but nopes. All the baristas are super friendly, very attentive and speedy as hell. The atmosphere of this place is very relaxed and definitely a spot I would find myself studying in. (Please open up a shop in NYC). I got the mint mojito and my boyfriend opted for the iced ginger snap. Both were so delicious and I quickly remembered why I was so eager to find a Philz location right upon landing in the west coast. This was my second time at Philz but I'm yet again counting down until the next time I can get my fix again. Thank you, lovely people for making both my experiences such a great time! I'll be back soon :)
author: Kimberly K.

description:
I've been here twice in the past week. Both because I wanted to sit and get work done with a tasty drink.

The first time was with my roommate. She had never had Philz before so I was eager to have her try it. We both got soy iced mojito coffee drinks. We both enjoyed it. We both sat to study. We both got work done. 

The second time was by myself. I was a little under the weather so I asked for a recommendation. I was told to try the Istanbul Treat which is a tea blend of green teas, black teas, anise, chai, and some other stuff I don't remember. I decided that it sounded good and gave it a shot. You can choose to have it with cream and honey, but I chose to have just a bit of honey. I figured it would be better for my throat.

The Istanbul Treat was tasty in that herby tea way. Very much like your average tea but with an added kick because of the anise and the chai. A slight sweet spiciness. It was comforting indeed. I would like to try it with cream and honey next time when I'm all better!

Love this place.
author: Sofia R.

description:
PROs: There are outdoor seats.
CONs: The location isn't that big, but you can always take the drink to-go and head to Dolores Park. The tables are a little crooked, so it can spill drinks if you accidentally rock the tables.

This was my first time at a Philz Coffee location, on Aug 11th.  I wasn't too sure what to order, but all my friends were recommending the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  It was delicious.  You definitely taste the hint of mint as well as the ice coffee.  It's not crazy strong in coffee taste, but has a kick to it.
author: Sharry P.

description: This location rocks. It is a little bit small. But that does not matter. I love all Philz Coffee location no matter what size it is. This location was not that crowed when I went here. I ordered the hot chocolate and it was good. I will come back to this location again some time.
author: Isaac H.

description: This is probably one of the best places to get coffee. Their pour over is insanely good. I had the Turkish coffee, which includes fresh mint and cardamom. While this taste combo is definitely not for everyone, it was delicious. The staff was cooky, fun and welcoming. I will be back as soon as I return to SF.
author: Storm H.

description:
Always a line but it moves quickly and the artists behind the counter are cordial, professional and knowledgeable. Don't know what you like?  They are typically very patient too!

Only thing to make the experience even better is to replace chairs outside. They're too reclined and not conducive to enjoying a hot beverage :-)
author: Philip C.

description: I usually don't understand the hype when there is one... but I understand the Philz hype. I didn't get it at first, but now I am a fan. I have been here more than a handful of times, at first I was confused and had no idea how to order, but the baristas are good at explaining, asking how do you usually like it? I like my coffee sweet and creamy. Sometimes hot, sometimes cold. I ordered the Ecstatic Iced Coffee and loved it. Also ordered the Mojito and loved that too. Became a fan after I got the Philz Bagel - cream cheese, cucumber and tomatoes. Usually that wouldn't sound appealing to me, but when I ate it, I was very much satisfied. Friendly staff. WAY BETTER THAN PEETS OR STARBUCKS OR BLUE BOTTLE OR FOUR BARRELL. lol in caps.
author: Jamie B.

description:
This place just blows me away.  Located in the Castro area, it's a small coffee shop that always has a decent amount of customers and for good reason.  As so many others have espoused, try the mint mojito coffee at least once.  The mix of flavors with coffee was unlike anything I've had and was very refreshing (the mint and coffee mix together very well).

The only other drink I've had here is the Turkish and that was also a very solid drink as well.  The flavor and depth of the drink was everything that I wanted a coffee drink to be.  It also contained mint, which as I mentioned above, just happens to mesh well with coffee for some reason.  They also serve a variety of pastries and baked goods that are made from other businesses in the area if you happen to be craving something to eat.

Anyways, this is hands down my favorite coffee place in the world right now.  We'll see if I'm able to find anything better out there some day.
author: Randy S.

description: Every experiance from San Jose, Palo Alto to San Francisco I try a new blend every time and enjoy the sweet taste everytime. I am usually adding sugar but I have yet to have to ask for more at Philz. I order creamy and extra sweet and they deliver the perfect cup. I am hooked on Philz and take the time to enjoy the coffee flavors and a little break from the fast moving pace of life.
author: A M.

description: Great cup of coffee. It was a blend of all of Philz's coffee beans called an eclectic iced coffee. It had some milk and lightly sweetened. It tasted like heaven. Nice and cold for the day. Our coffee maker Nelson was very pleasant and welcoming asking what we liked and recommending things for us. It was great and I will be back!
author: Eric V.

description:
Never have I fallen so instantly and hopelessly in love with a drink. That is, until I had a mint mojito from Philz. It was perfectly minty and sweet coffee and I wish I had ordered a larger size. The menu there is extremely extensive and I wish I lived in SF so I could sample a different drink everyday, but alas.

My only issue with Philz is that their lids don't close very well (or maybe I'm just an idiot). Either way this is a sf must visit!
author: Sally E.

description: Never had a better cup of coffee in my life! Philz house decaf blend of Ethiopian/ Sumatran =amazing. Staff so friendly and really great experience at the original site I'm Mission.
author: Kim O.

description:
oOOOoo sexy men, half naked walking their toy dogs, sipping on high quality coffee from around the world?? YES YES YES!! Talk about, "A Cup of LOVE" ... too bad they aren't paying attention to me though, but towards my guy friend next to me. 
Out of all the various Philz Coffee's, i like Castro's coffee shop. Uber unique, with cute and friendly baristas. The fun art work on the walls, stickers, and the eye candy walking around, completely make the cup of coffee in my hand tastes all that much better. 
My favorite coffee has to be the dark roast Mocha Tesora. It is their distinctively dark chocolate-inspired blend with a delightful mix of decadent cocoa. YUM!!
author: Sherry T.

description:
Ah, Philz. I've had many friends who have returned from San Francisco and/or are from the area swear by its mint iced coffee.

Coffee was good. The place is good, sets a good mood and it's in a tight hood. All in all, got some good vibes from chilling here after walking around SF and trying to stuff a ton of food in my belly. Can't wait to try it again when it opens up in Santa Monica!
author: Paul B.

description: I've gone to more coffee shops than I can remember, but Philz stands out to me because of their mint mojito iced coffee. It was damn good. I actually ordered the ginger schnapps one but I basically split it with my girlfriend's mint mojito. Get the mojito for sure, it's as good as it sounds.
author: Steven N.

description: I finally tried Philz coffee after everyone told me it's an absolute gem! I took my friends' recommendations and ordered the iced mint mojito coffee with light cream (I really like that you can specify light cream and sugar). The mint mojito tasted really fresh and delicious. The barista told me to try it and make sure I liked it before heading out, which was really nice. Cute little coffee joint in a great location (right next to Dolores Park) with some delicious options. Taking off a star because all the ice and mint leaves took up a very large portion of my drink, so there really was not that much coffee in the small size. Next time I'll get a large.
author: Rena M.

description:
I walked up to the super friendly barista and asked what I should order that I couldn't get anywhere else. She said she loved that line, and made me a mint mojito iced coffee. It was a wonderful blend of creamy, minty sweetness with a mildly bitter edge... perfect for enjoying while taking in the Castro flair.

The place itself was wonderfully casual, and gets bonus points for the easily accessible power strips secured to the underside of its table. I'll admit I was a bit sad two hours later when it was time for me to pay and leave.
author: Richard G.

description: I have never been treated so rudely in my life than today buying an iced coffee at Philz.   I think the young lady who was working the register needs a day off. She snapped the money out of my hands.....literally snapped it out of my hand.  I was confused about the ordering system...you order first and then go down to the register to pay .....what a miserable human being.....so condescending and RUDE.   I have worked in the food business for years and would never ever treat a customer the way I was treated.  All i wanted was a cup of coffee...wanted to go to Philz instead of Starbucks..... where is Blue Bottle or 4 Barrel when you need them?  They are not in the Castro that is for sure.   Shame on you.....Shame on you.....
author: Mitchell F.

description:
This is the worst Philz I have ever been to. I am a big fan of Philz in general but this place sucks. Instead of putting mint leaves, the barista put 2 bunches with stems :-(

When I took out the mint, the plant is even longer than an iPhone 6 !! Can you imagine a drink filled with the stem of mint? It tasted like soil in your drink!!  I ended up throwing away the drink!
author: Eva F.

description:
This is a general Philz Coffee review and a review specific to the 18th Street location.

For me, Philz serves the best coffee in SF, hands down. Best.

The coffee is made most tasty by the bar none customer service. The baristas in every store I've been to (SF and Sausalito) are genuine, friendly, and ask "Is your drink perfect/great/just what you wanted?" 

Pre-2013, I'd steel my nerves to get a drip coffee at an artisinal/single origin-serving coffee shop in San Francisco. Interacting with baristas and some customers was like sitting through Thanksgiving dinner or Passover. 

Not Philz though. No passive aggressiveness or aggressive aggressiveness. Just good service. 

The 18th Street store is terrific. It features local artists' works on a rotating basis on the store's walls. The baristas are sweet and authentic people, and the creepy unicorn motif (borderline fetish) is hilarious.
author: Cecilia C.

description:
I've heard so many good things about Philz and was very excited to try out their coffee. I mean I love mojitos, and I love coffee, so I knew I'd love their mint mojito coffee. Best of both worlds, right? ;)

Philz offers specialty coffee drinks and also classic brews so there is something for everyone. Their mint mojito coffee was extremely refreshing and perfect on a warm day.

This particular location is close to Dolores Park, so you can grab some coffee and relax in the park. The staff is really friendly and helpful with their suggestions! There's nothing I appreciate more than service with a smile.

Can't wait to try their other drinks!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Great coffee and good atmosphere. Just don't expect a seat. Lots of customers that will set their stuff down at a table before they go stand at the back of a 10 person line.  Happened with a full table three times in the last two weeks. They should put a sign up, but both times I've asked the customers who did it said, "well, I want a seat".
author: Taylor H.

description: Does not live up to the hype. I always hear my friends raving about how great the mint mojito is, so of course when I was nearby I had to try it. This location is pretty small with only a couple seats inside and outside. I ordered the large ice mint mojito to take with me. The drink was made fairly quickly and looked aesthetically pleasing with the mint leaves on top.  After taking my first sip, I was underwhelmed with how not "phenomenal" it was. I just thought it tasted like coffee from Starbucks. After drinking about a third of it, I just decided to give it to a friend to finish.
author: Melanie H.

description:
I don't get it. Ordering a black coffee was so difficult. 20 questions and 5 minutes later the condescending barista got on it. It reminded me of a Portlandia episode. 

Unfortunate that they are moving right in the middle of the Castro close to Spikes coffee - which is excellent and friendly mom-and-pop style. It's clear they are trying to keep a corporate appearance and make it hard for smaller businesses. 

Formula retail go away. Your Philz product is average and your customer service is severely lacking.
author: James V.

description:
ONE DRINK...Iced Mint Mojito...It's FIRE!!

I love coffee, even though i used to work at Starbucks(which sucks), this is the place where I would go get coffee. LOL

This creamy, minty, awesomely awesome Ice coffee got my coming back here all the time.  

When i worked as an Uber driver, I would come to this particular place because of the location and its more relaxed atmosphere.   

Didn't really get personal with the employees but I recommend Philz to everyone that comes to San Francisco!

I recommended it so much I had to write about it!  Which you can read below.

http://www.thealldayblog.com/the-choose-your-own-adventure-1-day-all-day-trip-guide-to-san-francisco/

For a 1 day trip in San Francisco, Philz is definitely a place to visit! 

Plus they have plenty of locations also so you can find one anywhere in the city if you look it up!

Thanks Philz Coffee for always making my day!

-Mike Le All Day!
author: Michael L.

description: I'm not sure how I haven't written a review here yet, but this is my go to coffee place on the way to work. It's a great place and very small. The staff is super nice and I always get a mint mojito as I'm sure it is many other customers' favorite drinks. There are a few of them that always remember that I always get a mint mojito. Great place. Can't complain at all.
author: Julie L.

description:
I've been lucky enough to have gotten a cup of coffee from the Philz Coffee that is predominately decorated with lovely unicorns everywhere on the inside of the shop - it made my visit THAT much more amazing!  Charmed by the unicorns, I ordered the I believe it was called the Mint Mojito?  Of course, it wasn't REALLY a mojito.  They just add a mint leaf... thus the mint mojito is born!  I got it ICED and it was perfect to sip on during that hot and sunny SF day!  I love the fresh flowers that are lined up on the sidewalk right next door to the coffee shop also.  I thought the way they displayed their pastries was interesting - inside of an old cabinet - they have vegan treats as well.  

Note: Order on the right, pay on the left
author: Allie P.

description:
Easily one of my favorite coffee shops in SF. 

I am still obsessed with their mocha tesora, but I've also had the chance to try the silken splendor and their famous mint mojito iced coffee. Both are so great! Coffee is nice and strong, keeps me wired all afternoon!
author: Elaine N.

description: Ordered a hot coffee, got a cold mint coffee. Ordered a gluten free pumpkin bread, found fungus in it. When returned, the woman on the counter instead of apologizing, said "thanks for returning". Really!! Is this how she should have reacted. And this cafe happens to be the favorite of local. Guys check before you drink or eat..............
author: Michael W.

description: I've only recently tried Philz. While I've enjoyed my 3-to-date experiences, I've also only tried one drink, the Turkish dark blend. The taste is good, especially with the added mint leaves - a practice I've started at home. And I'm totally fine with all their coffees being pour over, but I think they go too far by insisting only the barista adds sugar and cream. I drink my coffee black, so this doesn't even impact me directly, but why shouldn't a customer be allowed to add their own cream and sugar?
author: Scott L.

description: Wow. Pretty disappointed in the new location.  The place seems very disorganized.  The layout of the space is very inefficient.  There is not enough seating.  Staff are less than friendly.  I had to stand in 2 separate lines to get my ground coffee.  Not coming back.  FAIL.
author: Matt S.

description:
As usual, Philz delivers great drip coffee. This location, however, is quite small, with only 3 tables inside, and the interior isn't the cleanest. It's not the nicest place if you want to get a coffee and relax for a bit.

However, if you're just walking by, this probably will do. I just like the other Philz locations better.
author: Alice C.

description:
I have tried every coffee on the menu and loved them all.  That mint mojito though... I don't even like iced coffee.  But that is CRAZY good and refreshing. 
The pastries and breakfast burritos are spot on. 
On a side note I love the unicorn theme.  It's really unique and fun.  
The staff here are personable and very nice!!  
All around wonderful coffee place!

Update:  sometimes the staff can be inattentive, particularly one barista that somehow finds a way to mess up my order every time.  I got served an ice cold burrito one time!! Lol. They were mortified and offered me free pastries.   I didn't want to write about this but they keep dropping the ball every time after this!  Lately the mint in the mint mojito looks bruised and dirty.  One barista took a handful of tiny, bruised mint leaves and threw them in my coffee, instead of using a sprig.  The problem with this is every sip I took I was picking mint out of my teeth.  He also forgot to put sugar in the coffee.  I've also been noticing a ton of flies and fruit flies lately.   I loved
Philz when I first started going there but lately they keep dropping the ball and turning off my appetite!
I don't think this is a problem with individual associates.  I think management needs to step up and identify these problems.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
When you suddenly gain a few hours thanks to time zones, there's nothing like coffee to ensure you'll last the day.

Cheery service doesn't make a good cup - though I won't lie, our barista was the cheeriest ever - but thankfully my "Ecstastic Iced Coffee" was rightly-named, caffeinated goodness in every sip. Each cup is made individually, and the quality shows. The best part? Reasonable prices (credit cards accepted).

The Castro location offers light seating inside and out, plus a laundromat (the Sit and Spin) in the rear if you occasionally have the urge to do laundry like I do. Clean bathroom, too.
author: Dave L.

description:
I will miss you Castro Philz...

This used to be one of my favorite coffee places before they moved to the new location, used to drop by before work to get a quick caffeine injection. I work in the same block where the old location was and it was quite convenient and neighborly to stop by and head to work in an instant. I had the worst customer service on a mid-weekday when I walked in to this place. The new place is designed like a techie heaven (like not all the places cater to their appetite all over SF nowadays) 
Laptop size tables that look like work stations with tons of outlets and hubs. Charging cables are dominating the entire floor already...
Back to my story, I proceeded to order at this ginormous marble bar, there was one guy in front of me, he ordered something else at the cashier all the way at the end of the cafe. I waited, waited and waited. The hipster baristas were singing and dancing on the Kelly Rowland song "when love takes over" and talking about guys as if they are doing something back there. I asked the cashier girl which she was eating cookies and I waited for her to swallow her bite so I can ask a question. How does "ordering" work here? She said go back at the coffee bar and wait for them until they are ready to take your order! FML. I am in a total dilemma whether I should leave or not. All of a sudden the hipster queen Asian barista yells "get in line, Sirrrrrr!" I am in fucking line, obviously I am the head of the line since people are lining up behind me but you don't stop singing and dancing to notice a customer! I explained the situation and he scolded "what do you want?" As if I have done something wrong. 12 minutes of shock and disbelief for a cup of coffee? Where did you get these people from, the owner of Philz? What happened to those nice baristas you have in all other locations who say hi to people and they take great care of everyone? Save yourselves some attitude and go to Reveille Coffee instead where they will welcome anyone with genuine attention and care.
author: Emre T.

description:
My go to is the iced "so good" coffee.  The baristas were super friendly, especially the first time I visited.  They happily explained the menu to me, and I love that they organize their menu in order of strength of the coffee.  The so good comes with fresh mint which also tastes awesome.  

If you're a local, then you probably know how amazing this place is.  If you're visiting from out of town, then you should definitely make the effort to visit a location.  I've only ever been to the Castro location because it's in my hood but going to assume they're all just as good.

Five stars all around from flavor to service to experience.
author: Samik R.

description:
I'm updating this to 4. My previous review was too curt. Their coffees are tasty and the staff is extremely friendly, not aloof or too cool for you. 

$4 coffee done right.
author: Christopher J.

description:
After having coffee at (and reviewing) Réveille Coffee Co. in Castro, I saw that many other Yelp reviewers recommended Philz Coffee above Réveille. Naturally, this peaked my interest and I headed over to Philz to try their acclaimed Mint Mojito Coffee. 

Philz Coffee in Castro is small and could be easily missed by passersby. Upon entering I appreciated a trendy ambiance, which included a few small tables and a counter for ordering. I ordered the Mint Mojito Coffee (it does not actually have alcohol) from a very friendly barista.

I really enjoyed the coffee! The mint was fresh and added wonderful flavour to the sweet, creamy coffee. The service here was very good; notably, though, I came in the middle of the afternoon, so there were few other customers.

Recommendations: 
-Mint Mojito Coffee 

Verdict: 
Loved the coffee and would return on my next SF trip!
author: Laila A.

description:
Every Tuesday, I meet up with my coworker who lives in Castro to carpool down to Sunnyvale to see our client. I have to wake up super duper early just to get to Castro to get to her place, but I recently found out that there's a Philz near her place -- so it totally makes it worth it. You might pass by it first, because you see "Spin and sit" or something like that. It's slightly hidden, which makes it a tad bit more special.

What I love about this specific location is that every single barista here is SUPER duper nice and just makes your day a lot better. I'm not much of a morning person, but every single time I walk in here, the baristas are always slinging the sweet nectar of Earth. 

I always get the Philtered Soul - some people swear by Ambrosia. It really depends on your palate. I hear the iced mojito is awesome as well (however, I've been sick the last two times I have gone here, so I haven't tried a chilly coffee yet).

Definite recommend.
author: Joanne W.

description: My first Philz experience was here at their Castro location.  And of course, my first drink had to be their Iced Mint Mojito.  Pretty much other than that I didn't really bother to look at the rest of the drink menu so I guess you can say that at the time I was just popping my Philz cherry.  This location is pretty small compared to their other locations.  It could actually be considered as a Philz Express.  Not too much to complain about here though.  My drink was made pretty quick and I was in Mint Mojito bliss.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Philz coffee is great! My all time favorite beverage choice being the "Philharmonic Wow"! Have nothing but good things to say about Philz Coffee product and customer service.

However the store design at the Castro Street location in SF that grand opened a few weeks ago already looks tired. Shame on Philz Corporate Store Development and Design department for implementing such an uninspired store design at such a vibrant location to showcase your great product.
author: Andy L.

description: The coffee and hot chocolate here are superior to any other in San Francisco. That has not changed with the move. Having said that, the new location sucks and not in a good way. Yes, I know the old location was horrifically small and I always had a tough time finding a seat but it felt like Philz. This new place feels more like a Starbucks with good coffee. I've been in once and won't be back. I will make the trek to the 24th and Folsom location which means I won't be in Philz as much. Do all us Philz devotees a favor by keeping the new location for the techies and reopening the old location for us old grouches.
author: John A.

description: I go out of my way to get coffee here as I can always rely on it being a perfect or near perfect cup.
author: Phoebe M.

description:
Yes!! and Yes!!! to the Iced mint mojito here. This place has the best baristas mixing up the best drinks. Had the Iced mint mojito and it was perfect. I first tried Philz in Berkeley and the mint mojito was a bit off. Well I decided to give it another shot and this place solidified my new favorite coffee drink. Will def be back to this location, great friendly service coupled with expert barista skills. 

Do yourself a favor and try the Iced Mint Mojito
author: Corey F.

description: Considering there are more coffee shops than lube in the Castro now, glad I don't have to walk a few extra feet for this one again. The obnoxious baristas are waaaay too busy chatting it up with each other than helping customers figure out how to order which was clearly a clusterfuck the entire 15 minutes I stood there for a coffee that never showed up. Walked out to catch my bus. You can have my $3 just to never walk in here again.
author: Michael A.

description:
I must admit my first experience wasn't the best and the second was a bit better. Especially since the manager was kind enough to personally reached out to me and asked me to give it another chance.  Given that there's no Philz anywhere close to me, it's taken me some time to get out here. 

I came here one morning on my way to pick up my friend. This time I wasn't as confused and I knew to line up to order and then pay. I gotten the infamous mint iced mojito mocha. Afterwards, I paid and waited patiently for my drink. I'll have to admit my barista wasn't the friendliest, I'm not sure if its because its from the awkward question that he had asked me after he finished making my drink and I went up and grabbed it and he said to me 'did you pay for it yet?' Of course, I just answered yes and left and not thought much about it. After driving for like 5 mins I thought to myself, why did he ask me that. Mind-boggling but none the less I did enjoy my drink.
author: Mimi P.

description: I almost never write reviews . Philz coffee is good but this location was a mess ... Very disorganized feel . One of the barista was cocky enough shrug his shoulders pointing to where the line started.
author: Sandeep D.

description:
I've never been so impressed with a coffee house. The guys working here when I stopped in were funny, friendly and quick (even though one guy ran out to catch a glimpse of the rainbow). 

If you aren't careful, you'll miss this place, as it is right next to Sit n' Spin laundromat. However, this might be a godsend, because it isn't usually crowded and you can kill two birds with one stone (laundry and amazing coffee consumption). 

My favorite is the mint mojito, which I am convinced they have a giant river of in heaven. 

Blue Bottle and Ritual eat your hearts out!
author: Bianca U.

description:
#19 Tesora (honey & cinnamon)
Mochas are bomb!

I will return over and over again. I love Philz. I always walk away with a big smile because I know it will not fail. 

Love, period.
author: Priscilla N.

description: Oooh the mint mojito lives up to the hype. My drink was so flavorful and the staff was approachable and eager to answer any questions. Philz, when are you coming to NYC?!
author: Meg K.

description: Best chai tea latte I've ever had! They sell whole beans of their coffee that we use for cold brew and were hooked. Excited to get one in San Diego area here soon!
author: Korina K.

description:
Beautiful, cozy place in the middle of a more than interesting neighborhood. The barista was very useful in helping to choose the right coffee for me and my wife, and they were absolutely amazing.
One only minor thing: wi-fi connection is rather poor.
author: Marcelo C.

description:
Always come here when buying flowers or doing laundry next door. 
ICED MINT MOJITO. Just get it. You wont regret it. The barristas are also very friendly and look like they actually enjoy their job. I can see why they're expanding!
author: Alan M.

description:
Philz staff was great. We told them we were first timers and the barista took the time to explain the menu, and answer questions. They were all very friendly and helpful.
We got three different drinks between the three of us, and only I was truly happy with mine. I ordered the Philtered Soul (with milk and sugar), my companions got the Tesora, and a cinnamon iced coffee. The iced coffee was apparently like chewing on cinnamon, and the Tesora was bitter and un-drinkable. 
The line out the door makes us think that maybe those just weren't the drinks for them, but at $4 a cup it's a little too expensive for that margin of error.
author: Annaliese I.

description: Thank you Philz for restoring my faith in coffee! I had hears so much about Philz and I live in LA and they have already opened up the Santa Monica location but I have refused to go because I want to try Philz from SF! We went to this locations and the vibe was unreal. We loved it. We ordered the mint mojito ice coffee of course and it was fantastic! I also got some Tesoro coffee ground to go to bring home! I shared the coffee with my co workers and they were going nuts about where the coffee was from! So good! Thanks Philz!
author: Jen T.

description:
You know this place is great when each person that gets their order has a huge smile on their face and when they take that first sip they say now that's great coffee! 

I got the mint mojito iced coffee and it was so good! Love that mintyness infused into my coffee. 

The staff was friendly and their service is quick. Wish they had Philz in SoCal!
author: Leda T.

description:
This location is my favorite. Coffee's the strongest.

All time favorite is the Mint mojito iced coffee.

But really, I haven't had something I didn't like.

Mocha is super chocolatey, make sure you mix the bottom.
Silken Splendor, yum
etc!

Just ask the barista for recomendations if you have no idea.
author: Erica L.

description: Terrible business model. You wait at a sign to order and then wait to pay. No espresso drinks. They put the cream and sugar in for you. Just like Dunkin Donuts. All very smug.
author: Nicole C.

description:
I'm such a coffee addict, and LOVE Philz, especially this location. 

All Philz coffees are pretty consistent in their coffees, and they're all delicious, so you need not worry about the quality. If you're unsure, the Barista's here are SUPER nice and will talk to you about which ones might be the best for your taste buds. I personally love the Ambrosia one, but I haven't had a terrible one yet. =)
author: Lily W.

description: One of the best cups of coffee I've ever had. I got the mint mojito iced coffee that came with fresh mint. I'll definitely come back the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Andy I.

description: Good looking Store but this morning my partner and I  had to leave because music was way too loud, they were blasting music like if it was a bar at night, it was fun watching baristas dancing to music but my partner and I couldn't even continue our conversation since we simply couldn't hear each other so we left and walked to Noe Store instead. What a shame.
author: D C.

description:
I'm not a big coffee drinker but I must say I would drink coffee everyday if paces served the best coffee I ever had. Yes, I'm talking about their mint mojito ice coffee. The mint is what made this drink superb. This drink was so awesome that I got it three times while I was on vacation there. 

This place serves local desserts from different bakeries in the area which I support with business to business for the growth of the economy. Once you walk in there is a long line of eager people but the lines moves pretty fast. You can tell that people love their jobs because they are welcoming and creating conversations as wait for your drink. 

While I waited I order a lemon bar which I LOVED. You can't go wrong with a lemon bar. I didnt try any other drink here other then the MINT MOJITO ICE COFFEE...if you are in the area go get it before the world runs out of mint and you will never experience this awesome drink - YOUVE BEEN WARNED!!! ALOHA!
author: John U.

description: My son ordered Ginger Snap Iced Coffee. It was made with fresh ground beans and is excellent. My granddaughter had Iced Chai Tea. Also excellent. They were both asked what their preferences were with regard to how they wanted it prepared and sweetness. Definitely would recommend Philz for any gourmet coffee lover.
author: Alida R.

description:
I love, love, love the Philtered Soul (drip coffee made from hazelnut infused beans). I had it nearly every day while visiting SF. The staff are exceptional - they're friendly, helpful, and fun. Be nice to them and they'll make you an awesome cup of coffee. I love that Philz is pet friendly (even saw a parakeet/parrot sipping on coffee with its owner). 

I want to live in this area just to have access to Philz every day!
author: Trang H.

description: This morning around 6:30 AM, I went to the Castro Philz location, which I go to at least 3 times a week, to get my morning coffee. There were three people already there who had already ordered. There was a short woman with dark hair (looking glum) and a young tall guy with light hair working the bar. I stood DIRECTLY in front of the counter to order my coffee. No acknowledgement other than that they both looked at me. Then another guy walks in. The young man working the bar acknowledged him immediately and then the woman took his order! I was still standing at the bar right in front of them. The place was not crowded at all so its not like I would not have been easily noticed. So I picked up a croissant and when I went to pay for it, the young man asks me, "Is that all?" And that was it. Horrible customer service and I am never coming back to this location again.
author: John R.

description:
Just some of the BEST COFFEE IN THE BAY / YAY AREA!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I was once told that it is the full cream that they use that makes Philz special and as we now purchase our beans from Philz I can attest that that is NOT the case in our experience as we make our own pour over drip to start the day and use dry creamer (eww gross huh?/!) but the flavor of the coffee comes through and it is always delicious!  Not to mention cheaper than the bold roast we recently tried at Sightglass!!!!  I am a big fan of value and Philz won this most recent competition! Julies Ultimate is my partners favorite while I like the Code 33.
Enjoy some of the finest coffee in our coffee rich area!
CHEERS!
author: Sean M.

description:
San Francisco residents have coffee infused with their red and white blood cells. I haven't met anyone here really who isn't down for a cup of joe (or a cocktail.) But in terms of java love, Philz is near and dear to everyone's hearts. This Philz has never failed to pick me up on a Sunday morning. 

This shop is conveniently placed in the Castro, amongst the gay bars, brunch hangouts and Victorian  adorned SF architecture. It also happens to be about 3 blocks from my church, so this is the coffee shop i go to occasionally on Sunday mornings before service to read, reflect, have a great cup of coffee, and puppy watch all of the dogs in the area on their morning strolls. 

Like all Philz, you go to the barista bar, request what you want and then shift over to the casier and pay. This isn't the biggest Philz in town, so lines can get blurred and sometimes you don't know where to go and stand without misleading the next customer into thinking you are ordering and paying when you actually are just waiting for your drink to be done. The baristas are kind and helpful in facilitating all of that, and even with the large influx of customers, they don't miss a beat. Well, i think they forgot my order once, but all good, they're great!

I'm a sucker for their iced coffees, their Ginger Iced coffee in particular. The Mint Mojito is the rage, but i just want something sweet, without the mint. Their pastries are on point as well, with my favorite being the vanilla scone. 

Like i said this place is not the biggest, so seats may or may no be available. If there is a seat, grab it and never let go a la Titanic. If not, well the Castro and Mission is beautiful - go enjoy the city with your coffee, on the house. 

Cheers to Philz!
author: Kristine T.

description:
Commonly known fact: Philz includes an addictive substance in their Mint Mojito. Get it once, and you're hooked for life.


The Gingersnap Coffee is also amazing too but seriously, Mint Mojito.
author: Jo L.

description: The Jacob's Wonderbar is by far one of the best dark roasts I have ever had the pleasure of drinking. I have ordered it multiple time from their store, and usually make it at my house. I love their coffee, but I think the place is a little too small to hangout at.
author: George S.

description: Sarcasm and Coffee. The perfect start to a new day! I love Philz Coffee. If you don't like mint in your coffee in the first place, then don't take a sip from a friend! Order something else you yucky looking you.
author: Mr. T R.

description:
Philz coffee with awesome barristas that great you with a smile and an awesome cup of coffee what more can you ask for.
It is right next to the laundromat, so sip a coffee while you wait for your clothes to take a spin.
author: Tsu C.

description: Obviously every single Philz Coffee deserves 5 stars, but the reason I'm reviewing this one in particular is because the space is ridiculously adorable and comfortable. Definitely stop by if you're in the neighborhood and enjoy!
author: Amy Y.

description: The absolute best coffee bar in the city of San Francisco! Great staff, great coffee, great atmosphere what else could you ask for.
author: Tony G.

description:
The staff is SO sweet at this location, and they seem like they have fun at work, which is great. 

The coffee is delicious - my favorite is the iced coffee, sweet and creamy. The treats are yummy too - fresh croissants and donuts, mmm.

Really fun to sit on the bench outside and people watch.
author: Julia O T.

description: Must have, don't miss out! Had a Jacob's Wonderbar and it was nothing short of deliciousness in a cup!!
author: Yolanda C.

description:
I don't even like coffee, and I love Philz. About 3 times a week, I stop by to get a green tea, Philz' way (light cream, light honey, and mint and cardamom). 

I then settle in to one of the four indoor  tables and read for an hour or so, and no one gets anywhere near impatient. Lovely!
author: Charlotte H.

description: Love these people. They make a mean ginger snap. I will definitely give them 5-stars when Phil & Co decides to allow credit card tips(!). It's a hair awkward for me to come and patronize when I don't have cash to throw down, bc I do appreciate the flair and people remembering my drink and I want to respond in kind but having cash isn't always an option. I know SF is hard to do business and margins are tight, so I always wonder why they don't just then deduct the credit card fees correlated with processing the tips out from the tips, so it is cost neutral. There is a tip jar, so the idea of a tipping environment being dissuasive to customers probably isn't why they don't have this feature. Well, even though I don't get why I can't tip on the card, I hope same day soon I can! I really appreciate you all.
author: Brian B.

description:
My friend Jess J. thinks Philz is the best coffee in San Francisco. I'm not sure I am expert enough to make that judgment, but I did have a nice, satisfying experience there that puts it in the running, for sure.

The people who work here are uber nice and very informed. They helped me pick a coffee to try based on my abstract-sounding tastes, and my coffee did not disappoint.

There are lots of lovely coffees with rich descriptions.

I like how the "feel" of Philz is not pretentious but definitely serious. It's a chill place to hang out for a bit, even though the space, at least at this location, is not necessarily cozy inside. (It is pretty minimal.) Sitting in the front with the bulldog statue, though, is a pleasure!
author: Jess L.

description: I wish we had one of these coffee shops in Reno, NV. I came to visit my sister and she recommended the mojito coffee. It was amazing! Its a San Francisco must drink every time I go!
author: Kellie K.

description: Great coffee in s great location the employees are happy and enthusiastic which is nice thing to see in the morning the cafe is new and the decor is very contemporary
author: Mido E.

description: The mint mojito iced coffee is definitely worth all the hype. Creamy and lightly sweetened iced coffee with a kick of mint at the end. I was addicted.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
This is one of my must go places when I'm visiting sf. Every drink is individually crafted by your own philz rep. You go up to the counter, make your order, wait for them to finish it and then pay for it. 

Depending on the rep, they ask you to try the drink to see if you like it. If not, they'll alter it for you. Dont be afraid to ask for recommendations - these peeps know their coffee!!

I was in love with the mint mojito but now the gingersnap iced coffee is my fave. It tastes like speculoos in a cup!

And the tesora is on sale for $10/lb until Christmas!
author: Lisa T.

description: Great selection of light and dark roasts-- every coffee aficionado needs to check this place out. The baristas are great and will recommend you something if you want to explore the menu. My personal favorite is the New Manhattan, Philz Way (half cream/half sugar). A great place to hang out with the locals.
author: Polina S.

description: Amazing!!! Everyone is so sweet and kind here! Love the new location and such good coffee! Mint Mojito is the best! Great way to start the day and like that they open earlier than their old location!
author: Shakira M.

description: My first time going to Philz, the baristas looked really chill and they were, but the cashier lady was looking like she was hating life.. But and I got the Tesoro Mocha drink, because I like chocolate and sweets in my coffee cus I'm into that stuff. The drink is different than Starbucks or any typical coffee you would but at a cafe. It will have a strong taste if coffee, so if that's your tijng, definitely come here. I'm more of a sweet coffee kind of person so I would probably prefer a mocha drink at Starbucks because it is sweeter, but thats just me. Other than that, it seemed like a really chili place to talk about life or do some schoolwork. I would  recommend Philz if you like drinks that actually taste like coffee.
author: Bryant D.

description: This is a coffee shop that makes coffee. Not fancy espresso drinks. Coffee. It's great coffee too. Every cup is handmade at the time of order and is probably the best coffee you'll ever have. This location is in Castro, which is a fabulous part of SF. Grab a cup and enjoy.
author: Dave S.

description:
sorry
to some people, philz a religious experience
to me, it's too turkish-ish
It's not my bag baby
author: Alanna F.

description: Not only am I a fan of Philz unique methods and tongue textures of Arabica bean delight, but I will add here that the staff at the Castro Street location are truly some of the nicest service folks I have encountered in SF in quite some time. Everyone works hard while dancing to an inner positive note that leaves every patron smiling. Well, save for the few automatons who simply can't get away from their AI to tap into humanity.   GREAT JOB, Castro Philz staff!  Jacob Wonderbar - always a fave!
author: Dana J.

description: I stopped into Philz with a group of friends while we were visiting San Fran. We had just finished running a half marathon and were in need of caffeine! Being from Seattle, we are fairly particular about our coffee, and I have to say that Philz knocked it out of the park! I had the philharmonic blend - it was exactly as the tasting notes described. A great cup of coffee. The staff at the Castro location were so friendly and willing to listen to all our questions. I will definitely come back!
author: Toby T.

description: Friendly barista, centrally located, plenty of choices, attentively made cup of coffee, and delectable taste of Philz coffee in my hand - I know, it's a good day.
author: Francisco S.

description: Hands down, best coffee in the City! I love the flavor and the ritual from ordering from Philz. The atmosphere is warm, inviting and welcoming. They don't hassle you if you stay a long time. They always play great music too! My only wish, is more food Maybe premade sandwiches?
author: Downtown D.

description: Iced mint mojito!~ As everyone on this has suggested, I got the mint mojito. Because it was such a hot day, i got the iced! It was super delicious and minty fresh. I made it a point to get this when i was in the city. I went out of my way to get it too. It was totally worth it. I even got to drive through Castro which was pretty neat. It's a must if you're in the are and love coffee.
author: Peggy N.

description:
mint mojito iced coffee

i can have this every morning ........
author: Helena H.

description:
mint mojito all the way, forever and always.
this place is definitely a must if ur in the city!! 

the bagels/ baked things r also really good too, better then some restaurants lol
author: jocelyn n.

description:
Great little place on The Castro to grab an after meal coffee and pastry. I'm GF and to my amazement they had the best GF little pastry,
That unfortunately when I returned the next day were sold out. Not your typical prepackaged option, which the seem to have consistently... It's a little confusing if it's your first time, but line up at the "Line Starts Here" sign and one of the wonderful baristas will call you over. Don't ask for a latte, as they don't do espresso. They specialize in drip coffee which has a HUGE selection ranging from light to dark! If the menu seems overwhelming, as for their recommendation. Coffee is a little pricier (more on the latte range), but I guarantee it will be worth it!
author: Jes L.

description:
Two words - MINT MOJITO!  I've probably said the same thing to all of my friends who have ever visited a Philz or ever wanted to.  The Mojito Iced Coffees are simply amazing and with no frou-frou fancy lattes in sight these mint mojitos make you wonder...

The Philtered Soul is also one of my favorites since I'm a huge fan of nutty coffees.  Check out Philz Coffee sometime and if you're lucky enough to meet Phil... let me know!
author: Kevin J.

description: A classic San Francisco institution for coffee. The menu can be a little intimidating with over 20 options of coffee beans but variety is great! Beware even the medium options are quite strong. Each cup of coffee is made to order ensuring that it is fresh and hot! There is also a small selection of baked goods and bagels. The average wait seems to be about 5-10 minutes but it is worth your time. The staff seem helpful if you find yourself lost!
author: Charlotte A.

description:
LOVE this location. 

Mint Mojito is my favorite. If you never ordered one, definitely let them know you want it with cream and sugar.
author: Adam J.

description: After taking up coffee recently, I found Philz to be my favorite.  I like the Mocha Tesora with extra chocolate.  The staff is really friendly and are easy to chat with.  I just wish they stayed open a little later.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Wow I never thought that coffee could be this good. I use to be a huge fan of Peet's until I finally went to this place. This place by far the best coffee I've ever had. 

Had the Tesora and that has to be my favorite. 

The one downside of this place is that they have all sorts of weird names for each of their drinks and there is only one banner that explains the drinks to us and the banner unfortunately is on the bottom of the counter so you would have to bend down to see what you are ordering. I was too lazy to do that so I just asked to get the most popular one everyone gets and that was the Tesora. It would be a lot better if they use normal names for their drinks so people would know what to order or have the explanation be on flyers or have it up high and big so everyone would know what to get.

But because of the incredible good service and great drinks, I have to get this place a 5. 

I highly recommend coming here and if you don't drink coffee, get the chai, its to die for.
author: Anthony N.

description: Good coffee and I like to support a local business.  The only problem, is that finding parking is hard.  Overall I love the place.
author: Michael M.

description: Hey wow! I couldnt wait to go here after reading the badass reviews. I went in slightly intimidated and approached the counter with 2 friendly dudes behind it. I was all like" I just want a god cup of coffee". Friendly dude #1 proceed to not treat me like an idiot but ask me what I liked in my tastes in coffee. He recommended the Jacobs Wonderbar dark roast and boy was it awesome. So they totally make your coffee to order right in front of you. It was one of the best plain cups of coffee I have ever had. I am pretty much dreaming about it every morning as I drink my drip coffee from my machine here in Atlanta. Both guys were super friendly, thanks guys.
author: rachel m.

description: I love Philz! Whenever I'm in SF, I like to come here and/or Blue Bottle Coffee. My favorite is the Mint Mojito. I'll definitely be coming back in the future!
author: Cindy B.

description:
Things I LOVE about Philz...
-Coffee is brewed by the cup!
-Coffee is cooled to perfect drinking temp!
-Bring your own mug and get charged small size price!
-Order a Code 33 if u wanna be wired.
-Julie's Ultimate is my fave!
-Friendly staff!

Things I LOVE about this location...
-Parking is (somewhat) easy to find.  
-Water bowl for doggies.
-Outdoor seating, great for people watching!

Other notes:
-Restroom is a drag to get to.

CONVENIENCE: **** [Street parking, non-metered]
AMBIANCE: ***** [Limited seating indoors, outdoor patio available]
SERVICE: ***** [Fast & friendly]
PRICE:  $  [$3 & up]
OVERALL: ***** [5-stars... cuz I've been to Blue Bottle, Ritual, & Four Barrel and Philz is by far the BEST!]

Nuff said.

[#31 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]
author: Lily Y.

description:
Nom nom nom nom nom. The mint mojito iced coffee was delicious! Delicious! They were super friendly too. 

I was skeptical about mint and coffee, but I'm sold. Definitely some of the best coffee in the city.
author: Sneha P.

description:
Magic coffee and magic brewing tricks. Oh yummy. If you haven't heard of Philz by now, well, that's weird. They have secret recipes for roasting their beans amaza-awesomely and they do every cup with a special pour over method. I'm a big coffee person, and Philz is like the fancy-and-tasty high-end hipster-ish coffee chain.

On Castro they don't have much seating: three small indoor tables and three or four outdoor tables. They also only have two or three stations, so be ready to wait. However, the baristas were the nicest of any of the Philz I've been to.
author: Luke K.

description: Mint mojito mint mojito mint mojito!!! That's all lol this stuff is ridiculously good & addictive!
author: Sally O.

description:
Wow, wow, wow. Really really really gooooood iced mocha.

I got a Philz gift card from The Journey church for being a first time attendee (I love this church). Being an aficionado of coffee and everything free, I had to trek out of my comfort zone in Pac Hts and to one of the many Philz's locations to utilize the gift card. I decided at random to go to the one in Castro. 

I walked in to the Castro location yesterday and took a look at the menu. Despite being busy accommodating a couple of patrons before me, a cute male barista noticed me and said he will be right with me. I was already liking this place. I asked whether they had any blended coffee as I wasn't used to their drink monikers and couldn't tell what was what. The said cute male barista kindly asked how I liked my coffee. I told him sweet, chocolatey sweet. He offered to make me an iced mocha, medium sweet. I said ok. 

When it was time to pay, I realized I left the gift card in my other bag. Grrr... So I had to pay with cash. But the iced mocha was so damn good, I didn't really care that I paid $3.50 for it. In LA, I would've paid close to $5 for non-starbucks coffee that was this good anyways. One sip of the drink and I was hit with a wave of inexplicable happiness. I loved how he even put a couple of mint leaves to complement the chocolatey flavor. Mmmm. Plus, now I get to come back to use the gift card for another cup of delicious drink, and perhaps, see the cute barista again.
author: Lina S.

description: Very very good Mint Mojito. Im having it right now in front of the place. There is also a flowers store right besides, so the area is beautiful.
author: William B.

description:
Ordered coffee and got a cup of steaming condescension. I should be the only one doing the patronizing in this situation. Coffee's good.

Now, I'm no stranger to the relationship between good coffee and hipster barista ennui, but if you're going to go there, go there. Either be so rude to me that I have no choice but to return continuously and drink shit tons of your coffee until I win the coveted approval reserved only for regulars or be nice, but none of this distain encrusted with quirky-friendly-neighborhood-coffee-guy thing. barf.
author: KC G.

description: Just your regular quality Philz. It's really small, the furniture could use an upgrade (my chair was just begging to comically break while I was sitting in it), but it's still a great place.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I WANT TO TRY EVERYTHING.

I got the mojito thing. It was really good. 

A lady outside the store asked if she could have a sip. She looked trustworthy and generally hygienic, so I gave her a sip. She was thankful, and it's been a while, and I have no diseases to report (knock on wood). So overall, it was a good experience.
author: Joe H.

description:
Great location and friendly baristas!  I have only tried their mint mojito iced coffee.  Its one of those things you love right off the bat, and can never order anything else ever again.  I would love to try other things on their menu, but every time I am there I just can't seem to make the switch.  They even recommended the pumpkin spiced iced coffee to me, but I couldn't resist that delicious creamy sweet mint iced coffee.

This coffee place is attached a laundromat.  If you need to use the restroom you have to look for the plastic elephant watering pot laying around with the key attach to it.  The restroom is located in the laundromat.  

I also love passing by the flower shop next door ;)
author: Lynn L.

description: Amazing place! Hands down to Mint Mojito! Most exotic coffee I've ever had, best in the bay!
author: Fanny Z.

description: Philz has been my favorite place to get coffee in the Castro for 10+ years. The new location is an upgrade in style without attitude, and it's a block closer :)
author: Kevin C.

description: I found this location by accident, which was a pleasant surprise.  This is the smallest location I've been to but just as always, the coffee and service is great.
author: Rose A.

description:
At Philz but can't drink coffee?

Two words: ISTANBUL TREAT.

This gorgeous combination of green and black teas, mint and spices truly is a treat and won't leave you jealous of your compatriot's coffee.
author: Miriam W.

description: I love Philz, but this location is probably the worst one I've been to, in terms of the interior design. It is literally an order-pay-pick up kind of location, not one where you sit and chat with friends because there is only one dinky table next to the window. So if you plan on meeting someone here or bringing large groups of people, I suggest going to a different location!
author: Alice H.

description:
I enjoy my Philz in the Van Ness location better than this one.

The ambiance at this location was not very welcoming; Although the workers are nice, there's something missing.

The drinks have the same quality, but I prefer the Van Ness location.

Mint mojito iced coffee FTW! I prefer this than the mocha drink; the Mint Mojito iced coffee is more refreshing; the mocha is very thick and rich.
author: Jen H.

description:
Seriously the best green tea I've ever had.
Not sure what voodoo magic is involved, but I could easily switch out my Iced GingerSnap Coffee for green tea from here on out.
author: Eugene X.

description: Iced coffee mint mojito and Mocha Tesora. Amazing! Location is new, fresh & airy. The baristas are helpful as it was our first time ever to try Philz. I highly recommend for everybody to try Philz if they are ever in the area.
author: Ysca B.

description: This is a smaller branch of the Philz franchise in the Castro. It's tucked away on 18th just a bit east of Castro itself. Given that it's a little smaller, there can be a bit of a line, and the seating area is pretty minimal. For this reason, it seems to cater a bit more to the in/out customer than someone wanting a chill place to sit. However it's a pretty good place to get your Mint Mojito fix if you're nearby, and it brings that same Philz quality you know and love.
author: Brent W.

description:
Every time I'm in the city or Berkeley I try to stop and get a cup of Philz... and when I'm away I order the beans online to enjoy at home.. Love that each order is brewed by itself, huge selection of coffee and you never get that burnt brewed five hours ago starbucks taste. Also their pastries and cookies are pretty good too. 

Dark Roasts
1. Ether - Great if you like really dark coffee with heavy earthy flavors 
2. Jacob's Wonderbar - FAVORITE, nice smooth dark roast with a hint of dark chocolate
 
Medium Roasts
1. Anesthesia to the Upside - Perfect if your not a huge dark coffee drinker but still need a kick in the middle of the day to get you going
2. Philtered Soul - Nice light cup of coffee when im looking for something a little bit sweeter.
author: Russell U.

description:
My my.. how much I missed Philz!! 

ECSTATIC!!
I get it with cream and sugar but not too sweet.
It is PERFECTION. Many know how delicious this place is, so I will just say...

Philz, please hurry up and move down to LA.
author: Sylvia Y.

description: Pretty smooth (ecstatic) iced coffee that was not too acidic. Enjoyable. Quenching. The staff put cream and sugar for you, which is a tad annoying as I like adjusting this on my own. The water provided was refreshing with cucumbers. Loved all the rainbow unicorns!
author: Agent W.

description:
Coffee is just coffee to me. But at Philz, they give you a hard lesson in how different coffee can taste.

I got the philtered soul here, and it was very good. They add the cream and sugar for you which I thought was a little weird. I usually like to drown my coffee in cream and sugar so it tastes like coffee ice cream. But they go very light on the cream and sugar here. I thought it was the perfect amount to add some sweetness but also not overwhelm the flavors of the coffee. I could taste some of the nuttiness that they described in the menu. I feel like a snobby douche saying stuff like that, but I guess I got a glimpse of why people are so particular about their coffee...
author: M L.

description: The mint mojito iced coffee is the perfect refreshment on a sunny San Francisco Day!
author: Laura C.

description: Love this place. Had a much better experience here than the original locale on 24th. Despite being super busy, the staff was friendly and efficient and my coffee was delicious as ever. Thanks!
author: Leslie H.

description:
As someone who hails from the overly caffeinated birthplace of Starbucks, I am always in search of delicious cups of java wherever I go.  Philz definitely lives up to my standards and fit the bill for a refreshing drink on a warm spring day.  They even have some outdoor seating so friends and I enjoyed taking a break and enjoyed some people watching before continuing on our San Fran adventure.

Not only is their coffee great, but they also have some great concoctions that will change your mind about just plain coffee.  The iced mint mojito is an absolute must and is very refreshing. Like any other mojito, it had some muddled mint in the bottom...it couldn't have been more delicious mixed with the coffee flavor.  Since I don't like super sweet drinks, I got it with half the sweetener so it was perfect.  

Even though there was a line out the door on the day I came here, the staff treated each customer with care.  I was quite impressed the line kept moving despite the customization and level of crafting that was required for some of the drinks.

A must if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Maria K.

description:
Tiny little location, but a place with a lot of smiles and character.

== Food ==

Great coffee! Tesora medium sweet is my go to coffee and every Philz I have been to makes it perfect.

== Service ==

Quick and fast!

== Overall ==

I love Philz! They make the perfect cup each time.
author: Steven B.

description:
It was love at first sip...this place brews AMAZING coffee.  So amazing that I drive 1.5 hours to get one a few times a month. I don't live in the bay area (sadly) thus going to Philz is such a treat for me.  Well worth the drive though!! Plus it's just a few blocks away from Tartine's morning bun goodness...

The coffee is bold yet smooth & never bitter. Also, the staff at this location is always very friendly and helpful if I have any questions about any of the blends.  They know their stuff! If you are a Philz first timer, I definitely recommend asking the baristas for their suggestions. You won't be disappointed.
author: Gina G.

description: I've gone into this Philz a couple of times, mostly as a coffee pit stop with friends, and then once for a date. Whatever the occasion, though, they've always been OK experiences. Mostly, because the people behind the bar never seem to be having a good day like the people that work at the other Philz locations. I mean, if I worked in a touristy location, I guess I wouldn't be super pleasant all the time either. It's pretty much a guaranteed cluster in here on the weekends, so don't count on coming here to sit and chill. Anyways, coffee was fine.
author: Shawn B.

description:
My go-to coffee in all its quirkiness and glory.

Head through the doors, line-up, step to the counter, order Philtered Soul, pick your quantity of cream and sugar, and enjoy that SF splendor!
author: Bryan P.

description: I am so in love with every single coffee Philz sells, and this particular location is just wonderful. The people are friendly, the coffee is fantastic, and the buzz I get from the Silken Splendors, Mint Mojitos, and Philtered Souls, are just beyond.
author: Ilana B.

description: Go with the mojito coffee ($4) as everyone recommends, it is pretty bomb. The lady working there was also super friendly. The place is small, so chances are you won't be able to stay. Great coffee.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Everybody's been saying. That Mint Mojito is absolutely ridiculously awesome. Those real mint leafs in the cup... it's definitely something special.

I'm SO SAD I'm not a local so I could come here everyday and try everything there. There's no doubt the quality of coffee and beverages are top notch.

The employees are so much fun and down to earth. In the face of a line out the door they kept their cool and their smiles and continue to crank out that amazing elixir they make one-cup-at-a-time, Philz style.

TINY shop with limited seating. I didn't really want to sit in there anyways with the line all crammed up in there.

But all is well. My experience there was great. I'll be back Philz.
author: Richard W.

description:
So I've heard Philz coffee is pretty badass up here and that people say it gives Urth Caffe a run for it's money.  I must say that the Mint mojito iced coffee was damn good.   I didn't get anything to eat because it was not on the menu.  
This location is a bit tiny but the baristas are cheerful, friendly dudes, so that matters more.  The couple of tables out front was cool.  I got to enjoy the little bit of sunshine while savoring the damn good coffee.
author: Michael L.

description: I can't say enough fantastic things about this place. Not only is the coffee tasty and delicious, and is filled with rainbows; the staff is very friendly and professional. My top favorite drinks are mint mojito ice coffee, Tesora, and Jacob's. I normally ask for light cream and sugar so it doesn't over power the actual taste of beans. My favorite people here are Britt, Adam, and Nelson! Keep up the great work!
author: Vinson H.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee... Need i say more?
author: Anh T.

description: I would do anything for Philz to open in NYC. Please. I am tired of New York's hipster coffee shops. Philz Coffee is so unique and awesome without that pretentious feel. The Mint Mojito Iced Coffee was, of course, delicious. It's very refreshing and perfectly sweetened. They have a plethora of unique coffee blends for you to try, all with clever names. Your barista will carefully brew your coffee and ask exactly how you want it: cream or milk? If sweetened, how sweet? When you receive your drink, they ask you to try it, and make any changes if needed. I absolutely love how they make each drink to your liking, and they put a lot of care into it. You talk to your barista face to face, unlike at Starbucks. The wait can get a bit long both to order and to receive your drink, but it is very worth it. The service is great at this location, better than other Philz that I've visited. Truly one of my favorite coffee places!
author: Anna C.

description:
If this review would have been written 5 years ago, when I originally began going to this philz location I would have given it 5 stars. Back then the baristas remembered the locals who came in regularly they'd remember your drink and make it to perfection.

Now, philz is always crowded as the hipsters have made their way to this spot. The prices have gone up, the baristas are changing constantly, and it lacks in that neighborhood coffee shop feel that used to charm my husband and I to come in every weekend.
author: Leetal M.

description: Best Coffee ever! Long wait but worth every minute. A regular coffee is so good you would think you ordered a specialty drink. I will be visiting again soon!
author: Allison S.

description: It's a tiny Philz, but a good one! They still have the old descriptions of the coffee blends on the bar, which I actually like because it's fun to read about them while waiting for your deliciously tasty mint mojito iced coffee.
author: Nick S.

description:
This is now probably one of my favorite coffee shops of all time. 

My friends and I ventured to this place right after brunch, and it was a nice walk given how full we were. The surrounding neighborhood is really lovely, and all the murals definitely brought more character to the neighborhood. 

Philz Coffee is definitely crowded; people are lounging around doing work or simply catching up with friends. The line was out the door, but service was friendly and fast; it gave me just enough time to browse through their endless selection of coffees and teas! 

This place has one of the most unique varieties of coffees and teas I have ever seen. I ordered the iced coffee mint mojito, which I definitely recommend if you love coffee. You could taste the coffee, and the fresh mint added a refreshing twist that I particularly loved. 

They rely on the honor system in the fact that you first order your coffee with the baristas, and then mosey your way over to the register to pay for your order.

I definitely want to come back soon and try the other selections they have there. The Istanbul Tea is up next for me!
author: Andrea X.

description:
Ever since I tried Philz Coffee for the first time in San Jose, I wanted to go back for another cup. I didn't get the chance to until about 2 weeks ago.

This was my first time at this location. Nice little place. Seats/tables indoors & outdoors. Employees were very nice. 

I ordered a Mint Mojito Iced Coffee & my friend ordered a Philtered Soul Coffee. Both were delicious. No complaints here :) 

I found 2-hr parking in the residential area right around the corner. Not bad. 

I'll be back for another Philz Coffee fix :)
author: Jessica A.

description:
Located near the border of the Mission and Castro district. The shop isn't too big but there are some 2 person tables for individual study. Outside are a couple of tables as well. 

On a nice summer day in SF, I was debating between the Mocha Tesora (small $3.50 then additional $0.50 intervals for larger sizes) or Mint Mojito Iced Coffee ($4 small, $4.50 large). I opted for the Mint Mojito since I was visiting from So-cal and I don't know any other place that serves a Mint Mojito Coffee. The coffee is definitely accentuated by the mint flavor. There is a pretty strong coffee flavor regardless of the mint. 

The coffee is definitely stronger and smoother than your local Starbucks. The prices are decent and each cup is carefully prepared. Too bad there isn't a Philz in So-cal otherwise I would already be a coffee addict.
author: Kathy W.

description: I had to check this place out after hearing such rave reviews. I had a large Philharmonic for 4 bucks. It was smooth and brewed a cup at a time as advertised. Nowhere to sit on a saturday afternoon so we walked around. I'm now a fan but I can't think of why it would deserve 5 stars. The people that work there were very personable.
author: Marty J.

description: They still sell ether and they still sell vegan dontus so i am happy.  the new staff is just as awesome as the old.  great place to sit down and drink a cup of coffee and relax.  pet the fake dog for good luck.  ;)
author: Cynthia B.

description:
This is by far my favorite Philz location. Even though it's super tiny. The staff is extraordinarily friendly and helpful and when you're lucky, you can score a seat outside. If not, even better. Dolores Park is just around the corner and having an amazingly delicious Philz while hanging out in the park is just unbeatable. 
My favorite is Philtered Soul. There's something about the hazelnutty, chocolaty flavor that is almost like Nutella for grown-ups (not that the real Nutella is for kids only).
author: Tobias G.

description:
Just my .02...    Never had coffee from Philz, so when we were up in the city for a Giant's game that night, we stopped by at this location before lunch.

It's a small cafe and the girl behind the counter was helpful with the selection of a particular cup of coffee. She knew we were not regulars of Philz as we gazed up at the variety of coffees on the menu behind the counter.

She recommended a cup for me as I mentioned that I typically go to Peets and like the Garuda blend.  I'm actually not sure which one I got as it was a bit busy and noisy, I just nodded my head at the cup that she mentioned.  When she was finished with the coffee, she stated that it goes well with a bit of mint on top so I again nodded as I like to try new things.

I just had the coffee with a little cream, I drink a lot of coffee black to get the full flavor of the particular bean. About 1/3 of the time, I'll add cream for the richness.

While it was good, I'm still a Peets fan.  At $3 a cup, that is the equivilent of 1/4 pound of coffee beans.  You can get quite a few cups of coffee in 1/4 pound.
author: Glenn O.

description:
If you subscribe to the notion that coffee is a complex beverage - you, like me, will have noticed that there's a wide variability between coffee providers. If that were not enough there can be a substantial difference between all the different varieties of drinks each shop sells.
