Philz is no exception, however their best coffee beats your best coffee - I'm still to have a Phil'z dark roast that i havent been positively surprised by. Having said that, the light roasts are only slightly better than the decaf at Carrows (thats actually not true because Carrow's decaf cant possibly be called coffee...)

tip: there's a process here that's a bit different then your normal coffee ordering procedure, additional thing that makes this place unique
author: Oleg H.

description:
I was not a coffee drinker until my love introduce Philz to me a few years back. My favorite place for Ice Mint Mojito! We go there when we need a minty fix. I love the set up, decor, color so vibrant in Philz and everything in it looks cute. 

I'm constantly entertain by the nice customers while watching our coffee made. I recommend this place to everyone who loves coffee for it's made with the right amount of care. Imagine a cool drink running down your throat.

Remember, there's a long line and so is the waiting..
author: Joanne L.

description: Philz never ceases to impress me with how good their coffee is. I think it was almost one year ago when I first tried the mocha tesora. Next, I moved on to their signature iced coffee mint mojito. It was a revelation and changed the way I drank iced coffees. Last week I sampled the tantalizing turkish since I am fond of dark roasts. I was a convert of the herbal flavor of the cardamom and thought I had found my go-to cup at Philz. Today, I tried the philtered soul, a medium dark roast. Chocolate with a touch of nutty hazelnut. I think whatever roast you choose, you can't go wrong.
author: Bailey Z.

description: Philz is the best coffee in the city, hands down. Everyone at this location is so friendly - Lauren, Chelsie, Nelson, etc - are always eager to help and go above and beyond. I've never waited longer than five minutes, even on crazy weekend mornings. They do what they need to do and get the job done. Love this place.
author: Kyle S.

description: This coffee is five star for sure!! My favorite of all time. Excellent service always!! The exact opposite of some other Blue coffee shops. My only complaint:  they run out of the same muffin every morning (yummy raisin bran muffins from the Starter Bakery). This has been the case for two years. Management...order more per day maybe?  Why wouldn't you order more of something that you run out of every day? Like other customers, I don't buy some other pastry, I just take my coffee, and disappointment, and I leave. Minus one star for that.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Located conveniently in the Castro, this Philz location is small, yet welcoming. Their coffee selections are plentiful and definitely intimidating to most people. However, the staff are more than helpful offering up explanations and suggestions based on your preferences and tastes. 

I definitely recommend the mint mojito iced or the mocha tesora with mint. Great coffee, great ambience, amazing staff. What more can you ask for?

This place is definitely a must. I go every time I visit the city.
author: Geoffrey Blair A.

description:
Delicious. I love the ecstatic iced coffee. I find myself craving it even after I've just had one...

One other thing I like about this place (other than the coffee) is the fact that the baristas are so friendly, helpful, and not snobby at all! They're so open with their recommendations without acting like a snoot, which is refreshing after some negative encounters with baristas at other establishments. Very welcoming to newcomers and regulars alike.

Oh, and my two cents on the debate: Philz wins over Blue Bottle.
author: Angela K.

description:
I'm so in love with Mint Mojitos and am always excited to crash at my girl friend's place so we can have a lovely sunny stroll to Philz. 

Their pretty light on the ice too so you'll have plenty to drink and enjoy. 

I don't even know if I can try their other coffees because I always want the Mojito!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Good coffee. They have almond milk (score!). The mocha tesora is delicious, as is the mint mojito iced coffee. You can pick the milk and sweetness level. Love that. 

They also carry gluten free/vegan cookies and brownies!
author: Wendy R.

description: Maybe the phunkiest Philz I've been to.  Definitely the smallest.  This is one is just a walkup storefront with maybe a few chairs inside and a couple tables out front.  The barista, though, was one of the friendliest I've experienced at a Philz, considering that most tend to be a little too hipster-ish aloof or even downright snarky.  Was in and out with my iced mint mojito in a flash!
author: Bryce B.

description:
If there is ONE THING I could take with me from San Francisco back to Dallas, I say it would be Philz. What the hell do they put in their coffee other than awesomeness and strength that could power you to run for miles? All in one day I managed to order two Ginger Snap Iced Coffees and I still wanted more. 

They individually brew each cup and then save some of the strongest parts for the iced coffee. I honestly wish they would incorporate a location where I am because this would be my new daily addiction.
author: Abra B.

description:
Great location , I love everything about this coffee shop .
Been there several times with my friends and enjoy it very much .
author: David S.

description:
My friend told me that once I try the mocha from Philz, I am going to cry that there's not one in Seattle. Why? Because the mocha is made without milk added and it still taste sweet and coffee-ee. 

He ordered the mocha tesora. I waited a bit for it to cool down. Walked a few blocks on Castro and took my first sip. And I was impressed. My tongue was flabbergasted. Will I cry? No, but I might occasionally lust about it when I'm in line waiting for my mocha at Starbucks. Or have nightmares about terrible mochas chasing me and the mocha tesora coming to my rescue! 

From here on, every mocha I ordered in the future will never live up to Philz. Boo.
author: Vicky L.

description:
One of my favorite Philz as it's one of the oldest and in one of the most awesome neighborhoods in the city.  It's smaller so harder to get on your computer and get work done.  But, if you're dropping in for a quick cup or to sit and talk it's a cozy little spot.

I am a huge fan of Anthony behind the counter...is an awesome dude that always makes your day.  

If you use JoynIn before yourdrop-in you can sometimes pick up 2 for 1 on your drinks.  Pretty dang cool...
author: Brenton G.

description:
It was my first time at Philz and I'll definitely be back! The coffee was great. I was a little intimidated because of all the choices but the woman behind the counter was very helpful. 

It's a small space so not ideal for a writing or study session but perfect to pop in and get a great coffee drink served by a sweet and friendly staff!
author: rachel g.

description:
I was amazed! So many blend choices! It was my first time coming here and I asked the gal behind the counter how it worked and she pleasantly explained the process in detail without making me feel rushed or in the way.

Every coffee we had (there were three of us and we taste tested each others) was delicious. I think it would be hard to go wrong here.

p.s. I normally don't feel that caffeine high from coffee, but I was definitely buzzing after Philz coffee.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Their mocha was divine, mint mojito iced coffee as good as always, no line at this location either. :)
author: Vivian H.

description:
*cue John Williams score from the movie Jaws.
Oh god 
oh..noooooooooooooooo
oh my god,
oh my GODddddddddddddd....
GOd please help me
HELP me....
GOD PLEASE HELLLLLLLLLLLLLLlppppppppppppppppp......


Just like the girl in that opening scene,
I wish I was being torn apart limb by limb....
*****side note: She did want the shark to attack her.
She raised her eyebrow, gave a come-hither grin, and gave a soft
laugh.
You know the shark wanted to rip her
apart. So...yeah...She was pretty much just asking to be lunch.
anyways....

We don't have a
Philz Coffee in San Diego. 
Life without  the best coffee I have EVER had....
just isn't the same.
I should just bathe myself in blood and 
go surfing.
At least,
I might have a chance, getting
a shark to tear me apart.
Or...


I could move to the Bay.
author: Rossi H.

description:
Once I found Philz Coffee I have now been making it a priority to stop in whenever I venture to the Castro. 

There regular cups of coffee have the consistency and taste of a latte. And the fact that they put in the cream and sugar for you makes it all the more delicious. 

Can't say enough about how nice and helpful the staff is too. Love love love this place!
author: Marlisa F.

description: I don't know what I can add to the accolades others have written here except to validate them.  The staff is great, and the care they put into brewing a cup of coffee is a thing of beauty.  Ether is my variety.  There's not much that's better in the world than a freshly-brewed cup of Philz Ether.  Thank you for being in my neighborhood, guys.
author: Earline A.

description: I don't even like coffee. But oh by gosh by golly that mint mojito had me swoooooning. The mint brings out an incredibly distinctive, refreshing taste. Absolutely delicious! At $4 for regular sized cup, it's pretty expensive but definitely worth the cost. Definitely the best coffee I've ever had!
author: Carolyn L.

description:
Mocha tessora is very earthy and rich. It is stronger than your regular Starbucks mocha. They make it rich and creamy and it comes only in two sizes (small or large). 
My overall experience is that you order first then they rung you up. The price is reasonable probably about the same as Starbucks.
author: Lilac L.

description: Great service and really good pour over coffee. It was nice to sit outside and enjoy some delicious coffee.
author: Adriana S.

description: The coffee is deservedly celebrated. This particular branch is the best one they've got.
author: Eric F.

description:
I love Philz drip coffee. This store is significantly smaller than the others and the menu is hard to see. Fortunately, the staff at Philz is great and if you are overwhelmed just tell them what you like generally and they will whip up something awesome for you based on your preference! 

Lots of cute boy toys hanging around here. There isn't really seating though and the pastries are limited/don't look as fresh and appetizing as the other locations. 

This is definitely a grab-n-go spot. If you are dining, partying or just chillin in the Castro, get your caffeine fix here! 

I love the variety of spiced and  flavorful coffees here! As everyone says the iced mint mojito is great, but I would only order it on a really warm day. I just love the aroma and cozy essence of hot coffee. The mojito is perfectly refreshing on a warm day though.
author: Angela K.

description: I was referred to this by a friend I met on vacation in LA and I can honestly say this might be the best tasting coffee I've ever had. The iced mint mojito is a delicious coffee and every other coffee I've had pales in comparison. Even if you aren't an avid coffee drinker, the iced mint mojito is a MUST TRY for anyone. The one thing that some people may not like would be the extremely long wait. I usually pick up coffee at my local starbucks and am out the door within 3 minutes. Expect to wait 15-20 minutes at Philz , maybe even more during rush hour. That being said after the wait is over, sip and enjoy one of the best made coffees out there!
author: Zip T.

description:
Wow...this was disappointing. The guy at the counter was super nice and very very helpful with us picking out something to drink. Ended up with the #18 "So Gooood."

I dunno...maybe I just didn't want coffee yesterday. It was just not mind-blowing delicious like all the other reviews make it seem. Rather, my coffee was cloyingly sweet and just so-so. 

If I end up out front of another Philz Coffee with a hankering for a drink..I may just give them another chance. Not too interested otherwise.
author: Lauren G.

description: Philz! Always a little overwhelming to order at due to plethora of options. I recently accidentally ended up ordering a mint tea WITH caffeine AND soy milk AND honey and oh my god what did I just do? But it turned out delicious and now I think I'm kind of an ordering genius.
author: Tasha D.

description:
Had the tantalizing Turkish single drip coffee to off set the brunch mimosa's I had. Black was the call to order and it fulfilled it very nicely. The taste was dark and strong, which I needed. Much better than the other roast that I tried, which I cannot remember... It took me back to trip to  Turkey and the Turkish coffee I had back then.  

Usually I am a Peet's or Blue Bottle person, as I like my coffee full flavor and  body. But after tasting the Turkish coffee, I will add this to my rotation.  As it is in Berkeley, I will have to give it another whirl.
author: Marck N.

description: The speciality drinks are my favorite! If I can come here everyday, I would! You are missing out if you haven't tried any of their drinks!! It is a must in the bay area!
author: Joanne C.

description: No words can describe the iced coffee mojito. It's insanely delicious. The staff is patient and knowledgable. I loved every minute of it.
author: M. C.

description: I am an espresso snob that generally detests drip coffee.  But Philz? Philz does drip like no other.  It has flavour!  It's not bitter!  In fact, it's damn delicious.  The Philtered Soul is friggin amazing.  Too bad this is a "grab-n-go" establishment, because it sure would be nice to enjoy my Philz inside on a rainy San Francisco day.
author: Andrea P.

description:
It's a little frothy.
It's refreshing.
It's slightly sweet.
It's a pick me up. 
It's good for a date.
It's minty, real fresh mint, like mint with your pho.
It's not Colgate minty.
What is it??
It's a Philz Iced Mint Mojito Coffee, that's what.
Its $4 for a small.
Damn.
author: Angela W.

description: Great coffee, Great workers. Mint mojito coffee!
author: d n.

description:
Great coffee and super friendly staff!
I was going there thinking it was a regular coffee shop,
and after I ordered a cappuccino, the barrister started explaining to me
all the varieties of coffee that they have, which really impressed me,
since I went there a bit distracted and did not pay attention to the 
huge variety. She was super nice and the Arabic coffee was great!
(I ended up following her suggestion and did not get the cappuccino)

I can't wait to have more great coffee next time I go to San Fran.
author: Rafael O.

description: Mojito iced coffee was surprising light and delicious. A bit overpriced, but great for a quick grab and go!
author: Olivia N.

description: Philz staff are second to none. Very friendly. The coffee is good, but definitely a stronger coffee! Even with cream or milk, order it with extra as it can be a little bitter otherwise. The baked items are great. Worht stopping in for sure.
author: Jason M.

description:
You guys are quick, efficient, friendly, and make some delicious coffee. Whenever I've had questions, y'all have been pretty knowledgeable, and knew when to defer to others if there was ever something you were unsure on.  Me gusta.

Also, to the girl who always rocks the colorful eyeshadow, get it hunty :D *snaps*
Seriously, as a cosmetics whore myself, your style makes my day.
author: Michael A.

description:
DRINKS:
1.) Mint Coffe Mojito = Yum so good. This has got to be the best most unique coffee 
2.) Drip Coffees = otherwise their drip coffees r all so strong n tasty :) with the option for them to sweeten it or not. I used to get crazy caffeine buzz off Philz
3.) Veggie Quiche - oooh, of the food this is the best
4.) Meat Quiche - not as good as the veggie. Must have quiches toasted for you tho. Do not eat cold.
5.) Chocolate Croissant - I know I got a croissant before n it's true, you really can judge a coffee place by their pastries. yum. I had them toast it up a lil an it was perfection. 

SERVICE:
Good

ATMOSPHERE
I love this one. In the Castro Mission almost... I love the neighborhood here... and walkable distance from Dolores.. Small though.
author: Angela L.

description: Just wanted to update by saying no matter how busy this place gets, the staff are so on point , friendly, and just pleasures to order from. Lines don't stay big because they crank out that liquid love with precision. I like you guys A LOT
author: Lauren V.

description:
This review is purely for their mint mojito. I've heard so many good things about this drink and finalllllyyy it's my turn to try it. Yes it took a while for my drink to be prepared, but that just means more time was put into it right? At first I thought the barista was a little quiet and cold but he eventually sparked some small talk so I wasn't feeling  ignored. Anyway! This location is smaller than the one I've walked into at Berkeley (didn't order anything.. I know right?). But it's a nice little cozy area. 

As for my first indulgence into a cup of the mint mojito...it was not what expected...but better! Sooo refreshing. Not overly bitter or sweet. It's actually neither! I almost want to describe it as creamy... But that's not correct either. All in all, I definitely enjoyed it and would buy again. I think I may be biased too because I love mint flavored things. I'm glad Philz Coffee did not disappoint! Shall try the one Berkeley since it's closer to me :) 

Oh yes a small is $4 and large is $4.50 but that's how much Starbucks specialty drinks are...and I definitely think this mint mojito trumps Starbucks!
author: Christina N.

description: I took camomile and enjoyed it a lot! My parents had coffee and liked it like "4"... They have European taste
author: Nadav D.

description:
Best coffee in the Bay...hands down!  And the cute girl behind the counter adds about 5 bonus points.

Iced mint mojito...delish and refreshing on a sunny day.
Tesora mocha(medium sugar)...I melt into splendor every time.
author: Michelle H.

description: This location is busy mainly because there isn't a whole lot of space. I did try the mojito mint iced coffee that was recommended by a fellow Yelper which I actually liked. I'm more of a tea drinker and this Yelper said a friend of hers liked this drink and they were a tea drinker as well so I thought I'd give it a whirl. It has a sweet taste without being overly sweet and the mint leaves give it a nice minty flavour. I was wired for awhile though because like I said I don't enough caffeine so it gives me the shakes. Other than that, it's a fine little spot to catch up with old friends if you can swoop in and get a table.
author: Amy J.

description:
Philz is always going to be delicious, no matter what. The 3 stars is moreover for the location and setting (and I'm sure a 3 star rating won't hurt the 4.5 average rating anyway). This location is DEFINITELY more of a grab-and-go kind of Philz, not a place to lounge around at.

There are only 2 stations/baristas, so if it is busy it can get pretty crowded and take a while. There are I believe 4 small tables inside, and 2 tables outside for people to chat, read, do work, drink coffee, and let me tell you, if you do not get there early enough you will NEVER find a seat. People will definitely take their sweet ass time chatting and doing whatever to occupy the seats so don't plan on coming here to study or do work or anything.

Service is always friendly, per the usual. =)
author: Alex R.

description:
I have been to this location for many time. Philtered Soul with honey! Always get it right! :-)
The guys work here are very nice and very easy going. I will definitely stop by when in the neighborhood.
author: Luong T.

description: Love coming here when I visit my friends. This is an awkward location, being stuck next to a flower shop and laundry mat. The lines still regard to form regardless.
author: M C.

description: Delicious coffee, awesome ambience and cool decor. Love this place!
author: Kate E.

description: Friendly Service - Nice Menu - a bit pricey but different feel & nice atmosphere.  Ordered an Istanbul Cream Tea with Mint Leaves! Their menu was quite extensive & their coffee's looked really lovely. I'd like to try them sometime. What I liked about Philz Coffee was how happy every customer seemed with their Drinks. Everyone seemed pleasantly surprised and left with a bit of spark in their eye which a nice change of pace from the likes of Starbucks & Peet's. Philz seems more like a place you want to have coffee and sit down with someone and have a nice conversation or read a book or do some writing. It feels more about taking time out to enjoy every sip and not rush in and out. Their pastries are self serve and in a case of their own which was great too! I love that they have fresh mints and herbs and ingredients and I can't wait to try more beverages from their menu!
author: Julian I.

description: The mint mojito in my opinion taste like toothpaste but as you can see many ppl love it.  I go for the Tesora with medium sweetness which is always good.
author: Marcus D.

description:
I'm not sure I'll ever be able to drink an ordinary cup of coffee again. Ever. I'm almost in tears just thinking about what happened today..
I had the most incredible cup of coffee. I LOVE coffee. I knew there was amazing stuff out there, that I had yet to experience, but I am forever changed by this experience. I didn't know that fluid of any sort could taste this amazing.
author: Christopher L.

description:
You can never go wrong with Philz. Although I haven't had the chance to have it too often, I've definitely had my fair share since living in San Francisco. However, the only thing I have gotten is the Mint Mojito. As everyone has said, it is amazing and one of the best things I've ever had to drink. 
The caffeine content is not like those of a chain coffee shop, the last time I came here I got a coffee early in the morning and when I tried to go to sleep that night I found myself wide awake still. So you know it definitely does the job.
author: T L.

description: In my opinion the best coffee in SF. The interior design is not as modern or hip as some of the other big name coffee spots but I think the taste, quality and service is hard to beat.
author: Ryan M.

description:
I'm TOO hardcore for my friends...
...because Philz Coffee is too full-bodied for them to handle.  
Consider this my ad for new, more bada-s friends.  

Dear old friends, now you know why I stopped responding to your text messages.  

FYI- if this location had more seating, the roof would be set on fire.  Not only are the baristas great, they've consistently brewed my Mocha Tesora with the perfect amount of non-sweet that an angry, tiny thing like me would need, in order to punch raging taxis out of the way.
author: Diane N.

description:
On my first sip all I could say was, "Wow!"  Philz is doing something different here.... and I like it.  They are side stepping the espresso trend and going back to a pure coffee, but a coffee that will redefine how you think of "coffee."  

Upon walking it, it is honestly a little intimidating for a first come customer.  The board on the back wall lists the different kinds of brews they have... the problem is that outside the name of the kind of coffee there is no description of what that coffee was.  There was a couple in front of me that I'm pretty sure were first timers and I could tell they where having that problem.  Thankfully, I read a review from a yelper I trust (Thanks Lana N.!) and I ordered the Jacob Wonderbrew.  What I liked about the ordering process is that the barista asks you how you like your coffee to taste: not sweet, kind of sweet, medium sweet). I choose medium sweet and wow it was delicious.  It was probably a touch too sweet for my taste but that didn't hamper my enjoyment of it at all.  The coffee had a nice deep roasted flavor that was very pleasant and it was balanced well with the rich cream and sugar.

Overall...wow, I'm a fan and I will be back!
author: Rob P.

description:
I used to live at the end of the block so this was my spot for a while. I love their coffee, but I still think Blue Bottle is better. However, the variety a Philz keeps me coming back! I go for the Sooo Good or the Iced Mint Mojito Coffee. 

Their POS system is super old school and slows them down but the baristas are for the most part really pleasant folks, the kind of folks you want to run into in the morning before I've had my coffee-- which is saying a lot! 

All in all this is the best cafe to grab a coffee in the Castro by far.
author: Chris W.

description:
It's my first time at this location and I ordered myself an iced mojito. I had it at another Philz before where I asked for it to be less sweet. The other place's half sweet was still hella sweet, but this one makes it right! It was perfect! 

The baristas are nice and they are pretty fast. 

The iced mojito is addictive! Well, their coffees are too!
author: Mandy C.

description:
Philz has decent coffee made to order but it's not as fresh as a cup from rtiual or blue bottle. The way they brew the coffee here make for a really strong cup but they use manufacturing cream to cut the acidity. 

Manufacturing cream has higher fat content than whipping cream so it's like drinking a melted milkshake. If that's what you're in the mood for then it's great but if you want coffee that is good without adding things to it I suggest blue bottle or ritual. Also If you're looking for an awesome iced coffee don't get it at Philz unless you want the top of your mouth to feel like you just ate a stick of butter. Blue bottle has the best iced coffee around in my opinion.

To be clear you can get any of the drinks black or with milk/soy, but in my opinion they are not as good that way as other coffee shops I've mentioned in San Francisco.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I dream about their MINT MOJITOS. 

A friend told me I should get their mint mojito, but I was skeptical because I couldn't imagine mint in my coffee... how would they get it sweet, creamy, and mint at the same time... I'm so glad I listened to my friend because it was amazing! 

It was the first time I had Philz, and it was so so good!

The service was great as well, the baristas are very friendly and easy going :)
author: Esther S.

description:
I feel like this particular Philz is more of a secret than their other locations throughout the city, but like their brothers and sisters on Van Ness, 24th Street and beyond... they offer up a mean cup of coffee.

All of the favorites you'd come to expect, but without the hassle of waiting in a huge line. It's much smaller than their other locations, so it can get busy occasionally... but I've had pretty good luck getting in and out of there during my visits.

It's right next to a laundromat called Sit and Spin (love the pun, considering it's in the Castro), so you can get your clothes nice and sparkly while sippin' on some of the best coffee in San Francisco.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Hearing all the raves about the mint mojito, I decided to give it a try. The drink was alright but I had better. The drink tasted a bit watery which was weird. The flavors just wasn't there. I like how Philz has an assortment of unique blends. The menu is vast and a bit confusing. But i like it. 

I'll try and give Philz another go.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Do they put crack in their coffee? Everything I've tried here has a crazy kick, and the mint drinks are a real treat. One star off for being too pricey, long lines, disgusting bathroom, and shamelessly upping prices sometimes.
author: Cambridge Y.

description:
The world's best coffee is at Philz. It is the best coffee in the universe if you have them make it. I love to have an Ether with cream and splenda. It's an amazing buzz akin to the one you get from chocolate at Angelina's in Paris (yes that Paris) It is a clean buzz that doesn't have you looking over your shoulder for a narc. 

Phil if you ever want to open up a shop in Philly, just let me know. I would quit my job in a minute to manage it.
author: Gordon M.

description:
Suck it Ritual, Philz is the best.

Had the Soooo Good and it was so good. It's brewed by the cup and the barista does some crazy pouring from cup to cup to aerate and cool the coffee. It was awesome. It's considered their lighter roast, but it was utterly satisfying.

I can't wait for another cup of Philz.
author: Andy K.

description:
Coffee: 5/5
service: 5/5
decor/cleanliness:3/5 can't complain, this is more to-go than a large sit in place.

Philz Coffee is sooooo good. I haven't tried their plain coffees or lattes, but their other specialty coffees are sooo good. This is definitely not your typical chain grade coffee shop. I think once people try Philz, it's hard to go back to other more ubiquitous places. Most of their drinks are $3-3.50 for a small size. With the Mocha being one of the more expensive drinks. But you have to try it, you get those gritty chocolate bits at the bottom of your cup that actually taste like dark chocolate. I haven't tried the other locations yet, but I hope they are as good as it is here.
author: Cecile S.

description: I use to love Blue Bottle, but then I finally went to Philz - which I'd heard about for many years, but never been. Their coffees are rich and smooth. I have suggested they do special tasting events since I do not know one blend from another, so I usually just ask them to make a recommendation. I have never been disappointed. I am a believer and a convert. End of story...
author: Dana L.

description: iced mint mojito ummm yes every time.
author: Kristan B.

description: What's there to say? Best cup of coffee you're going to get from a chain, and it's not crazy expensive either. Love coffee in the Castro. So many men, all flirtatious!
author: Sean B.

description:
Who knew coke/crack cocaine could be sold for 4-4.50 dollas with a dash of happy smiles and goofy fits...thank you Philz for making me broke.

So my best friend told me about the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee circa 2010, and I've been hooked since...2011. My favorite coffee shop by far in the city (though I have yet to explore the rest, so don't be thinkin' I'm the coffee guru). 

To be one hunin' with the world I've only gotten the Mint Mojito iced coffee, and what can I say, it's nothing short of dank. Has that rich creamy flavor and that wonderful fresh sweetness. Honestly I can drink this instead of water! Usually coffee makes me uber thurssssty but this stuff quenches my thirst and also puts me on a whole 'notha level of caffeinated euphoria...rolling bowling balls status. 

It is a little pricey, and the wait is usually a wittle witch if you're coming at prime time hour. Sometimes there is a little inconsistency with the sweetness, but you just gotta know how to order (medium sweet, or little sweet, or hella sweet)...it takes time.

BUT GO.
author: Eryn K.

description:
I am not a huge coffee drinker, but maybe it's because when I drink it, I want it to be good.  I live in Seattle, the land of Starbucks, which I don't consider the best coffee.   

I was not disappointed by Philz at all!  I hadn't had coffee that good since Spain.  The staff was patient and helped us make informed decisions as it was our first time there.  I had the Mocha Tesora and it was very delicious. There was no medicinal burnt bean taste left in my mouth.  It was good start to finish.  

I heard the Mint Mojito (iced) is really good.  I only wish I could change one thing and that's the location.  Move it to Seattle and I'd be there everyday!  Love it!
author: Dawn L.

description:
Gotta love Philz Coffee. After seeing all the reviews for the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, we had to try it. It was as good as advertised. Surprisingly, they put actual mint sprigs in there! I got a mouthful of them in one my sips and was a bit startled. Our brother-in-law got a mocha drink and was raving about it afterward. He had Blue Bottle coffee the next day and hated it!

The service was excellent. We came in a large group with some family visiting from out of town, so the barista asked if this was our first time. A few people raised their hands, so he patiently explained how Philz does their thing. Our family went to Philz every day afterwards until they left town.
author: Jang K.

description: I like my coffee bold and full bodied and Philz hit the spot!! This place is super hipster to me, people chilling outside, on their laptop or just straight chilling. The walls are graffiti'd up with murals and there's a bulletin in the place with flyers of local events and such. Got the iced coffee, which was deeeeeeeeeee-licious!
author: Angela L.

description:
On a hot Dolores Park day...

There is no better way to start the dance/"seen and be seen" fest....

Than an iced cup of Philz Mint Tea.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Great, friendly staff. The cashier was wearing a tiara; he pulled it off quite nicely.

I've never tried the turkish brew but thankfully I did because it was amazing. I had it dark with cream and sugar. Delicious! I've tried the famous mint mojito iced coffee, not a fan, the mint was a bit too light and nonexistent.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I actually started drinking coffee this year. Call me a late bloomer. The thing is I prefer tea over coffee, but Philz pretty much is the exception. I go for the Mocha when I want to feel decadent or the Ambrosia when I need a pick-me-up. 

Now, like I said, I'm not very into the coffee scene, so I find the description words next to each item on the menu extremely helpful as guideline for what I'm feeling that day, especially since they have a really big menu. But really, I haven't found anything on the menu that you should avoid, so try your luck and I bet you'd be happy with what you get. If you're an indecisive one, they know what questions to ask you to lead you to your perfect cup of coffee. They also are pretty knowledgable about coffee in general since I've heard them do some coffee talk and field questions from customers, so ask away.

Compared to the other locations, this is one is smaller. But somehow, I've always managed to grab a seat inside to do some reading. Inside, most people are working away on laptops while outside is a great place to sit on a bench and people watch.

Also, beware: the dog outside the store is fake. I've tried to pet it multiple times thinking it was a customer's dog... 

5 stars!!!!!!
author: Brian M.

description:
This coffee may be the reason we move to San Francisco. Seriously.  Holy cow is this an amazing cup of coffee.  I am typically a latte drinker, so I scoffed at first at the idea of having a "regular" cup of coffee.  Our master of a barista completely killed any fantasy of enjoying coffee elsewhere ever again.  Jacob's Wonderbar Brew tends to be my drink of choice, loaded with cream and sugar, and every sip is a revelation.

Blue bottle who?  This is the best coffee you will ever have. Period.
author: Julie B.

description:
Had I known that Philz makes THE PERFECT CUP OF COFFEE, I would've dragged my lame ass here sooner. Years sooner.

I guess it's better late than never.
author: Anastasia B.

description: totally would not have realized philz was here if not gps.  it is small, right next to a laundromat.  they have a few small tables inside and 2 bigger ones outside.  same menu, great drip coffees/speciality drinks and friendly ppl.
author: Linda T.

description:
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  Period.  Yum.

The time i ordered it, they told me its already premixed coffee and I guess can't really tailor it to your liking.   Nonetheless, it was pretty good.
author: Mabel C.

description: Philz never disappoints me. Love the friendly batistas and all their drinks. Their mint mojito is a must try.
author: H K.

description:
This place is always a regular meet up of mines with my sf homies. Best convos were born in here......

Best service and very friendly baristas......
Yummy Samosas!
author: Rae R.

description: Best coffee! They make STRONG, just the way I like. They fix it up with your custom cream and sugar order for ya. They break it down by levels of strength and analyze the flavors beautifully. You end up getting exactly what you want. Definitely bringing some home to Atlanta.
author: Claire W.

description:
Oh man, PHILZ COFFEE. Where do I start.

Whether you order coffee or their absolutely delicious chai tea with soymilk, I'm sure you'll enjoy your drink so much that you'll soon be returning here. They used to have vegan sticky buns at the Castro location, which were my favorite, but they always offer vegan doughnuts, which are just as delicious and will make your experience just as great as you expect it to be.
author: Sade R.

description: Why haven't I discovered this earlier? Coffee is way better. I have been getting the ginger snap (hot). I still haven't tried their signature mint monitor but I think that's next! Really nice staff as well
author: Jamie D.

description:
I'm not much of a coffee drinker, nor do I know much about coffee, so I'm not going to pretend I know how good Philz is just because everyone says so. 

I've been living in SoCal for the past three years, and Philz seems to be the hip coffee joint in the past year. I recently visited my hometown over the long weekend, and met up with a friend for coffee. My friend took me to Philz being that I never had it. He asked if I liked minty coffee drinks, and I responded "yeah...I like the Starbucks peppermint mocha." He then proceeded to order me a mint mojito, sweet and creamy.

My cup of coffee was presented like a mojito - mint leaves and ice, except in an insulated coffee cup with no rum. I took one sip, and at last, I was no longer a Philz virgin. At first I thought it was kind of weird - my mind is thinking "caution - hot!" but it's actually cold when I drink it. I have to be honest that it threw me off a little, but as I continued to drink it, it grew on me. 

By the time I was done, I was pretty wired. Attempted to take a nap that afternoon, but couldn't. For those of you who need a booster, I think Philz might be the answer.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Try: Coffee
Skip: Lavendar Cookies

Love!! With outdoor seating and a laubdromat next door, this is the perfect place to chill, study, people watch, work, and do laundry.

The cookies were bought from an outside vendor. Maybe I'm just not used to vegan cookies, or glutan-free sweets, but it had a weird powdery texture. But I don't really come here for the sweets (unless their in dark liquid form). 

I love you Philz!
author: Sue Y.

description: A bit of a line, not much space to sit and work, but come for the amazing coffee specialties. I don't even like coffee but their coffee mojitos are incredible. The cream they add is heavenly but super rich, so you can also choose soy milk. It's not as great, but won't upset the tummy, and the mint leaves and 1/2 tea, 1/2 coffee mix are yummy no matter which way you have it. The staff is always nice and the snacks are all local, mostly organic and great tasting as well.
author: Dani B.

description: Great coffee, small spot, but I was able to snag an outlet after a 5 minute wait and they have freeeeeeeeeee wiiiiiffffffiiiiiii. (Cus everyone in SF works from a coffee shop, right?)
author: Emily D.

description:
It was my first time...and it was made with extra special care and love. Thankfully the guy asked me how sweet I like it, because my friend's was a little too sweet for my tastes. But anyways, this place is awesome. I'm excited to go back and try different drinks, because everything sounded awesome. I really liked the personal effect of my own cup of coffee being made specially for me, and maybe it was all in my head, but I think it tasted better too. 

Only downside is that its a bit pricey for a cup of coffee, but I'd say its worth it.
author: Krista S.

description: I love the Philz in Palo Alto, so I was sure I'm going to love the SF ones. This was actually my first time trying Philz in SF, since I wanted to expose my good college friend Kathleen T to great NorCal coffee. (I'm not an avid coffee drinker myself, but I knew she had to try the mint mojito! She LOVED it.) This Philz is kinda small but loving the vibe. Service was GREAT... always love it when cashiers/servers are accommodating and understanding when two friends are fighting over who pays. (Of course the visitor doesn't.) Fantastic coffee and awesome service... what more can you ask for?
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I'd describe Philz Coffee as coffee full of fun&personality. Its not as intense as Blue Bottle (imo), and its definitely not boring like your generic Starbucks. Philz Coffee is full of fun&pizazz, and you won't find coffee like it anywhere else. If you haven't tried Philz, definitely do! I grab some every time I'm up in the bay.

If you're into chocolatey-sweet, my personal favorite is the Jacob's Wonderbrew... meh on the Mocha Tesora.
author: Lana N.

description:
Tried this spot again.  Seem like you just gotta find the coffee you like.  I'm not a fan on that turkish spice they use, but I tried the Jacob's Wonderbar and Aromatic______ and i was a big fan.  

Friendly staff always ready with recommendations if you tell them what you like.


Line usually moves pretty quick.
author: Steven F.

description:
They were so nice here! I loved the people who were assisting me - and they were like - totally happy to let me photograph them and post it here.

The coffee was really good. The guy asking me what I wanted seemed to pick just the right drink for me.

This is an interesting and unique place - they treat coffee differently than most places. Gotta try it.
author: Jason B.

description:
The servers are super friendly. And the coffee could not be any fresher. But if you like cream or sugar in your coffee, you likely will be disappointed. That's because Philz will not allow you to add your own cream or sugar.  The servers invariably add too much -  even if you request just a little. Why? Because "just a little" is too subjective.  Their idea of "a little" is much more than mine.  In the end, you wait a long time for a cup of coffee that is not drinkable because there is too much cream and sugar in it.

This is equivalent of going to a restaurant where they remove the salt and pepper shakers from the table and insist on putting it on the food for you.  How could they possibly know what is the right amount?

Sad. I won't be returning.
author: Leonard G.

description:
Mint Mojito - you are a fabulous orgasm in a cup.

Canopy of Heaven - you get me high and I thought I didn't do drugs.  
Guess I just drink them.

The end.
author: Athena S.

description:
MINT. MOJITO.... justifies every one of those five stars and more... 

I was sort not impressed with the coffee (but I admit I should try it again).  However, someone told me to get the mint mojito and I've NEVER had anything else like it. Get extra mint too, just do it. Mmmm....
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Xtra hot coffee and guys you don't have to worry about.

j/k

On rainy days such as the following we've had as of late, my inclinations will find me with a stack of books and my vat of extra hot Breve Latte.  I've been behind on my reading, so lately I have several books in tow:  Günter Grass The Flounder (advice from a Platichthys Flesus, totally trustworthy) , Sartre's The Wall (need a little passion in my life right now) and copies of chapters 1-6 of  Deutsch: Na klar!  I find a nice seat by the window, share if I have to.  My Breve Latte is always full bodied and smooth.  They never cheat you by layering on the foam and mine comes special with a big heart of love on top.

Ah, the beauty of urban retreats.  I do not mind sharing a table.  Although sharing a table with a beautiful gay man is equally distracting, I must confess. This location makes me feel right at home.  Warm.  Friendly.  And the baristas are always up for a great chat.

Summertime can find me outside.  With shades on and watching people incognito.

Ich liebe das!
author: Miika M.

description:
Since all the reviews wax sonnets over how amazing the coffee here is (still great!), I'll talk about the super nice barista :D

Very nice people! A few friends and I stopped at this location on a lovely WARM SF day and we all ordered a small mint mojito (which is fab!). Apparently, a lot of other people ordered the same drink too, and another patron might have accidentally taken one member of our group's mint mojito. There were two medium sized mojitos still sitting on the counter, and the barista who made the drinks for us told my remaining friend that he could just take both of them since somebody took his. Yay, thanks nice barista! :D
author: Mary C.

description: Sooo...I don't drink coffee. But that's ok, I still love this Philz. Why, you ask? Because it is a great place to hang out while I do my laundry at Sit and Spin. And they have delicious vegan treats!! Plus, I have to admit, the coffee does smell good. Is it possible to get a residual caffeine buzz through smell?
author: Jon T.

description: Although I'm NOT a coffee drinker, I had the herbal mint tea and an almond croissant. The mint herbal tea was AMAZING; they brewed it with real mint leaves and the perfect amount of honey to give it the right sweetness. This was by far the best cup of tea I've ever had, and I'm craving it as I'm writing this review...
author: Lillian C.

description:
I'm not a big coffee drinker, but my friend wanted to try Philz so we headed over there. 

MINT MOJITO ICED COFFEE: She recommended this drink saying it was pretty famous. I usually don't like fresh mint (except in a cocktail ^_~) because I find the flavor too strong, but the mint wasn't overpowering in the coffee. I liked how this coffee was really light and refreshing, not like other places that can drown their coffees in sugar and flavored syrup. 

If you are a coffee aficionado, you should definitely check this place out!
author: Chrissy C.

description:
This is one of my favorite Philz! It's cozy in the middle of a residential area so it's never too crowded. And walking distance from Dolores park, Bi-Rite, Delfina, Tartine, and free residential parking usually available. 

I had the new Mint Iced Coffee.....AMAZING. It's not too sweet nor too bitter so that it really quenches your thirst, which is a very rare quality in coffee - hot or iced.
author: Amy M.

description: This location is one of the smaller and more quaint Philz I've been to. I don't live in the bay area and as the mint mojito is the jam to my peanut butter, I absolutely have to get a cup whenever I do visit. The day I came to this location, it was pouring rain and cold, so I faced the dilemma of cold drink on a cold day, or try the mint mojito hot. Well, I tried it hot, and it was... interesting. It was exactly how you would expect mint creamy coffee to taste hot, but I didn't love it. I recommend braving the cold and sticking with the iced mint mojito. Anywas, the barista didn't give me any weird looks when I asked for it hot, plus she was totally friendly and had kickass blue eyeshadow on, so I'd give her a 5 in my book. Same quality of coffee all around, this is as great a location as any!
author: Jessica C.

description: I just don't like the coffee that they serve. I know they are an SF institution and the people there are a little bit more cool than your average coffee bar... but, there is something so odd about the mouth feel of the coffee at these places, it has 2x the air and 4x the caffine, I don't like it.... but I like places that do well and do something different so they get a middling review.
author: Thadd L.

description:
My fav Philz - I may have an obsession with small cafes.  
I feel somehow the coffee taste the best at this Philz and it is nice to sit outside of this store.
author: Kali F.

description:
When I lived on 17th Street 2 years ago, I used to go to Philz Coffee every weekend. I was addicted.

Even though the cap was cheap and it would routinely spill down my arm (you know that kind of lid), I would lick down my arm just to savor every last drop. I was that desperate OR just that appreciative. ;) Phil would make it --- back in the early days of this store being open -- and then he'd offer me free baklava, which I always savored later in the day.

I love Philz special blend with cardomom and mint. It's awesome. Every cup, if you don't tell them otherwise, is made (fresh by the cup) with cream and sugar. So, if you're lactose-intolerant, or don't like sugar, tell them!

If you do like cream and sugar, get the full experience -- Philz isn't just coffee, it's an experience, and it's the best coffee experience I've ever had.
author: Heather S.

description:
Several individuals have recommended Philz to me... and as a big coffee fan, I can't believe I didn't go sooner. 

I tried the mint mojito iced coffee and loved it! It's sweet and minty. It's an excellent pick me up for late in the afternoon. It's $4.00 for a small, which is a bit steep, but seriously, where else can you get this coffee? And who knew that mint and coffee go so well together? Maybe I'm slow and didn't get the memo... regardless, I'm glad I stopped by today.

The store is a little small though, so don't expect that you'll find seating. However, no worries.. just take it to go. You'll look totally happening with a cup of Philz in your hand.
author: Cassy H.

description:
Great coffee and a quaint little shop.

Highlights:
-fun atmosphere
-good service
-great variety of good coffee
author: Larissa A.

description:
The coffee texture is perfect, even richer than hot cocoa. Its not watery like just about all coffees, allowing you to fully enjoy the roast and creation of this morning treat.

If it's your first time here, like it was mine, wait on the right to order then pay on the left. You'll be picking up your order from the person you ordered directly from. The baristas were super friendly :) and knew I was a first timer there, cause I bet I looked confused, so they told me where to pay and pick up my order.

P.S. Loved the tiara!
author: Jayme N.

description:
Super friendly staff. Delicious coffee and tea. I'm completely addicted.

My only complaint would be the system for ordering and paying. It's not so clear which line to stand in, who's already been helped vs. who's waiting, etc.
author: Enrique V.

description:
Sometimes, I'm glad that it's impossible to find parking around Dolores Park.  Whenever I want to eat at Delfina, Tartine, Kasa, or Ike's, I always end up getting Philz.

Some people might say that Philz is too expensive at around $3.50+ per cup, but I think it's really reasonable for the quality.  Much better than Peets, Tullys, Starbucks.  What's even better is that the baristas at Philz actually know their flavor profiles for their drinks.  Every time I tell them I trust them to control the level of sweetness, and they are always spot on.  When I want vanilla soy milk, they are even considerate enough to ask me if I want less sugar because vanilla soy is sweeter.  AWESOME.  Just too awesome.  I wish there was one closer to me!!
author: Anna T.

description:
THis place doesn't need any great reviews as they have plenty BUT cannot pass up the opportunity to say this is a unique, delicious, and 1 of a kind place!   

Give them a shot for sure I am so Happy with this place everytime I go. I get the "Canopy of Heaven" its a Lite roast therefor MEGA caffeine! I love to get my buzz on so this place does it for me. Try them out and you will think of me!!! 

Heres the deal yes it takes maybe about 5-6 minutes to get your coffee (usually during busy times) but its EXCELLENT quality! I am a COMPLETE weirdo with my coffee and because they run  so strong I can't remember how many splendas I need when I get them and the worker Jayden said "no problem you can bring it back" I did, and it was no problem! He was very nice and I really enjoy good customer service. 

On a side note, I was there for 5 hours and no one made me feel I outstayed my welcome. I had a lot of work to do and me and my friend ordered 2 coffees a piece as our thanks for our stay.

YUmmy coffee and just as important, great customer service! = I feel special and welcome= Who cares that its like a whole $1.50 more? 
Quality and detailed customer service is whats needed in the Castro. 

THAnK YOU PHILZ
author: Mike R.

description: Not my favorite Philz. It's small and crowded, and I don't know if it was just the day, but the baristas were not very smiley. I ordered my usual Iced Mint Mojito and it came out lukewarm....I don't think they added much ice to it. A bummer on such a hot day.
author: Melody L.

description:
I can't believe I've never tried Philz until 2 days ago. For all the days I downed coffee during high school and college, I didn't think of treating myself to Philz. (Thank you Anna T. for bringing me, now we just need to figure out a way to take this intravenously.)

The Mocha Tesora is divine. It's AMAZING freshly brewed coffee with chocolate taste. The mocha settled and was a little too overbearing (and powdery) for me at the end but the initial taste was out of this world. I love dark roasts and I drink my coffee black so I got the Mocha Tesora w/o any added sugar, cream etc. I think I might even ask for a little less mocha next time and will definitely stir it a bit more myself near the end.

This is more expensive than your usual cup of coffee but with the great service and excellent tastes, it's worth every penny. I want to try every single blend! I'm so excited to go back again for another caffeine hit.
author: Lucy D.

description:
Using its powers of temptation, this Philz location has consistently delayed my commute home after work.  It has been crucial to meditate on the reminder that I do not need a cup at 5 in the afternoon when I am already done with the work day.  However, when there is a visible parking spot along the block, my resolve fails.

The more limited seating in this Philz provides a cozy feel.  The couple of tables outside provide an entrance to people-watching in this bustling neighborhood.  The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and ensures cups are satisfactory.

Whenever I think about coffee, Philz comes to mind first!
author: Andrew M.

description:
O_O  and  =D

You will look like the first face and then the second after having Philz because:

1. The dark roast is as strong as my guns (the physical kind, no ammo needed)
2. The cups are just as strong.  No sleeve needed.  What an idea!
3. Clever coffee names ie. Anesthesia & Ether.  Love it.
4. Super friendly service.
5. Simplistic ordering: Small or Large, Cream or none, Lil Sweet Medium Sweet or Sweeeet.  (I like it suh-weet!)
6. It's damn delicious.

Philz.  Do it.
author: Heidi L.

description:
I am not a coffee fan.  Having said that, this was before I ever experienced Philz.  The Mint Mojito blows my mind and taste buds.  The caffeine kick is insane, and the staff is super friendly.  

If you enjoy coffee, or even if you don't I recommend Philz!
author: Tiffany L.

description: I am so happy to be back in the Bay Area and to have easy access to Philz coffee. The beans are high quality, the roasts are never burnt (at least not yet) and the perfected pour-over technique gives me delicious coffee at an instantly-sippable temperature every time. I usually order my drinks sweet and creamy which makes them extra delicious, so if you're not calorie/ diabetes/ heart disease conscious, I recommend giving that a try. I also love that the barista asks if you're satisfied with your drink before you leave the counter. Excellent coffee and excellent service.
author: Malini K.

description:
Excellent coffee. Fancy without the attitude of the hipster roasters (although I love me high quality beans and will drive and find a parking spot in search of the hippest newest roaster.)

Philz does coffee. Good coffee. 

Each cup individually made. Ask if you don't know what bean to try. The people here are nice and love to talk coffee.Try the silken splendor.

PS- I drink it black--which means it needs to taste good:) Gone are my days of Starbucks where I would put three sugars and a cup of cream in to kill the taste. This is worth the extra walk and few cents more.
author: Dani K.

description:
This location is pretty small and seems to cater towards the "to-go" crowd.  There aren't many tables.  

I, like many others, enjoyed the mint mojito iced coffee.
author: Jen G.

description:
Iced mint mojito definitely met expectations.  I don't know if it was just this one location on Castro St., however, I can't say I was comfortable with how the barista handled my order with her bare hands. At one point I saw the tip of her finger go into my drink as she was topping my coffee with mint leaves. 

Tip: order a small drink in a large cup of ice.
author: Choi C.

description:
I do prefer this over blue bottle (in terms of straight up coffee)...why did I mention coffee only?  Well only Cali ppl think the term coffee includes lattes, capps and other types of warm caffeinated drinks.... 

I like to stick to the tesora and can't go wrong with it!  Get it done Philz way since its not too sweet nor bitter (is that how you spell it?)
author: Jeong K.

description: Supposedly best coffee that can turn into an addiction.  Good thing I don't drink coffee.  I had tea instead.  Pretty interesting with the mint!  The highlight was on the street!  I was utterly amused by this old man walking wearing nothing but a bag and a little something in the front (not a thong, smth just covering the tip... don't know what I will call that).
author: Ro C.

description:
Ahh, philz. how i miss it. my friend and i came to Castro and were freezing to death and in desperate need for some coffee so we wandered over here on the way to Dolores Park.
the two guys working were theeeee cutest, nicest, and most helpful guys ever. what i LOVE, is that they hand-make each individual cup of coffee, so it's guaranteeeeeed to be hot and fresh. there were so many different roasts to choose from i couldn't make up my mind and i ended up getting my old-faithful mocha. how can you go wrong?
but not only was this mocha fresh and perfectly sweetened, but it was so rich and creamy i didn't know weather to jump behind the counter and kiss the guys working there or to get another cup. 
AND i didn't get my usual crash after having a big, strong, cup of coffee. 

in a word, perfection.
i love you philz. i'll be back soon.
author: Amanda S.

description:
We stopped here on our "Real SF Tour" (which I highly recommend).  Philz was one of the local spots the tour took a detour for us - thank goodness!    

I was totally overwhelmed by the menu board so I let the super nice guy behind the counter brew up what he thought I'd like based solely on his visual impression of me.  After a brief second durin which he apparently summoned the spirit of  "Carnac the coffee seer" he made me a Jacob Wonderbrew (magical powers had he!)   

Other reasons this was a great spot (1) there is a clean bathroom in the adjoining laudromat and (2) Darling daughters saw a full grown man out front SOBBING (like a girl) while being comforted by a couple of women.  You can't make this stuff up!
author: Kelli R.

description:
For me, and I'm just saying for me people, so don't get your knickers in a bunch, Blue Bottle puts out a better cup.

Philz gets big points for being the friendliest, those guys make you want to go back to get sprinkled with lovedust.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Love the coffee here...so delicious and unique!  Made a visit earlier this month.  Dropped by to their Castro location after grabbing lunch at Ike's.  Usually I go to the Van ness location but decided to give this place a try. People like Polo make this place even better... Happy New Year and thanks for a great experience this morning!

; )
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Let me start by saying that, as a law student, I quickly became addicted to coffee.  In my first year, I heavily ingested large quantities of Starbucks.  Starbucks, however, always tastes watered down to me, and there is a very assembly-line quality to it.  Don't get me wrong, I know several who prefer Starbucks, so I don't want to be libelous, but it's never quite worked out for me.

In my second year of law school, I switched to Peet's Coffee.  This is certainly a step up in my mind, as it was tastier, smoother and altogether a better cup of joe.  Still, it, like Starbucks, lacks any sense of individuality, as I again felt as though every cup I had was subject to a wide variety of flavors, consistencies and/or quality.  If I ever needed a quick jolt, I'd go here.

In my third year of law school, I discovered Blue Bottle! What a rush.  It certainly does the job to get you hammered, so I give it credit for that.  However, as law school has dwindled down, my dependence on coffee has given way to a deeper appreciation for the habit that is coffee drinking.  More often than not, I now prefer coffee for the experience, more than for the rush.  Though enjoyable, I find that Blue Bottle cannot provide me a genuine, relaxed happiness in this manner, and on a consistent basis.  Alas, I moved on.

Then I discovered Philz.  Now I had heard of Philz, quite often actually, for years before I finally tried it.  I can safely say now that I drive out of my way to get a cup on almost a daily basis.  The rest of the reviews in this section touch on way this is so:

1.  They will make your coffee individually, filtered only for you, and they will ice the coffee as you prefer.
2.  They ask you how much creme and sweetener you want, and are consistent with these additions EVERY SINGLE TIME (cough, ahem, Starbucks fail).
3.  They ask you to taste your coffee before taking it, so as to make sure that you are 100% satisfied.
4.  They put a mint leaf in the coffee for ambiance, as well as taste. 

I am never, ever disappointed with Philz.  Ever.

I highly suggest the #3 Philharmonic, Iced, Medium/Medium Sweet.  it is a good, relaxed, lighter coffee.  I only wish Philz had a frequent buyer card.  Alas, they know I'll be back anyways. :(
author: Bryan H.

description: Best drip coffee in the city. If you feel intimidated by the menu just ask the baristas what they recommend and what you typically like to drink. They'll get you something good. They have tea too but I've never tried it. You are on your own there!
author: J S.

description: Best coffee in San Francisco. Everybody that works there is nice and they are always sure to set the proper expectations for the amount of time a drink will take.  I have purchased several bags of coffee beans to brew at home. "Philz So Good" is the best.
author: Amber S.

description: If I ever were to have to go to a laundromat, I'd go out of my way for two key reasons: Philz is here, and there's a patio for a dog. If I've seen a better business model, it probably had to do with a laundromat with pinball & beer, or the As Seen On TV kiosk at Walgreen's. The Philz employees here are experts, accommodating if it's your first time, and efficient. The one cup at a time caffeinated soulful cups you know from around town are served here, at the same prices, and in the Castro sun... the iced option with mint is going to bring all the milk shakes to the boys (that's how it goes, yeah?).
author: Jon A.

description: Pretty amazing coffee!
author: Kathy S.

description:
Had the Philharmonic (medium sweetness and medium creme - $3.25) today and it was heaven! I'm a fan now. :) 

However, parking is HORRIBLE on the weekends. The boyfriend and I circled around for half an hr and couldn't find any parking. Ended up at the Mission location.
author: Carrie Y.

description:
The first time I had coffee here, a transexual dressed in a clown costume walked in and wanted to hang up fliers. It's the Castro, so not a big deal.

The Product: so many coffee choices! They do their own blends of coffee, so you won't find these anywhere else. It's a little bit pricey for a cup of coffee, but certainly not enough for me to stop coming here. If you like the various tastes of coffee, this is your place.

The Venue: Small indoor seating, small outdoor seating, and certainly not a good study spot. A great place to have a chat, or just pick up your coffee and go enjoy the Castro.

Overall: I am a fan of huge seating areas when it comes to cafe experiences. I'd give Philz 5 stars if this location had more places to sit down and enjoy my coffee while I also get some school work done. Great coffee and little seating is a solid 4/5 stars.
author: Gun-Ik P.

description:
Goodbye Starbucks. I have lived in the city for 2 yrs., and I have finally discovered Philz Coffee. I would jump in front of a MUNI bus for this coffee. The menu of the different types of beans available is huge. It would take at least a month of hardcore coffee drinking to get through the whole menu.
I really don't know how to explain it, but the coffee is well made kinda like your Grandma baking you a cake with love. There are no frapps or double whipped just straight coffee with cream or sugar of course making it the drink that has lasted for thousands of years.

This is the smallest out of all the Philz stores in SF, but it is able to handle the Castro area very well. Like every store it smells like a coffee store not with horrible music playing just the grinding of the machines, and the water pouring. Like always the staff is very friendly, and i am sure knowledgeable about the coffee even though i am scared to ask which is the best...it's like asking what is the best wine at dinner. Even though the store is small you can drink your coffee on the chairs outside or walk to Dolores Park a few blocks away.

If your looking for a cool local coffee shop that's not a cliché this is the place to be.
author: Nathan M.

description:
They are SO nice here!!! I've been to all locations and (they're all friendly, but) this place has the best service! I swear I had asked for a Philharmonic, but he said I asked for (and thereby made) a Philtered Soul. I thought "Whatever, all the coffees are awesome" but I'm trying to taste all of them. I went to go pay for my friend's and my coffee...he comp'd me for mine! AWWW.... super sweet! The gal there with the curly brown hair is always crazy upbeat and nice. 

24th street is a bit more intimidating, Van Ness and SOMA has better seats, Castro is a bit small. 

If it's your first time, always have the coffee with cream and however sweet you want it (lightly, medium, sweeet). It's just not the same with milk =).
author: Christine Y.

description:
Without criticizing other cups of coffee in the Bay Area, I strongly feel Philz brews the best in SF.  With delicious blends and knowledgeable creators, there is something for everyone here!  While so many choices can be a little intimidating at first, if you are unsure of what to select, the staff members are always more than happy to help based upon your preferences.  This location provides a laid back, fun atmosphere perfect for a stop at any time of day.

Specific recommendation: for light-medium coffee lovers, try the Dancing Water (with cinnamon added!) - it's unbelievably delicious.
author: J J.

description: The barista walk me step by step to find the perfect drink for me. After the first sip I was glad the process was not just hype. If you don't know what to get definitely ask. Perfect drink for any time of day.
author: Hovik N.

description:
This is my crack. 

Take it with cream
Take it with sugar
Leave a tip 

Chai
Philharmonic
Turkish

I like it all! With a mint leaf of course and a vegan donut YUM
author: Katherine B.

description:
This is what coffee is all about - rich, full bodied, bold and aromatic - and brewed individually. Tesora is highly recommended medium roasted with a hint of cardammon.  Have the baristas mix a little cream and sugar to balance the delicate sweet bitterness and oiliness of the beans. Even their green teas are brewed individually to perfection. A sprig of fresh mint leaves adds a hint of coolness. Catch me here working on my computer, reading or meeting friends. Say hi and enjoy the neighborhood feel. Seating area can be a bit cramped and lighting is low but when you have a good cup of joe in hand the rest of the world don't matter ;)

Sit and Spin laundromat is located behind the cafe, so while sitting, spinning, and getting your dirty laundry done...well, you may as well wait for the hot cycle to finish...off.
author: Errol F.

description: Really good coffee. I had their #6 "ecstatic" iced coffee. It was awesome: lots of coffee flavors and not too sweat. Yes, sweat.
author: Thomas C.

description: As a NY coffee snob, one of the best cups I've ever had! Love the personally brewed cups, fresh beans on display. The menu is descriptive for roast and taste. Also loved the attention to detail for sweetness and cream levels. I got the Jacob Wonderbar and my husband the Tesoro. We went twice to the Castro location while visiting the SF area :-)
author: Jackie B.

description:
Philz. I am in love with you. 

It was a chance encounter. I was at the Castro. I needed coffee. 

You were right there.

I couldn't understand your menu. But I took a chance on the turkish blend. The girl at the counter brewed my cup fresh. I felt special, even if everyone gets it that way.

The cream was good; the sugar were good; the mint leaves - heavenly. You didn't have to, but you did. 

I don't know how many sips it took, but I knew - I was in love. No one but Philz could ever make me feel the same again.

I hope to see you again soon. Same place?
author: Shan R.

description:
I'm not a huge coffee person and am always hesitant to drop the cash for some joe, but Philz is a different story.   Each cup is brewed individually and the staff is super knowledgeable about all of the options.  I've had the Tesora and the Silken Splendor, both of which were delicious.  Philz is even a favorite for my roommate, who usually despises coffee but is obsessed with the mint mojito iced coffee.

I'd suggest taking the coffee to go as it is usually packed and has limited seating.  The separate lines for ordering and paying can also get a big chaotic.  They don't have an espresso machine and may make you feel a little stupid for asking for a latte.  

Philz really is the best coffee in SF.
author: Lauren R.

description: I thought the tea was better then the coffee. I've given it a few goes and for some reason the coffee is just not on point for me. The location is great though and if you're lucky enough to get a seat in one if the 5 spots you are good to go!
author: Rich S.

description:
Meh. Over priced coffee...

Its good, smooth..but it wasn't AMAZING!!!!
author: Brendan L.

description:
Iced Coffee Mint Mojito --- I die, it's so good.

Albeit this choice of coffee isn't for the die-hard coffee lovers because it is sweet ... I still like it.  I get a: "I want to jump on a trampoline and save the world!" kinda coffee high when I order this.  Not sure if that's a good/bad thing though lol.  

To those who compare this place to other coffee stops such as Blue Bottle or Ritual, don't.  It's like comparing apples to oranges.  Or an Italian Pastry Shop to an Asian Pastry Shop, they're just different.  

What I also like is that there are several locations throughout the city:  Van Ness, Mission, and the Ball Park.  Always only a couple minutes away once you're in SF....but parking at all of them is tough.  Make sure you have quarters to pay the parking meters if it's before 6pm.  If you want to meet the real Phil, he's often at the Mission location.  Cool guy, great coffee.
author: Char C. B.

description:
A friend of mine took me here today.  He and his wife live around the corner and go there all the time.  Lucky bastards.

He ordered the Philharmonic for both of us and yes it was an orchestra of flavor.   (Sorry, I had to.)   Strong dark coffee, sweet sugar and cardamom... one of my favorite spices ever... all lovingly prepared by hand.   I was instantly head over heels. 

My cranberry bread with rosemary was unique enough that I had to try it but left something to be desired.  Moist in some spots and a little dry and crumbly in others.   Not their fault.. it is an outside bakery that makes it.. but just as an FYI.  YMMV.  

The organic mini donuts were cute, and a "quesadilla" breakfast tart of cornbread crust and sweetened cheese filling was also intriguing so maybe I'll give one of those a go next time. 

Tiny little place and yes, there's a chaotic ordering system but the end result is worth it.  Fanfreakin'tastic.   Philz is going to be a destination coffee spot for me any time I'm in the city from now on, or Palo Alto, and I'm looking forward to the San Jose location opening as well.
author: Shanna K.

description:
Tried this on a whim based on other Yelpers, and the fact that they had so many blends on their menu, it sounded interesting.

Ok, so I am not a coffee drinker much, as it tends to wreak havoc on my stomach and nerves, but the coffee here is so smooth, especially the Ambrosia mix, with cream, medium sweetness (they do everything for you, the creaming the sugaring with brown sugar, and the mixing of it all).
They brew one cup at a time, and when you get your cup, you really are holding something special.

If you are any kind of a quality coffee fan, or your typical thing is starbucks, go here, and let the barrista guide you to a new experience. It is only slightly more pricey than a daily grind-o-starbucks coffee (2.75 for a small) but you will taste starbucks after this and want to scrape it off your tongue!

Staff is very nice and helpful. Pastries are kept in a glass case that has door so flies won't get in. Nice detail, and something that annoys me greatly is flies on food, so they win there too. All pastries were reasonably priced (2.00 each, 1.00 for "vintage" or day-old), and looked good, but we went for the scones which were very good, especially dipped in the wonderful coffee. I had "vintage" both days, and since they are freshly delivered every day, one day does not really make too much of a difference, tasted fine to me!

Go. Just go. 
You will not be dissappointed. 
They will not let you be disappointed. 
They even ask you to taste your coffee right when they give it to you, just to get your OK on it. If it's not to your liking, they will work to make sure you are happy, and you will be.

Parking was available easily both days we went there (weekdays before 12 noon), and seating, although limited, was available both days too, since most people who came in, buy their coffee and then go walking away with it instead of sitting.
author: Shindy P.

description: got the decaf mint mojito but it tasted super bland.  I told them and they were so nice and offered to remake it with darker beans to give it more flavor.  The second cup was super tasty!!!
author: JY L.

description:
Good coffee, good spot.
Didn't try the food, but I assume that deserves the five stars well.
author: Carlo M.

description:
We discovered Philz on a rainy day walking through the Castro, and have been in love ever since.  Not knowing anything about the place, we were a bit surprised to see a menu so much more detailed than your typical Petes or Starbucks.  Philz is a real coffee lover's coffee, and has a ton of options for anyone to find a favorite and become a regular.  Just make sure you've had a good look at the big board menu and are ready to order by the time you're at the counter, because the staff tends to get a bit...testy...if you don't move quickly.  And then be prepared to wait a bit for your coffee. The Tesora Mocha and the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee are our top choices.

Our opinions differ with regards to the donuts.  Philz has a decent selection of pastries off to the side of the ordering counter, including a few (unlabeled) flavors of donuts.  We picked up a bunch of them for the road, and while one of us thought they were great, the other was unimpressed.  So while we would (and do) definitely come back here, it will be (is) mostly for the coffee. 4.5 stars, rounded up.

-A&L
author: AdamLowell C.

description: One star for being connected to a laundromat. One star for the supervisor that acknowledged my complaint and talked to the barista that I saw cough into his hands, not wash his hands, then make someone's coffee. Minus 3 stars for the unsanitary barista that needs to review his work's health codes.
author: Valerie F.

description: Have been to a few of the Philz and all though they are all good and make delicious coffee the Castro Philz gets extra points for being small, always having a line but moving through it surprisingly quick.  It's a cute little place and they always make you amazing coffee.
author: Dave T.

description:
4/5 iced mint mojito

she made it perfectly. i may have to ditch van ness and start coming to this one.
author: Alvin D.

description:
Amazing coffee!!!  I tried the philharmonic and was blown away!  Best coffee I've ever had (and I've had a lot)
Friendly Castro atmosphere that's fun for everyone.  Highly recommended!
author: Steve M.

description: The best customer service I have experienced in San Francisco! Amazing coffee brewed by the cup with delicious treats to accompany it.
author: Bradley V.

description: Philz. Coffee. is. AMAZING.  I keep getting the iced coffee w/a sprig of mint and it is the tastiest coffee I think I've ever had.  I'm hooked.  Thank God there are multiple Philz locations across the city.  YUM.
author: Mel G.

description:
This place is rad.

Today marked my first experience with the reputable Philz, and I loved it.

Despite it being busy, the baristas were on top of getting everyones orders down and worked efficiently as a team. On top of that, one of the baristas actually chatted with me about life whilst pouring drinks, and the other two checked to make sure I had been taken care of. The atmosphere was kind and welcoming, and they have a huge menu of specialty coffee blends that looked delectable-- and delicious mint herbal tea (which I enjoyed today.) 

Downside: Their pastries were dry/stale and not very well presented. But that's a small downside, because they more than make up for it in other areas :-)
author: Anna F.

description: beleive the hype.  awesome made to order coffee which has a serious kick, induces a seroius caffeine buzz.  they really care about the taste which works out well.  in the future, i would not get mint or any greens in the coffee, this tasted wierd.  but otherwise ,wow very nice
author: Ankur P.

description:
Philz is really great... get your no bs straight up black death coffee here, or try one of their interesting and inventive coffees. 

After trying a bunch of their coffees, I have decided on the New Manhattan. But go to the Soooo Good every now and then, and the one coffee with cardamom and mint in it.

I usually go to this particular location since its right near my gfs house. The staff is amazing here, very warm and welcoming. I love chatting with them while waiting for me coffee, good people.

Its a great place to chill, grab coffee and get some work done. (Or write yelp reviews) ;)

Fail to understand why the Starbucks a block down is busy. This place is the real deal. If you like coffee, come to Philz.
author: Anish B.

description:
