Best. Coffee. EVER. Coolest staff ever. One of the top reasons I love San Francisco. And I definitely plan on getting some of them beans shipped out here to Seattle.

I've never been to a quick serve establishment where the staff asks you to let them know how the food/beverage/whatever tastes. And they were funny. Aaaand it didn't hurt that the boys were awfully cute.
author: Maria O.

description: The morning baristas always have a way to make the groggy, cold SF mornings a little more bearable! If it's not the light hearted commentary from the barista, the coffee will definitely hit the spot. I love the Chai Tea with honey and cream. Mhmmmm So Good!
author: Andersen Y.

description: People seem to love this place, but I was disappointed.  Long lines, surly staff, confusing menu, and only above-average coffee for high prices.  I love to support independent small business but I find the Starbucks on 18th and Castro to have more of a friendly neighborhood feel, and that's pretty sad.
author: Joyce J.

description:
This review has absolutely nothing to do about the coffee.  Coffee is great, hence the star.

The service and ATTITUDE of the staff....that's another story.  Cliche, but this my one and only "I'm not a yelp reviewer, but got on here to write this" kinda review, because CONSISTENTLY the staff is so inconsiderate, aloof, and flat out rude, that I just can't stand going in there anymore.

I live approximately 6 doors down from this location, and, once every two weeks I go in there to buy my coffee beans.  That's right, ALL I WANT TO DO IS BUY MY BEANS.  There is no organization to the patrons in regards to ordering/paying, and the coffee makers are so focused on making coffee, they become oblivious to the fact that not everyone is in there in order to purchase a cup of coffee to go.  Would a salutation or greeting kill you?  This is a local business, make people want to support you.

The register is never attended, leaving me unsure as to what line I should stand in, without other people thinking I'm cutting in front of them.  Instead, I'm left in purgatory, unsure as to where to stand, and have to listen to you all behind the counter tell your patrons they are ruining their coffee when they order Splenda.  RUDE. 

A simple walk-in purchase, when there are 4 other people in the store, should not take 10 minutes.  A "thank you" could have gone a long way too.
author: Rob F.

description:
Yum. Great coffee and pastries. The coffee is totally one of a kind and they take extra care when making each cup. Questions? No problem - the staff is super nice at this location. 

Also have tried their pumpkin muffin and a few mini cupcakes. The mini blueberry muffin is amazing as is the chocolate and vanilla on vanilla. Nothing bad to say here!
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: Tried Philz "Sooo Good" coffee, and I must say, it wasn't so good. HOWEVER, their Ambrosia coffee was up to par, and their VEGAN DONUTS were in fact good. Kudos for their lemon poppyseed vegan donut. I couldn't believe it was vegan! I'm giving them an extra star for proving that their mint mojito isn't their only good drink, their vegan donuts, and their friendly service! :)
author: Diane G.

description:
Disappointing. 

My girlfriend and I live near the Castro (Buena Vista Park). We love the vibe of Castro, Cole Valley and Haight. We typically have a morning walk and a large cup of coffee for me/small hot chocolate for her. We're familiar with all the typical local spots in the area but have always passed by the cafe/laundry spot on 18th Street.

This morning we strolled into Philz Coffee. A good amount of people/locals, and we thought the place must be really good. 
1. Although the staff was attentive, the ordering was very confusing. I could barely hear the guy over the loud coffee making process and multiple ordering.
2. Call me traditional but I like the option of adding stuff to my coffee. At Philz you need to direct the staff on how you like the coffee. Very cumbersome in my opinion, plus if they get it wrong..."oh well".
3. When our order was ready the coffee maker guy announced a coffee "name?" not knowing it was mine...I asked "does this have two equals?", he looked at me like I had tainted his coffee with poison or very annoyed that I asked him a question! Nevertheless, it was a fast process.
4. The coffee was +FAIR but the hot chocolate was -FAIR.
5. I would hope for +$6 the service, product, staff demeanor would have been a little better.

Try it once to see if you like it, and great but for us...most likely not.
author: Pstephan A.

description:
Soooo.....best cup of coffee ever. Didn't know what kind of brew to get...told the barista I like strong coffee with a hint of sweet....ten minutes later....ta-da! The best cup of coffee ever.  Can't fully remember the name of my coffee...I think it was Jacob's something...SO GOOD.  

Wish there was one closer to me in Burlingame.
author: Hanna J.

description: Seriously cannot deal wit the awesomeness that is mint mojito iced coffee. U will die and go to heaven. Worth the wait, worth the everything. Their hot coffee gets the job done and then some. Utter bliss. :D
author: Will K.

description:
Being a self-proclaimed coffee addict, I had to give Philz Coffee a try after my friend raved about this place. We were in the area after eating at Ike's and coffee was the perfect way to end a delicious lunch. I asked the staff for a recommendation of a medium roast coffee and they told me to try the tesora blend. It was nice of them to ask me how sweet I wanted it. Taking my first sip of this liquid jewel, I was quite impressed. The temperature was perfect and it wasn't too sweet or too bitter.I'm no coffee connoisseur but the taste was fantastic! It also gave me energy that lasted throughout the day.

The place itself was very nice. It's a chill place to study, meet up with friends or work on your laptop. I give Philz only four stars because of the price. A large cup of coffee was $3.25, which is a little pricey. For a fine-crafted cup of coffee however, it's worth it every once in a while. If you love coffee like I do, please give this place a try!
author: Annie C.

description: I don't even like coffee and I like this place! Delicious coffee and friendly service. I love the mint mojito iced coffee. I definitely have to try the mocha tesoro next.
author: Luke W.

description:
Note: Make sure to order your coffee from the barista BEFORE you get in line to pay at the register. It's a little unorthodox, but it's worth it.

Unerringly amazing coffee and really fun staff. One time I went there to do some work online (free wireless internet), and they had some oldies playing on the stereo. We ended up singing the songs together, and then one of the baristas started running around the place using a rainbow flag as a cape. I'm pretty sure I almost fell to the ground, I was laughing so hard. Only in SF. Every time I visit Castro, a stop to Philz is essential. ;)
author: David S.

description:
Pros:  Best fresh coffee in SF.  Free wi-fi.  Outside seating.  YAY. 

Cons:  You have to wait for the cup and stand awkwardly with others shoulder to shoulder in the small store for 5 minutes.
author: Brendan N.

description: always love their coffee, of course the mojito is a must, but the mocha and dancing rain is great as well
author: Long C.

description: We needed to grab some coffee before heading to Dolores Park on Easter Sunday. Good find by the Mister. The line was long that day. Coffee like no other was worth the wait.
author: Lora M.

description: Not much to say that hasn't been said. This place is the best in the business and It's my every morning stop. Get some!
author: Roger E.

description: Enjoyed the fantastical philz fresh chai tonight and it was beyond amazing. Really enjoyed the atmosphere and the baristas :)
author: Sarah S.

description: This place makes me wish I live in San Francisco. Love their Ecstatic Iced Coffee and have it every time I am here. I get it medium sweet so I can taste more of their delicious, flavorful coffee.
author: Kim Le P.

description:
Recently moving to San Francisco and being a major coffee addict, it was crucial that I find a nearby coffee shop within an hour of my arrival. 

Their #6 (which is an iced coffee) is absolutely phenomenal-- if you order it with some cream and sugar, it's the epitome of perfection. This is a type of coffee I can literally sip on two or three hours after I order it-- it's still perfect. Super rich, not watery at all. 

Well done, Philz Coffee, I solute you.
author: Val B.

description:
After a very long and co dependent relationship with Starbucks I walk in to Philz expecting to be battered emotionally. Instead they spoil me. 

Extra sweet please? Eep. Did I see a smile? 

Yes people they custom make your coffee. If your coffee could hug you it would be from Philz. From the great service to the cute little mint leaf on top, I'm a fan. I've only had the ice coffee, but can't wait to have more.

Phil.... you spoil me. You handsome bastard. Thanks
author: Christina Y.

description:
My friends and I had never been to Philz before, and as we were walking around, we decided to stop in. The ladies working were very helpful and explained how everything worked for us, which was awesome because otherwise, we would have had no idea. All of the coffee was delicious, and so was the chai.

Me gusta.
author: Maira M.

description:
This particular Philz has been my regular spot over the last few months. As you are probably aware, I'm Philz-phile and have visited almost all the Philz the Bay Area has to offer (minus Berkeley... is it open yet?). Ridiculous? Yes, definitely. However, this location has definitely become my favorite. Maybe it's because it's usually on my route either to or from home (okay, okay MAYBE I sometimes plan my routes specifically to take me by here). Or maybe because I've grown fond of the crew working there (usually the late morning or early afternoon shift). Regardless, I love it here.

My go to is a large Jacob's with medium cream and sugar. There was a girl who used to work the mid-morning shift that would make it PERFECTLY for me but then I haven't seen her in awhile. There is another fella who started making my drinks regularly who wouldn't put in quite enough sugar. He could always tell by the look on my face though! Genius. Now he's gotten it pretty good and it's always much appreciated. At first I was somewhat intimidated by the crew but now that I've been seeing them on a semi-regular basis, I appreciate seeing the same faces.

Parking when I go is hardly ever an issue and it's a quieter area than the 24th St location. Solid. Love you Philz!
author: Salina Z.

description: Heard about Philz from a friend who used to live in San Francisco calling it "crack in a cup." And he's absolutely right! I ordered the iced mint mojito and am addicted. Service was very friendly and helpful. Will be coming again!
author: Angela S.

description: Organic coffee that tastes like coffee should. The decaf selection is just as delicious. If you're a newbie, definitely try the Tesora
author: Karina A.

description: Amazingly good--and open early for an East coaster like me.  I had the filtered coffee with hazelnut flavoring.
author: Russ H.

description:
Very calm and peaceful place.  All the staff and patrons are very friendly and they are all here for peace and to relax.

They have a very interesting variety of coffee...from all over the world.  They blend their own coffee and the names are very creative.  It's kind of hard to determine which one is my favorite but my goal is to try out every one of them.  If you don't know what to order, just stand there and listen to the barista calls out the orders.  If you stand close enough to the counter, you can smell the aroma of the coffee.

Besides coffee, their teas are also very tasty.  On a hot day, an mint iced tea will calm and sooth you down.  I like it unsweeten, so I can taste the flavor of the tea.  They usually add a mint leaf to the black or green tea so instead of sugar, I like a little bit of honey with it.  The aroma itself will wake you up!
author: Bernice S.

description: The barista gave me a high five, first of all, so that started the visit well. I had no idea what to get, so we chatted and he advised the Philharmonic after I said I wanted something medium bodied and a little bit of spice, but smooth. I liked it and I can't wait to try more of them!
author: Theresa S.

description: This is the tiniest Philz coffee that I've been too thus far...it's at a great location...Heart of the Castro.  They only have 2 baristas, but they are quite efficient in making their coffee.  I ordered my Mint Mojito, paid for it, next thing you know...it's ready.   You wouldn't know that this little existed unless you did a Yelp search.  It's a great little hang out if you're waiting for laundry to be done.  The staff here are awesome!
author: Lisa W.

description: Great Unique coffee blends, cool space and cool people. Not as much room to chill as Mission but it's great to have this one near the castro and not have to go to Bear-bucks up the street w/ all of the 'show' happening there.
author: Rew C.

description:
Reviewed the Philz in SOMA already so I don't want to repeat myself..

But I do want to point out that the SOMA Philz is MUCH more aesthetically pleasing and feels more comfortable and welcoming. This location is small and crowded but still good if you just want to drop by and grab your cup of good stuff on your way somewhere.
author: Brad Y.

description: I love Philz, I love 'em all.  This one is a bit small but they get the job done.  The pastries look tastiest here.  I like the area but the Van Ness location has happier and friendlier staff.
author: Erika C.

description:
Each cup is individually ground and brewed while you wait.

This is perfect for the picky coffee drinker.
author: M C.

description:
Black tea with cream and honey served by pleasant barista earns fifth star.

Grunge defined. Eclectic clientele (war protester, random out-of-towner, lovebird students, possibly corporate laptop warrior, LBGT supporter, typical Mission hipster, etc.).

Tasty peanut butter cookie.
author: Inigo M.

description: Recommended by a counselor at our sons' camp, this place is wonderful. Great infused coffees and excellent service. You must try it.
author: Angela G.

description:
My first time.  I was kind of nervous.  The chaotic setup didn't make me feel any less self-conscious.  The menu overwhelmed me...I knew I had to get a drip coffee, but there were so many choices with such interesting names!  Finally I just went for it and asked the un-intimidating cashier what he would recommend.

He asked me what roast I usually prefer.  I said medium.  He suggested the Tesora, the house blend, but then asked if I like cardamom.  I do not.  So I got a Tesora, black.  He asked me if I wanted mint in it.  What?  Did I hear right?  "yeah, it's kinda our thing"  "oh!  okay sure!"  Down for everybody's unique "thing".  Saw the other guy pinch off some fresh mint and got a little excited and nervous.

Turned out to be amazing.  Loved the warmth of Tesora on a winter's day roaming the streets of the Castro.  The mint was very subtle but definitely there.  And being wired for 7+ hours?  Can't beat that.  Can the one in Berkeley open already?
author: Lydia W.

description:
This is actually the second Philz I've been to. The first was downtown somewhere, and I have to say...both were very consistent with their coffee and service.

The one in the Castro was much smaller to the one downtown of course, but they were just as friendly and comfortable to talk to. And the coffee of course.... smooth and toasty. I always order the Tesora, medium sweet, and I'm always satisfied with it.

It's a little pricier than a regular cup of coffee, for sure, but it's a nice indulgence every so often. And to be honest, I drink a LOT of starbucks (gold card member), and PHILZ definitely kicks their arse.
author: amelia g.

description:
i might be pissing some Philz coffee fans off here but ordered the Tesora with cream and sugar - too acidic for my taste. i described it as bad coffee. also got one of the berry muffins. i think it was strawberry?! it was alright... i was starving though. 

i asked for a fork or spoon of some sort, but the barista behind the counter responded, "we don't have that stuff here" without even looking at me. i thought that was a little rude. 

I'll give it a couple more tries, but definitely at a different location.
author: Diana C.

description:
Awesome coffee, nice staff. Bad shop.

Really limited and cramped seating.  Lot of outlets, but almost none are located near the tables so they're pretty much useless.  Not sure if this is just me, but it feels dark/dirty too.  Outdoor patio is nice, but overall this is not the type of place you can sit down and work in.  

I was seriously tempted to buy Philz coffee and go find a better shop to sit in...
author: Robin C.

description:
Philz Ecstatic Iced Coffee

is 

Phockin Phantastic 

on all levels

from the sip

to the moment it splashes and tickles your tongue

to the way it slides down your pipes

lubricates and glides

to the way it feels, literally "yummy in my tummy"

and even a minute later, the slightly minty herby sexy feeling it leaves on your tongue and aftertastebuds.

Is quite amazing.

                                                   __________
                                                 /      PHILZ       \
                                      =====================
                                                \\  ~~~~~~~~ //
                                                 ||                     ||
                                                 ||----O==O--- ||
                                                 ||     ~~o~~     ||
                                                 ||         U         ||
                                                 ||                     ||
                                                 =========== 

Phil, you are one cool cat! Keep on brewin'....

PS the iced mocha tesora is quite sexcellent too.
author: Ken K.

description:
This place is a god send.  The coffee is exceptional , the staff are just a delight. They know what I need. 

This place has been my make shift office for over 6 months now.
author: Suchitra V.

description:
Great price!!$6.00 for a pound of Espresso Roast.! Damn-Dirt-cheap!! 
Unfortunately, I don't come to the Castro often.
author: Matt G.

description:
Philz serves the best coffee in the City, individually hand brewed by the cup. They'll even mix in the cream and sugar for you, along with some fresh mint if you ask.

My favs are the Philharmonic, which is a refreshing medium blend, and the Turkish is a bit darker, with spicy overtones.

And best of all, Phizs has some comfy couches to lounge around while sipping your brew.
author: Allen T.

description:
I used to always get my Philz in Palo Alto so I was glad to find this just a few blocks from my house when I moved here.

Of course the Mint Mojito is amazing when I need ice.  I will usually go for a Soo Good with almond milk though.  Or Canopy of Heaven.  Maybe Greater Alarm if I need that extra bit of caffeine.  Their light roasts are amazing.

It is nice to be able to get the same great cup of coffee from back home  when I moved here.  They seem to be consistent in quality and service through the various locations.  Actually this one is kind of better because I have never had to wait more than a minute before being able to order.  I think I've waited like 15 minutes just to order at the first Palo Alto location.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
I LUVS Philz coffee! It gives me the kick in the arse when i need it!!!
Their coffees are smooth and delicious. 

I love their service and they always know how to make my order right.  I'll have to admit, this one Sunday morning I walked in and ordered a tall mocha and the girl behind the counter gave me an evil store and asked -you've been in before right? I was like -CRAP!!! Yes, soooo sorry, it was one of those late night outings -Phew, she forgave me!!

Anyways, they are one of my top 2 local roasters I go to for my coffee!
author: Alvin M.

description: No disappointed  with the coffee consistency when hopping between the city locations. Great Castro location with extended hours compared to the other locations.
author: Shadi K.

description: The first time I came in.. I was super confused what to order. It didn't help that I did not have on my glasses either!! They recommended Mocha Tesora (light sweet for me) and I've been in love with it ever since. One time I had forgotten to order mocha and just ordered Tesora, which was not bad either. I also like how it's not too hot and I can drink it right away. I've been wanting to try the mint mojito iced coffee.... maybe when it's sunnier.
author: Allyson L.

description: One of the best cups of coffee I've ever had at a cafe. Only $4, too, and worth every penny! Try Julie's Wondebar or Jacob's Ultimate & you'll never want a Peet's or Starbucks coffee again.
author: Lew A.

description: The Ether blend is one of the best I've had! As a  coffee snob, that's saying a lot! Dark, tasty and strong.
author: S C.

description:
I once drove for 12 hours to get a Mocha Tessora at Philz.

Yes, it is that good. My favorite Cup of coffee in the world.

Every cup brewed individually to your taste-- and they get it right every time!!!

Great people as well, very genuine and helpful!
author: Josh P.

description:
What a pleasure it alwayz is (purrty much,unless ya don't know how 2smooze and be an excellent guest yaself) visiting Philz!  

Terrific and helpful staff ready 2please your palate... best have sumtime 2spent as you prepare yourself 4 a memorable experience of tasting and socializing at a coffee/tea house.  Staff's always ready 2make your drink just so, that means it takes communication and time.  So, relax, pull up a chair and enjoy yourself.

A plus to meet Mr. Philz himself as well :)
author: LindaLu N.

description:
Try the new iced mint mojito! If you like mojitos in general, you'll love this! But don't get it hot because it just doesn't taste the same. 

Introduced 3 of my friends to Philz and they all loved it!
author: Lisa C.

description: I love Philz, and this is my favorite one in the city. If you love rich, dark coffee, I highly recommend Jacob's Wonderbar. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because there's very little seating in here and I would love to hang out and work in this cafe. Staff is very helpful and friendly.
author: Amy C.

description: This is the best coffee I have ever had. I love the iced mint Mojito. The mint is hand crushed by the barista. Philz Drip coffee tastes to clean and fresh. Philz coffee is less acidic in my opinion than other chain coffee shops in the area. I love this place and the barista's are always friendly and smiling. This place seems to be a great study place for local collage students. Meter parking is available around Philz but otherwise park at Safeway and walk over if you are just getting coffee.
author: Ellen H.

description:
The shop is small but they are friendly with good customer services. 
The street parking is nearly impossible but still worth coming back
for pleasant experience.
author: Yoshiko M.

description: I'm not much of a coffee drinker. However I wanted to check out Philz given its reputation in the Bay Area. On my visit the barista was very friendly. I wasn't sure what to order, but after asking a few questions about what I like the server gave me a great recommendation. I definitely appreciated the time they took in helping me pick something I would like. Another awesome thing is that everything is done by hand. Noe machines are used and each cup is freshly brewed to order!!!!
author: Richard P.

description:
This is a great place to have coffee. Drinks are excellent. Custom made. Some baristas prepared them super good while others are MEGA good. 

PROs: excellent drinks. fantastic shop. friendly staff. clean. central location. natural & artificial light for all. fast customer turn over (long lines may give the wrong impression).

CONs: some customers come with attitude. customers LOVE STANDING IN THE WAY. occasional gigantic stroller inside the shop or dogs barking senseless right inside.
author: Emir A.

description:
I am by no means a coffee expert. I drink a lot of instant. I like my Starbucks. Blah blah blah. What do I know, right? 

Well, strangely enough I watched a Korean drama and they explained how a great cup of coffee can be made one at a time with fresh roasted beans. Now I have no idea what kind of beans Philz uses, but they do the single cup brewing and I recognized that. 

My friend ordered iced coffee and I had the same. Whatever, right? We're walking. Talking. The day is super hot and perfect for an early afternoon iced coffee. 

Then I took a sip. What the what? Is this real life? At least I know I have recognizable taste buds. Hey, I know instant coffee isn't great, but it's a quick fix. Starbucks, hey, I like the toffee nut. 

This coffee was good. Like really good. To me it was so good, I'm still thinking about it at home in Hollywood. *shakes fist*

I'll be back. Oh yes I will.
author: Cheryl B.

description:
Oh Philz...what would I do without you? Philz is a lot like the Internet. I cannot remember life before it. 

The best cup of coffee in the city, the best people watching around, and the most genuinely friendly, unpretentious baristas - a rare find in a boutique coffee shop these days!

The only drawback is that their sound system is crappy. I don't even mind the music they play there, but when it's blasting through some bad, crackly speakers it can really grate on you. The good service and delish coffee makes up for it though, hence the 5 stars. 

I wouldn't tote my ass all the way from the Sunset District 2-3 times a week otherwise.
author: Melissa W.

description: This is a great coffee shop, warm and inviting. The coffee is made to taste so it's perfect every time. The Tesora is very yummy, bitter but rich. I can't wait to try the Turkish and New Manhattan beans.
author: Minda w.

description:
Neighborhood feel, fresh desserts daily, uber-friendly staff who smile and look happy, clean, modern decor, free wifi, lots of outlets. And relaxing, chill, background music. 

Rec: iced green tea is amazing. Took five min to make, but so worth it.
author: dan s.

description: A great cup of tea.  Employees are friendly and knowledgeable
author: Lisa K.

description:
Addictive, smooth & sweet. 

All I can say is I am determined to try every single blend on their list, which is written on a chalkboard. For my first time, Philz broke me in nice & gently with an iced decaf french roast. My cool hipster barista asked me, "How do you want it? A touch of sweet, medium or SWEET?" I took my first sip of the SWEET stuff & walked out with a goofy grin, signature brown coffee cup in hand, and new addiction in tow. 

P.S. the cutest thing is that you help yourself to their assortment of baked goods that's displayed in a CHINA CABINET. The BFF bought a blueberry scone, which I took a piece of & it was buttery good.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Yesterday at 4:30pm, I drank a large Philz coffee.  Last night I could not fall asleep until 6:30am.

At 2am, I was still jittery from the caffeine.

I slept two hours, yet am completely functional today.  I'm getting a lot of work done, and I exercised for 45 minutes without getting tired.

I'm concerned that Philz coffee contains some kind of drug.  If I ever need to perform super-human feats for 24 hour without sleeping, I will rely on their coffee.  However, I don't think I will be drinking it on any normal day.
author: Niniane W.

description: So glad I live four blocks from here because I LOVE philz coffee. I was never much of a coffee drinker but Philz changed my life. This particular philz is a bit smaller so you may have to wait a bit. There's also not a lot of sitting room either so and there is always a few people chilling at philz to work/study. Overall, the staff here is really nice and really helpful in getting you the right coffee for you.
author: edward k.

description: they definitely know their coffee.  One of the best coffee shops I have been too.  What they have defined in their posters is what you get in your coffee.  love to go and get my cup of joe there
author: Felix H.

description:
This is COOL coffee shop!

Okay! I went in and ask for something sweet and strong. The Barista said "I have something for you!"

And yeah! He de my day! :-) 
I was wired with caffein and delicious Philz coffee...

If you want some personality in your coffee come here.. and ditch your Starbucks!
author: Aemar E.

description:
Ok not the original - though I do love the very first Philz.. Philz coffee zee best! My favorite after trying several different grounds has got to be the Philtered Soul - black. It has a hint of hazelnut that leaves my office smelling so great - throughout the day!

Not only is the coffee consistent the staff there is just great! I walk in half asleep, half tired from just working out at the gym and they carry this "good morning" cheer that just leaves you feeling like - "today is going to be a good day" - I know hard to say from someone like me who is not entirely a morning person!

Philtered Soul - hands down the best.
Staff - two thumbs up.
Overall - five stars because they start my day!
author: Caroline C.

description: We had the So Good, Arabica, and another dark roast.  I forget the name.  But all three are pretty good.  It's a little water compared to Four Barrel, on par with Rituals.  Good coffee and the way the individualized each serving is really cool, but makes the wait time very long.
author: Byron L.

description:
The best coffee hands down. All they do is coffee--they make it fresh for you while you wait. I think the coffee has a bit more caffeine in it-- I am always buzzed afterwards.

The guys that work there are super nice and few extra cents more than Peets is SO WORTH IT!!!! I go out of my way for my daily cup it is THAT good.

I have gone to the "better" coffee houses here in SF, Ritual, Blue Bottle,etc. and love them too. What I like about Philz is all they do is fresh drip coffee and the blends are crafted by Phil and his sons. 

Thank goodness for coffee.......
author: Dani K.

description: Absolute BEST coffee EVER, hands down! Ive tried just about every coffee and theyre all pretty damn amazing! Only downfall I can possibly think of is the crowd that swarms on a Saturday morning. Despite all of the people in the somewhat of a small cafe, the barista's keep things moving in a timely manner.
author: Biavaschi, T.

description:
Possibly the best coffee I have ever had... well, besides the stuff I brew at home that I am fairly certain could be used to power a time machine... no, I take it back... this stuff is better. 

My one complaint is that their menu is not online, but only on the front counter... so trying to figure out which of their coffees to order can be hard if there is a line. Though, this is easily solved just by talking to one of the Very Friendly staff, who will help guide you in the right direction. 

To make it even more enjoyable, you can do your laundry while you wait... at the Sit and Spin (my favorite name for a laundromat).
author: Jordan Y.

description:
This place is not better than Blue Bottle, I don't care what any of you say. But thank you Philz for making one hell of a faux latte. And putting a mint leaf.

And thank you lady sitting next to me for having the most adorable 3 year old miniature chihuahua.

Coffee and chihuahuas, what more could I ask for?
author: Lauren S.

description: Rich flavorful coffee.  All coffee are made to order, one cup at a time.  They "slow drip" all of their coffees.  You can really taste the difference between the different brews.
author: Mary V.

description: I live in Seattle. My coffee standards are high. I'm sitting here drinking a fresh Philharmonic. It is effing uh-may-zing. THAT IS ALL.
author: Leanna G.

description:
The best coffee I've ever tasted. And I'm a huge cafe/coffee drinker who's lived in LA as well as San Diego. The only other place that compares would be Urth Cafe in LA. 

I'm in love with the Mint Mojito like everyone else. The quality of the coffee is just so rich and smooth. I never though I would ever experience something so wonderful...The only thing-- I can't sleep at night. The last time I drank it in the evening, I didn't fall asleep til 5am. So I learn to ask for half decaf. Not sure if their coffee is stronger or I just drank it too late in the day. But still, it's worth it. So crazy that I would sacrifice my sleep for this one drink of heavenly goodness! Anyone who comes to SF MUST try it or they are seriously missing out.
author: Janet A.

description:
Amazing coffee! We were looking for a place to relax during a morning of exploring on foot, and after reading the reviews of this place, I had to try the mint mojito. It was as good as advertised! Creamy and refreshing, flavored not with some industrial green syrup, but with copious sprigs of fresh mint leaves! It's counterintuitive but delicious - the kind of drink that only a real coffee genius would dream up, and that only a shop totally committed to quality could execute properly. Hint: don't try drinking it with a straw - it needs to be sipped through the ice for full appreciation. 

My BF is a fan of dark roasts, but he's trying to stay away from caffeine - so he was excited by the decaf options at Philz.  He tried the decaf French and Ethiopian roasts on the two trips we made here - he reported both were excellent, and tasted nothing like decaf. I tried a sip of the Ethiopian - smoky and complex, great flavor. 

A word on seating: limited.  We were lucky enough to get tables both times - but if you're not, you might want to consider taking your drinks to Dolores Park two blocks away to enjoy outdoors.
author: Taylor Y.

description:
Oh boy.. strong a$$ coffee keeps you buzzing like buzzard. Pick up a Figaro hat while you are at it, and then 100% style yourself with a cigar from a store across the street.  

Great way to start the day and make some friends, Philz is a probably one of where the friendliest people hang.  Huge urban or local scene, there is something here for everyone, with too boot, all coffee if freshly ground then French Pressed right before you very eyes.    This is the best of the best on how coffee ought to be served to you without the notion of corporate coffee chain brainwashing.
author: Tito Y.

description: Love the coffee, great staff. I wish the wait wasn't always so long, theres gotta be a quicker way to serve coffee. And they really need to invest in a new card swiper, the poor staff have to manually key in each card number!
author: Blake H.

description: I have been to this Philz three times and I know I'll keep coming back! Needless to say they have great, wonderful coffee (and tea, too!). I only go to coffee shops to get work done, and strangely, despite this place being always busy and there being very few seats, I have managed all three times to find a table where I can set down my laptop and get to work. And if you can get a table, you'll get an outlet, even if it means you'll have to reach over a table or two... :) I also like that it's tied in with a laundromat --- I had to use it when I first got here, before I got a place of my own, and the laundromat owner was super nice.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Always great coffee! This time I had the "Its the Best" recommended!

Ambience of this place doesn't make it the best place to study. Loud of music and little seating. I ended up going into the laundromat next door where I could enjoy the smell of fresh clothes and zen out/study to the sounds of washing machines. It was great
author: Sirina K.

description: Why waste time typing a review?  Simply the best coffee in San Francisco.   Lots of interesting coffee options and unique interpretations on the menu.  Do try Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  Outstanding.
author: Ross B.

description:
excellent small philz.  busy and always good people making very, very good coffee. 
have never sat down, this is no 24th st location, but it is good.
author: e c.

description: I like the large variety of blends they have on their menu, but the barista was not very helpful nor friendly. They highlighted that they hand-make everything, and was a bit short when I was trying to decide which coffee I wanted. In fact, when I said I liked African coffees, she sort of interrogated me about what I like about it. The place itself looked very cool, the coffee was not bad (but also not amazing). I'm a coffee lover, but this was objectively a "Meh. I've experienced better." It was likely an isolated incident, and next time we're in the neighborhood we'll probably check it out again.
author: Dave Y.

description: Whenever I visit home, there are a two spots I always try to visit, Tartine and Philz.  Usually we'll park by the Philz on 18th Street in the Castro and after grabbing coffee, head down to Tartine for something sweet.  I like coffee, I don't love it, but I do think Philz is amazing.  I love the way they blend the cream and sugar into the coffee creating a truly lavish coffee experience.  I usually get a small Jacob's Wonderbar with cream and light sugar.  The Jacobs Wonderbar is described as a rich dark roast with layers of nuts and chocolate and finished without any acidity or bitterness.  I could definitely taste the nutty richness, and the chocolaty notes came through towards the end of each sip.  On really warm days I also love to get the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee on their specialty menu.  This drink includes Philz signature coffee/cream blend muddled with fresh mint.  The combination sounds a bit weird but it is totally delicious and refreshing.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Two words: Mocha Tesora

I was introduced to these guys at Outside Lands this year, with the mint leaves and the warm coffee in the morning while all the vendors were setting up, it SAVED me.

Definitely go here, I haven't had a bad blend, and they're always super nice... The old school brewing method is genious...
author: Chelsea D.

description:
I'm so used to espresso drinks that I usually don't drink brewed coffee. One of my workplaces has free coffee from a Starbucks instant grind and brew machine, and I feel like punishing myself drinking those "coffee-flavored beverages".

Philz doesn't have espresso, so I ordered their Turkish blend. They brewed every order individually and it was great. Not particular about their pastry selection. They are located by a laundromat, which makes a lot of sense.
author: Roy C.

description:
Besides being the BEST cup of coffee you'll ever have, I adore the staff at this location. The manager Paola is a sweetheart and ALWAYS goes beyond the call of duty. A few weeks ago I had just returned from a long trip abroad. As always, I needed my welcome-home-cup-of-Philz.  The day I got back was a holiday so rather than heading over I called to make sure they were open. To my dismay, no one answered so I figured they were closed. Minutes later my phone rang. Guess who?! it was Paolo!! Giving me persoanl call letting me know they're open! 

That, my friends, is quality service, damn good coffee, and a brilliant way to come back home from a long vacation...
author: Sharon M.

description: TOday I went in to purchase two gift cards-- have to pass along the love of Philz's coffee! I received the best customer service from NINA AND CURTIS! Helpful and kind- with a huge smile, too!  THank you!!!!!
author: Kim D.

description:
Hello lover....

I adore a great cup of joe.  And with how much of a slut Philz is, being passed around the city and all, i dont need to tell you how mouthgasmic their coffee is.  

I had the Itz the Best blend and the New Manhattan.  Also had a sip of the Turkish.  Holy shite, I was speechless!  At a time way too early for me to be up on a weekend, it was the eye-opener i needed.  It almost felt naughty indulging in this cup of deliciousness.  And the staff are some of the best baristas ive ever come into contact with.  They make your coffee specifically to your needs.  Do you want less cream? More cream?  Light? Medium? Dark?  Soy? Whole?  Sweet? Light sweet? When the person making your coffee actually pays attention to your needs, it really sets the mood for the rest of your day.  Both my cups of coffee were beyond tastebud pleasing, as was my fresh blueberry scone.

Perfect.  Cup.  Of.  Coffee.
author: Juv C.

description: iced coffee mint mojito. yezzir.
author: Criselle O.

description:
I wish I could focus on the coffee, which I thought was good, but unfortunately my experience here was bad enough to overshadow it.

I don't live far from Philz, but hadn't been to it before. My neighbor had recommended it, so when recently walking by I decided to give it a try. My "mistake" was to ask for a latte. The barista literally turned to another employee and laughed at me. I s%!t you not. Then, the barista says: "Sorry, you can't have a latte." So there I stand, gobsmacked, feeling like an a$$, with no idea why. The barista goes on and mumbles something about making something better than a latte, blah blah blah, which is what I hear because they've already lost me, and my embarrassment turns to anger as I realize this is one of those places where things are done "differently" and if you don't know the secret handshake it's an opportunity for you to be made fun of.

While waiting for whatever it was I ordered, I looked around for something that could have warned me ahead of time, like a poster for n00bs or some other sort of indication that I deserved the ridicule and should have known what I was doing ahead of time. I didn't see anything, although I did see that lattes weren't on their menu board, but honestly I don't remember the last time I looked at a coffee shop's menu before I ordered. Regardless, I'm not sure I would have done it differently anyway, as my hope would have been that my asking for a latte would indicate I was a new customer, and I'd be informed of the situation in a respectful way, possibly with the goal of selling me on the benefits that the Philz difference has over other local coffee shops.

Unfortunately, left to my own, my take away was that the Philz difference was something to stay away from.
author: Tad W.

description:
Philz seems to be swept under the rug when it comes to mentioning the best coffee places in SF (it's the usual barf about Blue Bottle).  I'll go ahead and assert that it deserves some consideration when mentioning the better joints in the City.

Philz definitely doesn't have the same alternative chic hipster magnet type of design that places like Four Barrel or Blue Bottle do but the coffee is legit.  I had the Julie's Encore (ok, it's Julie's something, I forgot the exact name) and the description was dead on with what the barista told me, nice earthy and clean.  The cream added for you may be weird to some.  I think it was hot milk (as opposed to adding cold) as the first few sips were kind of foamy and watery but that didn't detract from the experience.

Oh and a bit of advice, once you order, step to the side or back.  Two stepping around people aimlessly lurking by the register for their coffee can provoke caffeine rage.
author: Steven R.

description: Bravo for bringing hand-made drip coffee to every corner of San Francisco. All those different blends to choose from are also a draw. Less impressive is their standard doctoring of coffee with heavy whipping cream. I certainly don't need 300 calories of fat with my coffee. Also disappointing (given the price), is the lack of organic milk as an option.
author: Mike T.

description:
Excellent coffee that makes my heart leap for joy. Philz Coffee, you are my muse. 

If you're going to try Philz, definitely get the Philharmonic with a pinch of cardamom. It's a great kick to start your day. If you're not into black coffee, ask the baristas to give you a dab of their special creamer. 

This location has to be one of my favorites. Why? Lots of neighborhood parking (no meters!), easy to get to, outdoor seating, extra friendly baristas and the crowd is mellow. This place is my office away from the office, and I'm able to get a lot of work done.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
Things that aren't good about Philz? Its proximity to my apartment. 

And how I convince myself it's in between my gym and living space when it's really a few blocks out of the way. So when I get up early on Saturday mornings to go to the gym, I convince myself that I deserve a little treat. But let's be honest here... there's no convincing needed. 

I usually vacillate between 4 flavors, but the Silken Splendor will always have my heart.
author: Jared S.

description:
Philz is the least hipstery of the hipster coffee joints in San Francisco, and thus, it is my favourite. You still get specialised, high-quality coffee (and that "Toto, I don't think we're in Starbucks anymore" type of feeling), but with much less of a snobby/intimidating vibe than the other places. I won't name names, but I'm sure other San Franciscans can think of the places to which I am alluding. 

I've only been to this branch, but if I were to visit any others, this would still be my top choice because I've become quite attached to it; I don't go multiple times a week, like a certain caffeine-fiend friend of mine, but the baristas always treat me as warmly as if I were a regular- no matter how busy the line. This is the perfect "home base" to wind down after a crazy day (but do remember that the shop closes at 8:30) or to take a breather before some Castro-centred high jinks. What makes it even more homelike is that you can even plan mundane tasks around this place - stop by after shopping down the street, or load your clothes at the laundromat next door and pop back into Philz for some coffee and homework/project time/online-bill-paying/blogging/life-planning/existential ruminations.

However, seating is limited, so unless you are doing laundry next door or need the outlets to charge your cell phone/laptop/other electronic device, you might want to consider taking the coffee (or tea) to Dolores Park a few blocks down. The weather is usually good enough in the Mission-Castro (Mastro?) to sit outside, you get an amazing view of the city with your amazing drink, and there will be free seats at Philz for people who need it! EVERYONE WINS.
author: Joanne C.

description:
Not worth the hype.  $3.50 for what other places would be a regular sized coffee.  I like my stuff strong.  Had the Jacob's (hot), and didn't find it any better than Peet's (and would have spent $1.85).
Definitely better than any kind of Starbucks crap out there.
Getting a cappuchino at Cafe Triste or something like that I think would have been more worth it.
author: Q L.

description: They serve the BEST iced coffee w/ sweetener I have EVER had. Plus, they serve it with a smile. Thanks Phil.
author: Thomas L.

description:
I just read Tad W. 's review, and it was either taken to heart by Phil(z), or, just by coincidence, Tad's dream of what Philz should be has come true.
       I walked up and was asked by the very young-looking guy behind the counter,
      "Is this your first time here?"  It was. He explained that they do not make espresso drinks, and then described the different qualities of the coffees they have. His tone and demeanor were so incredibly sweet I wanted to incorporate him into my body.
      The other young guy (they looked like teenagers) who rang me up was equally kind. He asked me to tell him what I thought of the coffee because he was excited when somebody experienced it for the first time. They were both as soft and warm as Christmas puppies.
     Puppy #2 walked over as I was taking my first sip to see what I thought.
     I can tell you now that before I tasted it I loved it, because I had their little hearts in my hands.
    "I love it, I love it, I love it."
     I don't even know what it tasted like, frankly. 
     If I go back and there's an asshole behind the counter, maybe I can try it with some objectivity.
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description:
I was never a big coffee snob.  In fact, I'm still not THAT big of a coffee snob.  Yes, I'll be the first to hang my head in shame to say that I do suck down a cup of McDonald's coffee once in awhile in desperate times, or even the regular drip at Starbucks.

Then I discovered Blue Bottle and I realized what coffee SHOULD taste like.  

Just when I thought that it couldn't get any better, a friend introduced me to Philz.  

Omgad I am hooked.  I got the tesoro with the cream (my friend said that Philz must put crack in the cream or something...and I believe him ... how can you say no after that?) and a little bit of sugar.  It was silky, smooth, not oversweet, and so relaxing.  Another person in our group got the Turkish Delight, which had cadamon in it -- not as big of a fan of that, but then again I'm not into the bold dark roasts.

Would I come here again?  Um, yes fo sheez.  The service was nice, the atmosphere was chill, and the coffee was a type of coffee nirvana I had not known existed.  

And now I hear there is one on Van Ness and even CLOSER to me.  HUZZAH!
author: Shay F.

description:
The coffee is fabulous! Blue Bottle does not hold a candle to Philz on any level...taste, body, strength...not to mention the service at Philz (all locations I have tried so far) is superior.  They make your coffee exactly the way you like it and they are fast.  The little sprig of mint on top just adds that "je ne sais quoi"!
Love love love Philz coffee.
author: Nilu r.

description: This coffee is like no other.  It's delicious and they make it for you the way you like....talk about service......try the Iced Mocha Tesora....yummm...
author: Fatemah N.

description: The Coffee is sexy, strong and bold but still sweet. Matt can pour my soul anytime...
author: Electro A.

description: I like the vibe and the personalized cup of coffee. I came at night, so decaf was the only option and really, I prefer coffee in the morning and strong. The menu options look great, but it's a little overwhelming for the first time visitor. Thankfully the barista was extremely patient and helpful. I like the low key vibe of this shop.
author: Natalie S.

description:
They took a really simple concept (well at least I think it was simple?) and made such a cluster of it that myself and everyone else in the long scattered line were confusingly turning and asking each other if we were in the right spot and what we were suppose to be doing next.  

"The whole purpose of places like Starbucks is for people with no decision-making ability whatsoever to make six decisions just to buy one cup of coffee. Short, tall, light, dark, caf, decaf, low-fat, non-fat, etc. So people who don't know what the hell they're doing or who on earth they are can, for only $2.95, get not just a cup of coffee but an absolutely defining sense of self..." -You've Got Mail.

Yes, I am old.  I can remember when a latte was $2.95, Meg Ryan was America's sweetheart and people used AOL.

Let me attempt to give you some helpful information.
There is a man at a podium right inside the door.  His job apparently, is to talk on his cellphone with his roommate. Don't make eye contact.  It will anger him.  Up ahead is a row of Baristas in front of coffee pots with filters in them (technical term). There is also a fellow at a register.  In the middle of the room is a mob of people in various stages of acquiring their coffee.  
1) Avoid eye contact with podium guy.
2) make your way through the mob while confirming with each person that you are not in fact, cutting in front of them. 
3) Don't ask for a latte at the counter!!! YOU will be mocked.  They brew coffee bean to taste like a lattee based off of Ph.D level barista training. I finally just told her to make me whatever she recommends.  They brew the sweetness level too. (Sure if you say so.) 20 minutes in, I am sweating like it's the SATs.  
4) go back to the mob and work your way towards the counter to pay.
5) Pay.
6) Go back to the mob and agitated there until the coffee is finally brewed.
7) Grab coffee.
8) Avoid eye contact with Podium Guy (job still unclarified)
9)beat your way through the mob.  
10) Lean panting against the building and drink your okay cup of coffee. It didn't taste like a latte I guess it's cool that they don't use sweetner or milk . . . if you are into stuff tasting kind of crappy because it makes you feel like a superior human.
author: Kristine A.

description:
Expensive - Worth every penny. 

I always get something different, whatever the barista recommends, never disappointed.
author: kristen l.

description:
I am over blue bottle coffee!
After being introduced to Philz yesterday I am wondering where the hell I have been all these years.
Each cuppa joe is made one cup at a time, creamed and sugared to your liking and served fresh. Their cups are super cool, they have the built in sleeve which is something I have never seen before.
The best cup of coffee ever and I have only tried one flave! 
I am happy I found a mom and pop establishment I can support instead of Peet's or Starbucks.
author: Kehaulani K.

description: Tried the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee for the first time and I LOVED IT. Next time, I'm getting a large...maybe 2 large! I finished it craving more. Heck, I woke up the next morning wanting the mint mojito iced coffee!!
author: Eileen Z.

description: Philz was a very pleasant experience. Walking in for the first time I was unaware of their unique coffee style, and was quickly asked if it was my first time at Philz. Service was great and I waited a while until a seat opened up because I wanted to drink my coffee there.
author: Jean-Karlo T.

description:
Wow!! I had a major break in my work day today. On the recommendations of co workers I hopped on the J just to make a trip here.... It was well worth it. 
Basically this place puts blue bottle to shame. The coffee is amazing. They have so many flavors to choose from!! I suggest the new manhattan. They put cream and sugar right in for you if thats what you want. 
The staff was very friendly. Explained everything about how to order and gave me the best cup of coffee I have ever had.
author: Wes P.

description: Just moved out here and staying walking distance from Philz. Went along with the yelpers suggestions and got the iced mint mojito. It was freakin delicious. I went 3 days in a row to get it. Had to take a break though that's a lot of sugar and not to mention an expensive habit. $4.50 a cup and I swear it's gone in like 5 sips. I wish they'd have a frequent buyer card or something like that bc I am definitely a loyal customer!
author: Katie P.

description:
If there was ever a five star rating that deserved a five star rating this is it.  Seriously 300+ people are not wrong, this is the BEST COFFEE EVER.  You know their schtick already, one cup at a time, drip coffee, no lattes, they add cream and sugar for you, and it's pretty pricey for a cup of normal joe.  But still it is the BEST COFFEE EVER!

I don't even really do coffee, I enjoy it enough, but I'm not a big caffeine person so I don't really seek it out.  But I would seek out Philz because I just love the taste.  Seriously this coffee has the addictive properties if  Crack and Crystal Meth had a love child in a field of Opiate Poppy Seeds in Columbia.  I can't get over it.  Oh how much I yearn for it.  

It's not bitter, even their strong stuff, only full coffee flavor, which you will love.  GOD I CAN'T GET OVER IT!  

Philz is the reason I'm moving out to San Francisco from DC at some point.
author: Simeon T.

description: This place is great! I came in on a Thursday afternoon to get some coffee and it was delicious. The cashier was very sweet, and entertaining by singing along to Rihanna in the store. They grind the coffee beans and brewed each cup individually and made my mocha extra delicious. I wish that the atmosphere was more conducive to studying or hanging out, however there were only a few small tables and chairs. Overall, it was a great find!
author: Gretchen S.

description:
Philz here has the most confusing set up for ordering ever. Either that or the drones waiting for their caffeine fix are zombies unaware of the baristas taking orders. I always find it annoying when people stand in a line for 5 minutes and still can't figure out how the process works, making the line unnecessarily long while the folks behind the bar are calling "I can take the next order" as they continue to stand there pissing people (me) off rather than ordering like a normal person would. Venting aside, Philz has bomb, rich coffee. I think they add crack to it, my heart rate is still racing off a small cup of their Tesora, a sweeter, full-bodied brew with a mild acidity (to my taste anyway). Try it black for maximum flavor. I bought some of their Ambrosia beans, which I bought purely off the name alone (yeah, I'm that deep). I'll have to edit my review once I try them, since there is little description of any of their coffee varieties in store or online. 
Bonus points for having vegan offerings. I'm surprised the Starbucks around the corner is busier than Philz.
author: Danielle D.

description:
Anything but crackity crackity crack crack-a-licious.  See, I find comparing recurrently desirable beverages, foodstuffs and/or electronics to "crack" the equivalent of your Uncle Glen wearing a tie around his head at your cousin Wendy's wedding.  Celery has negative calories.  Have a sec?  Did I tell you the one when they tried to sell "No-va's" in Mexico?  Let's laugh and grow wise on worn-out humor and recycled knowledge together.

Get with the station, all them party kids aren't wearing floppy-tongued high tops and smoking the good ol' street crack like they used to, naw man, they're popping Hexadrose,  Amphetadrone and Percodrin.  They're pawing through Pop's medicine cabinet like it were an ancient Mayan temple and they're stuffing their floppy fedoras with whatever they can pull out with their cobweb-encrusted little hands.  Those kids want the legit, scientific stuff.  Stuff that makes stock options, stuff that has FDA approval, stuff that has been subjected to case studies at UCLA.  Stuff made in a LAB man!  

Philz is a coffee lab.  Those employed there are no mere baristas.  Nay!  They are coffee technicians, operating in the thin dimension created by Stephen Hawking and Pablo Neruda in a press box during halftime at the Superbowl last year.   You think it's easy?  You try it!  These folks at Philz are friendly, patient technicians too!  Ours lovingly explained the cryptic blends despite the onslaught of morning office zombies milling about searching for b-b-b-b-brains.  

My date was initially ready to run off like one of them lizards that lose their tale to confuse predators when she found out that Philz didn't have espresso but I coaxed her and her breakaway tail to give it a go.  This coffee was entirely unlike anything that we had previously tasted.  Our tastebuds said "WOW".  We said it too to emphasize the effect.

They should change the name to Pilz!  The party set will thank you and the rest of us will be more prepared for what we're getting into.
author: Steve B.

description: Best cup of coffee I've ever had. Delicious. I have never had Philz till today and will now go out of my way to get a another cup. I tried the Mocha and will definitely try the Chai next time. No bitterness in the coffee like most places.  I love the cozy atmosphere in here and especially the people watching. Awesome experience.
author: Joey D.

description:
Friendly service, local company, GREAT coffee (my fav is the Ambrosia with cream and sugar)....  only draw back is that it seems to take longer each time I visit.  BUT, one could say "great things comes to those that wait."  

Thanks guys!
author: Kyle P.

description: I am in love. A perfect cup of coffee every time. I need to start trying some different types but the Tessora is just so good that I have to get it every time! I love the workers at the Castro Philz. They are so sweet and always make me smile. I have also been at the Philz in the Mission - larger and more seating but doesn't compare to the castro baristas!
author: Danielle P.

description: I used to be a Blue Bottle fan all the way but I am now a convert. I don't think there is a better cup of coffee than Philz Tesora. Well maybe other Philz coffees are good too  but I tried Tesora and have become hooked and I can't get myself to stray. They know just how much cream and sugar to add every time to make the best morning treat ever. Oh the mint mojito is freaking delish too.
author: Rachel P.

description: I love Philz Coffee and it doesn't really matter where it's located (apparently) but I am always down for a cup. So naturally when we were done with ImaginKnit, we ended up in here. This is a smaller location but the service is great and the coffee, as always, is delicious.
author: Shauna S.

description: This is the third Philz Coffee that I've visited, the other two being the one on Van Ness and at Fourth and Berry.  This is the smallest of the three locations.  Even the coffee bar area is smaller than the other two.  Nevertheless, it's still the same outstanding Philz coffee and selection, along with the full service (including the addition of creme and sugar).
author: H K.

description: Closest to my apartment and the customer service is getting better each time! Love it :)
author: Bree G.

description: We stumbled on Phil'z after having a few too many beers in the Haight. We desperately needed a restroom and caffeine burst. Phil'z offered both. Their hand-poured espresso is a spin on the normal Starbucks job. We also got a soy mocha latte that reminded us of high school hot chocolate and was equally refreshing. We'll be checking out the location north of Market Street later in our vacation.
author: Sam P.

description:
The staff at Philz - specifically at the Castro location - are such a lovely bunch of cheerful baristas. They are adorable, funny, and sure to cheer up the most salty person in a bad morning mood (which might have been me a number of times). 

Thanks to the staff for being so charming. It makes the extra $2.00 per cup worth it when I decide to spend over $3.00 for a coffee (albeit of the highest quality). 

The selection of coffees, flavors, and effect in terms of caffeine strength is impressive.
author: G F.

description: Philz is love in a cup. I don't know how they do it. Actually I do. They use real deal full fat cream and sugar. Then they sprinkle in some rainbows and sunshine cuz that's what it tastes like! It was a bit of a wait but so worth it. The barista asked me if I like my coffee on the sweeter side and I said that I like it not too sweet and somehow he channeled my flavor preferences cuz the coffee came out perfect. The flavor has depth to it and it's 100% yum. Kinda on the pricier side but hey sometimes a girl's gotta live a little.
author: Angelina G.

description:
Yay yummy to order coffee!  I loved the coffee and was psyched about the little vegan mini donuts - I got one with chocolate icing and orange sprinkles that was sooo great.  The coffee is always fresh because they brew it to order by the cup and they also cream and sugar it for you which took getting used to but was worth it.

The only reason I am giving this place 4 stars is that there wasn't that much seating and the seating was a little run down.  

The peeps here are friendly and the service was fast though of course you have to wait for your coffee to brew.
author: Laura P.

description: The best coffee in the city!  Patience is a virtue...and I do not mind waiting for my coffee to be personally made each time.  My husband loves the Code 33 - and I love my mocha tesoro!
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
My first Philz experience, "Silken Splendour," was truly a life-changing revelation. Not since taking my first sip of Blue Bottle have I been turned so completely upside-down with my perception of the world (as it pertains to coffee). Awe and confusion. What have I been drinking up to this point? Toxic sludge? Turned to the boyfriend and suggested a move to the Castro might be imminent. Either that or it's time to start a letter-writing campaign to get Philz in our 'hood.

Get the coffee as they recommend. The Silken Splendour is mixed with cream and brown sugar. A fresh mint leaf adds a bright unexpected tone that I will crave from now onward. The staff is ridiculously friendly and helpful. 

Would it be weird if I started spending my lunch hour busing it down to SOMA and back for a cup of delicious Philz??
author: Carissa R.

description:
I heard the rumor that there was Jamaican Blue Mountain served here (my personal form of Heaven-in-a-Cup) so I had to stop by. I was greeted by very friendly and accommodating service, who helped me understand the rationale for the 25 different options on the board. And when I began to look a little down, he said, "You don't seem happy.... Were you looking for something else?" I sheepishly asked about the JBM and his eyes widened. "Why, yes! We do sell that! How did you know?" And I told him about yelp.com and my love to the JBM since 2003... and that finding JBM in SF has made all of my future days better.

He presented the coffee to me in the typical Philz's fashion - with a mint sprig atop the frothed milk layer of coffee. ... And the taste was heavely. Brought me back to my vacation in Negril.... Mmmmm.... And it was smooth.... God I love coffee one cup at a time.

Yes, it was $7, but the experience made me happy all day long...
author: Deirdre P.

description: Love the coffee, love the staff; we got the Tesora.  I had never been there before and upon telling the barrista(o) this, he was extremely patient and helpful.   I just wish there were more locations.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I love Philz coffee -- I especially love buying my beans here to grind and brew at home.  I'm an avid home brewer and I find their bags are well-priced and I love trying different flavors.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
Well, it's happened again: my fucking face has been shedding more skin than a molting sidewinder.
 
Yup, that bitch Mother Nature and her sick need to change the fucking seasons has ONCE AGAIN conspired with the Retin-A I take for acne, leaving things flaky and scaly. Basically, it looks like I have a major dandruff problem ON MY FACE. I know you're going to say "But Darin, you don't have acne" and "why don't you just use a face scrub?" To the first, I say Retin-A: Quod Fucking Erat Demonstrandum. And I DO scrub my face with a very HARSH exfoliant called Dermabrasion In A Jar, but it doesn't slough off all the scalies, so fuck you very much.
 
Sorry to turn your stomach with descriptions of my dermatological ailments, but look at it this way: at least you're just HEARING about them instead of SUFFERING through them.

Anyway, this past weekend I felt about as hot as Janet Reno, but instead of screaming "I AM REPUGNANT AND UNDESIRABLE" on the corner of 18th/Castro before I kill myself in a suicide pact with another ugly mofo like Kleist and Henriette Vogel did on shores of the Wannsee, I trucked over to Philz.
 
See, most cafes are the PERFECT places for me to hang out, wallow, and just be my disgusting self. I said "most" because I'm depressed and want to hide from the world, so of course I'm not going to Cafe Hairstyle (Flore) because all the world's a stage at Flore and I'll be tempted to show the business side of my hand to some of the Attitude Queens who prance there. Also, their coffee makes me puke. 

Philz, on the other hand, ROCKS MY FUCKING WORLD!
 
I grabbed a Mocha Tesora (EVERY blend on the menu will put the cream in your khakis), savored the escalated serotonin levels brought about by the minty, delectably bittersweet cup of joy, and read Either/Or because I'm a pretentious asshole with a martyr complex.
 
Alright, so I only PRETENDED to read -- I just wanted to APPEAR edumacated so I could have anonymous sex with one of the other desperate, intelligent men here.  I mean, this IS the Castro, right?  And nothin' says lovin' more than getting porked by a TOTAL STRANGER; it really makes me feel validated and pretty when people I don't know compliment my prowess.
 
No, I kid, I kid. I don't like anonymous sex -- HOW DISGUSTING! -- I just don't fucking care what your Momma calls you, you dirty whore.
author: d s.

description:
I don't drink coffee, but I love the iced hot chocolate at Philz. They make it absolutely perfectly - nice and chocolatey without being too sweet. The OCD in me especially appreciates that it's shaken, not stirred, and that they pour the hot chocolate right over the ice so you get a good variation of temperature. It's so very addictive, and the fact that it is located within Sit and Spin has made it hard for me to break a fast-forming habit. I've lapsed into making excuses* to wash my laundry so I can pop in to Philz.

Chalk on teacher clothes? Laundry time!

Spilled a drink on my jeans? Laundry time!

Took a shower? Laundry time!

We're having visitors? Laundry time!

Woohoo! Got lucky last night! Laundry time!

Student coughed on me? Laundry time!

Cat came within four feet of me? Laundry time!

Frustrating day where my car crapped out on me once again? Laundry time!

*Note: It's not making excuses, it's creating opportunities. Icey hot chocolatey waistline-expanding opportunities.
author: Devon S.

description:
I was out with the yelperazzi taking photos of Mission street art, when we stumbled upon Philz coffee. How is it possible I hadn't heard of this place? This is now my fave coffee joint in San Francisco! And that's sayin' a lot, with designer coffee on almost every corner these days.

I asked for something iced and sweet, and the girl working took the time to explain all of my options, almost the way you would describe fine wines. She ended up choosing a blend of two different coffees to suit my tastes -- Sumatra and Ethiopian -- and once the sweetener, cream and foam were added, I was in seventh heaven. 

Thank god for places like Philz! It makes places like Blue Bottle and Ritual feel sterile. Love me some down home coffee house flava.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Philz coffee this and Philz coffee that ... whats the deal with the Philz??

Well i finally figured out the deal.  Stepped into this Philz down in the Castro with a few friends of mine who were eager for their coffee fix.  Personally I'm not a big coffee fiend, but i was feeling a little sickly and tired and with the walking looming ahead of us on our foot sf tour (yeah for friends from out of town) i decided to induldge in some Philz.  

Being a newb, I was delighted to find some friendly and attentive staff to help me with my coffee choice.  I decided to go with the baristas favorite, Julie's Choice (or something with Julie in it, I know I'm horrible but there were so many!!)  And it was actually pretty good.  A little stronger than i might have wanted, but thats my error not theres. Ill def be going back t try some of their other selections.  

And who doesn't like a little mint garnish?
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Hi, my name is Adam, and I'm an addict. 

I remember my first time like it was yesterday... It was an overcast Sunday morning and my mother was talking on the telephone to a lifelong family friend who lived a couple of miles down the road from us. This being my mother and her friend talking, well, I knew that they'd be talking forever. At least, it seemed that way to me at the tender young age of 8.

As my mother was talking on the phone, I smelled the familiar smells of freshly brewing coffee wafting from room to room. I'd always appreciated coffees unique aroma, but alas, each time I tried to have a cup my mother would interfere, saying things like "You wouldn't like it" or "It's not for children, Adam." Not this time though. This time was different. I deftly picked up the cup she had set down earlier and had my first sip.

12 years after that, when I was about 20 years old, I had finally hit rock bottom. I had gone from drinking just 1 cup of coffee daily to guzzling down 3 or 4 cups an hour. I'd have to drink one cup after the other to even feel sober. It got to the point where I'd shoplift Folgers Instant Coffee and snort it in the back alley. My arms are still pockmarked and scarred from injecting pure Guatemala Huehuetenango, back when my supplier could still get it, at least. 

You don't want to know how I paid for it.

It was after an all night Jamaican Blue Mountain binge that I awoke in an over-caffeinated stupor, right outside the door of Philz Coffee in The Castro. I went inside, took out my wallet and said "Make me something that will make my head stop spinning." 

And they did. 

Ever since that day, the only coffee I've been putting in my  body has been from Philz Coffee shops and I'm never going back to how it was. This is the best, well made cup of coffee my world has ever known. Even though it isn't consistently flavored, it is consistently the best, and that's the most important thing.
author: Adam M.

description:
Phil's Tesora (Treasure) 
Phil's Sooooo! Good
Jacob's Wunderbar
Julie Ultimate
Tantalizing Turkish
Canope of Heaven
Aromatic Arabic
Anasthesia
The Philharmonic

Understatements all, once you've tasted any of these masterfully prepared varieties. One rich cup appeases my otherwise 5-cup-a-day habit. The hot chocolate is incredibly deep, dark and delicious. 

After Philz, anything less will leave you bottled up and blue.
...and you don't have to stand an hour in pee-pee alley to get it.
author: Andy R.

description:
Before heading over to Foreign Cinema for brunch and shopping, I got caffeinated at Philz.  I did not believe the hype really but since it was so close to my friend's place, I decided to check it out.  I had a large Turkish Brew and the barista actually winced when I said I wanted it black but he complied.  Then some stranger ahead of me in line felt the need to comment on it.  Really?

They don't know what they're missing.  5 stars!
author: Seong P.

description:
If you want to be a true connoisseur of weekend mornings in SF, you do the following:

1) Roll down to Tartine Bakery and pick up the divinely delicious baked goods of your choice (bonus points if you take your Vespa, your dog, or your hair is still wet)

2) Then roll back up to Philz and order the ludicrously luscious drink of your choice and take one of the relatively easy-to-come-by tables (bonus points for snagging an outdoor table, bringing the Chronicle, or inventing a coffee-drinking game around watching the other yuppies double-park).

Once you've tried the Tartine-Philz combo, forever will it dominate your taste buds.  Seriously, you will have a hard time refraining from offhandedly dissing every other coffee-pastry meal you come across, and your friends will take you for a major snob.  But oh, is it worth it. 

I went with the dark and exotic Turkish this time--highly recommended even for first-timers (unless you want to go with the mocha first, and hey, I can't blame you).
author: Wes M.

description:
I'm very serious about drinking my coffee black. 

I guess in the olden days women were serious about maintaining their purity. I have retained that instinct, but I seem to have projected it onto my coffee. I would definitely get into a jousting match with someone who tried to violate my coffee's honor, if we both had horses and long pointy things. Maybe even a fistfight.

I get offended when someone even suggests that cream or sugar might touch my coffee. For example:

Barista: Would you like room for cream?
Me: NO!
Barista: (fills coffee to the very top)
Me: (walks 10 steps and spills overfull coffee all over shirt)
Me: Drat it! I have ruined another shirt!

Although this problem could easily be solved by asking for room for cream and then not adding the cream, no. Just...no.

The first time I went to Philz, I ordered a coffee and, as usual, insisted on no additives. Unlike usual, the barista seemed truly hurt by this. I think Philz takes as much pride in blending cream, sugar, and other spices with coffee as I take in not doing that shit.

The black coffee was tasty. Among the best coffees I've had, especially because it was ridiculously caffeinated.

The second time I went to Philz, the most incredible thing happened:

Me: I think I might get the cream and sugar in my coffee. They are really serious about putting stuff in the coffee here.
My friend: REALLY?!?
Me: Yeah... I know... but I kind of want to try it. Don't tell anyone. 
My friend: Um... okay...
Me: Ohhh.... I feel guilty already...

It was about at this point that I turned around and saw a FRIAR in line behind me. Like, in full on friar gear -- brown cloak, white belt, cross around his neck. It's hard to be surprised by many people in the Castro, but the friar surprised me.

Especially when he said, "Come on! If you never give in to temptation, I'll be out of a job!"

Best. Friar. Ever.

At the friar's urging, I ordered the cream and sugar special. I'm not too proud to admit that it was amazing. Sweet and smooth while retaining much of the coffee flavor.

But I refuse to call the concoction coffee. I will joust anyone who does, if you provide me with a horse, a long pointy thing, and a friar to be the judge.
author: Liz G.

description:
With as many 5 star reviews that yelp has, it's hard to  believe that another would actually make any difference, but this coffee shop deserves all the five star reviews it can get.
 I've never been one to get all hot and bothered by a simple cup of coffee but when I first tasted the Turkish roast from Philz, I was smitten--it was something that was so incredibly different and fascinating--all other coffees will pale in comparison.  

I've tasted some of the other roasts they have--Jacobs Wonderbar, Julie's, Ambrosia....they are all great--but Turkish will remain my one and only true love.
author: Lale G.

description:
Crack in a cup. Please come to the Financial District. Pretty, pretty PLEASE.

Maybe it's fitting that their DT location is in the 'Lion...heh.
author: Alyson C.

description:
A coffee oasis.

One cup of the House special Tesora will make your caffeine-addicted tastebuds sigh.  A medium blend that took seven years for Phil to create - it's smooth, creamy, without any acidic aftertaste.  With such a harmonious taste, you're fooled into thinking this drink is mild.  Tesora can be dangerous and as the barista told me "it'll crack you up for the rest of the day."  

Each cup is specially dripped for every order and individually customized depending on how much cream and sugar you request.  Phil himself is there to ring up your order.

The decor has a random charm.  Mix-matched tables and sofas, a painted cloudy sky on the ceiling with trees, hand painted Phil portraits, regulars coming in to chat with Phil, and world music set the cozy and communal mood.
author: Pauline L.

description:
"The coffee at Philz is amazing and brewed to perfection!" (Bottom line ending shown on top)

For the past two years, I was able to kick my addiction to coffee.
