Yes, it takes a whole hell of a lot longer than St*rb*cks to get your coffee, but they're HAND brewing it. Duh. 

Leave me a seat and a newspaper and you will not incur my wrath for taking all the outside tables.
author: Alexis W.

description:
I bought a gift card from Philz and when I tried to use it, they said that they couldn't read any of their gift cards. However they were still selling them. Additionally they asked me to pay cash for the coffee I was ordering, even though I wanted to use the gift card. I'm sorry, but if it's your fault I can't pay by a method you sold me, the coffee should be complimentary. They also don't keep track of the gift cards they sell and accused me of lying when I said I purchased a $30 gift card and expected to be reimbursed for it. Never did get my money back and never will be back. Pretty crappy way to run your business.

Addendum...
After one of the owners read my review he personally emailed me and when I went to the 18th street location yesterday and was given a new gift card for the amount originally purchased. Am very happy with the way the situation was handled and will definitely be passing along kudos to friends about this business. Thanks Philz!
author: Roxanne L.

description:
I'm not much of a "this is the best whatever-the-eff" kind of guy, but this is easily one of the best cup of coffee in town. YES. Easily. 

It's smooth, it's flavorful, it's strong, it's hot. It fits in a cup and it doesn't make you shit your brains out.

They grind your beans in front of your face (if you lean forward real far), and you can pick a blend, if that's your bag. 

Way more expensive than Bluebottle, though, and Bluebottle is a bit better. Points for the selection and being able to craft your own bean blend, which almost saves the day.
author: Chris R.

description: Gonna add my credentialed opinion to Philz:  Best iced coffee I've ever had hands down.  I don't live nearby so I usually get this, but the first time I went I had a cup of black coffee and it was so good I had to stop what i was doing, sit down and do nothing but be in the now.  Thanks Philz for helping me along the path to nirvana
author: David V.

description:
I was walking back from ImagiKnit (but that's another review) when I stumbled upon Philz. Seeing their sign I thought, "Oh, Philz! They are supposed to have amazing coffee" so I went in, spent about five minutues trying to decide what I should get (small Tesora, cream and sugar), and walked out a changed human being.
Oh.My.GOD.
I'm finishing my cup as we speak and I have to say that this is as close to liquid ecstasy as I have ever come. The $3 I spent to be this happy was well worth it. I only wish there were a Philz closer to where I live, but I suppose I'll survive.
author: Steffany F.

description:
I love the coffee here, They have such a great variety of roasts and blends I'm pleased with all the selections I have made. They also have baked goods. Cookies to muffins I always find something tasty. I gladly walk by "Starbucks" everyday to get a cup of "Silken Splendor" 

The girl with the short blonde hair makes my coffee the best. she knows the right amount of creme and sugar for my taste buds. 

Best Coffee in the Castro.
author: Cecil O.

description: Philz Coffee is the Ke$ha to Blue Bottle's Lady Gaga: Crass and less sophisticated, but somehow almost as delicious.  And their iced coffee is some of the best I've ever had.
author: Dan S.

description: We had an incredible , prideful barista who ordered for us! What a delicious jolt of energy -- fresh and made-to-order! Stop praising Dunkin Donuts and try the real thing.
author: Andrew K.

description: My first time coming to a Philz Coffee I was greeted by a kind young man named Michael. I told him I was looking for a sweet coffee and nothing too strong. Michael made me something and it was delicious. His great service motivates me to stop by anytime I am in the area.
author: Darius A.

description:
my favorite coffee shops in SF. 
Excellent fusion drinks and great staff.
Enjoy!
author: Elena K.

description: I've already written a review for the 24th St. location, but gosh darn it, I love me some Philz. They usually aren't super busy when I stop here in the morning, which is awesome because I've recently discovered that I can get off my bus, get a cup of coffee, and then hop on the next bus. This is a smaller shop than the one on 24th St., but they do have a few tables set up inside and a couple outisde for nicer days. The staff are friendly, but their ordering system gets a bit helter-skelter when it gets crowded.
author: Jeremy J.

description: the coffee is super excellent.  of course that's to be expected when "manufacturers cream" is used.  At 60 calories per TABLESPOON, be ready to skip a meal after drinking the coffee.
author: Andi R.

description:
Had a 9 AM yoga class up the street.  Friends dragged me down her for coffee and a doughnut.  

The coffee is hands down the best cup I have ever had.  I ordered one of the dark roast brew.  It was rich, flavorful and had the perfect amount of cream and sugar. (They add it for you).

Oh,... the Vegan doughnut really sucked.

One suggestion, not a great place if you are in a rush.

Definately coming back.
author: John C.

description:
let's just cut to the chase... i work for starbucks and i daydream about philz coffee. yeah, it's that good. and i'm not really even a coffee drinker.

i've only ever been to this location because it's the closest to me, but in my opinion, it has to be the best because of the people they have working there. need a corny joke to brighten your day? done. want someone to remember your name and how you like your coffee? done. some eye candy for your "study breaks"? (okay, i guess that one really doesn't fall under customer service, but still... done.)

anyhow...go here.
author: Mj S.

description: There's coffee and there's Philz coffee. Even Blue Bottle falls in the coffee category. Philz is something else. It's an experience. The Ether, amazing!
author: Anne P.

description:
Philz rocks on so many levels.  My Mocha Tesora was damn near perfect and the fact that they personally brew each cup speaks to my inner Ego.  Wow..."I'm so important, and cool, and unique..."
Yep...thanks Philz for letting me know just how rad I am ....I will be sure to make you a weekly stop....if not more!
author: Sheila Y.

description:
I refuse to rate this place based on the horrible vegan donuts that are all the rage in SF. They are terrible. 

However, this place has 5-star coffee and I don't say that lightly. It's truly an experience. They brew every cup as ordered and it just has a completely different taste than the average cup of coffee. It's really in that amazing Americano range for coffee that's very hard to get too. 

They certainly do it right. 

Also, my friends had Chai, which was the best I'd ever had.
author: Andy P.

description: Amazing coffee.  The best I've ever had.  I took off one star because it is expensive.  If it wasn't so expensive, I would have my cup of Joe here every day.
author: Michael G.

description: The most friendly baristi in town!  Large variety of roasts to try- you really can't go wrong with any of them (hot or iced).  I really appreciate that they let you taste your coffee to determine if you'd like more cream/sugar.  Soy milk is available if you fear cream!  My favorites are the Ambrosia and Jacob's Wonderbar... yummm...
author: Bobby P.

description:
I had both their Turkish Blend and the Philharmonic Wow, and I'm seriously hooked.  The cafe smells delicious inside and it has a cozy, neighborhood feel to it.   The 'ole ball-and-chain and I stopped by for the first time last Sunday and drank our brews outside on the bench and watched one man buy a cup of coffee for a complete stranger who couldn't take his dog into the cafe. This gesture was super-nice considering these handmade coffees take a while to make!  That's something that'll officially put you in the holiday spirit, because if that ain't good will towards men, then I don't know what is!

Although I do know what isn't:  the sorta-cold barista-lady who served us our coffee...but she could've just been having a bad day.  Okay, resume holiday cheer.
author: Andrea U.

description:
I've had espresso in Italy and turkish coffee in Turkey, but when it comes to strength, nothing comes close to the cup I had yesterday at Philz.

I ordered an "Arabic coffee" and she asked me a couple of times if I wanted cream. The first two times I said no but when she let me taste it, I realized it would be way too strong to drink it black. But even with cream the cup was way too much (the volume is equal to about 8 espressos!). I managed to drink only about a half of it.

I have to admit that it was really good coffee. The sprig of mint is a nice touch.
author: Mark C.

description:
Strong crazy coffee yumm. The first time I came here I ordered my Tsora black - the woman behind the counter was all..
"are you suuuuuuuure?" and I was all"..well yeah I'm sure gimme my coffee.." then about 20 seconds later I came back in with my tail between my legs and asked her to fix me up right - and she did...perfect amount of cream, sugar, and mint. That mint totally does awesome things for that there brew. Strong, hot, by the cup coffee that tastes oh so good. I love coffee but I'm not so crazy about caffeine (I know, I know - what am I?..) and this shit is like rocket fuel..but *whimper* it's so good =O( 

From now on I will take cream, sugar, and mint when I'm at Philz...thanks for settin me straight, lady.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Mint tea with cream & sugar, please!!! 

I don't care how long the line is, this fresh mint tea is worth it! The staff is super friendly and the small shop is always packed. Great people-watching opportunities as well.
author: Gladys C.

description:
It'a not every day you get a custom, signed bag of beans from Phil himself.  

All you have to do is get married.

It's worth it. 

Trust me.
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
Yahooo!  Love this place.  Coffee made one cup at a time.  Don't worry it doesn't take to long.  I suggest the #1 with soy and light sugar.  Or a #2 with soy and light sugar.  Buy a fedora and go home looking just like Phil...

Damn.  The coffee is strong and good.  I and most San Franciscans are damn picky about our Brew.  So take it from me...this place is a must!
author: Christopher F.

description: 5 star crack coffee rating but, -1 for the high prices...so far
author: Deep S.

description:
This place is hands down the best coffee joint. EVER. 

Jacob, Philz son, works at this location too and has a coffee drink named after him. He is fantastic! Always remembers your drink.

I highly recommend the "Mocha Tesora" is is the bomb!

The 24th street location is a lot bigger and a little cooler than the 18th street, fyi.
author: Ingrid K.

description:
I came across Philz while haunting my favorite LYS, ImagiKnit, as it is right across the street!  I walked in and somehow I must have had 'mocha' written all over my face cuz he knew that's what I wanted!  FANTASTIC MOCHA!  I'm an idiot when it comes to which is better in coffee drinking, (OK, but I do know I love Peet's, too...), but I can honestly say that Philz is THE BEST mocha I have had!  I love how he makes it just slightly sweet and adds the little mint leaf-perfect touch!  I doesn't get any better!

Even if the yarn store weren't there, I would still drive across town (yes, that is literally how far I drive to get there) to get a Philz mocha!  I only wish I could get over there more often!

If atmosphere matters to anyone, I will let you know that I don't find this to be a 'cozy' type of "cafe' for someone to hang out and chit-chat in unless it is a nice day and you sit outside.  There is room to sit, but the sitting area to me doesn't feel all that inviting and is a bit crowded.  But in general, the business itself is inviting!  Definitely go for the coffee!!!
author: Leslie W.

description:
Philz is back. oh joy. 

rockin coffee, rockin people, half a block from my house. my hood just got a little more kickass. 

if you're a first timer, just ask them to whip you up something...you'll go home happy.
author: Geetika A.

description:
Dear sweet mother of Gawd!

The coffee is said to have a bit of love and compassion in it...and they were so not lying. This place...it makes my heart melt. It makes me smile oh so much. I heard someone walking by here say, "It takes so long to make a cup of coffee here...it's totally lame."

NO! No sir, you are lame. Hello, it takes so long because they are true craftsmen of coffee making. You want some generic little "instant" shit...you go to the store and you buy yourself some Folgers. Make your own coffee stooge!

You want a cup of perfectly made, cup-by-cup tastiness of perfection...you come here, and you wait, and you enjoy the wait because you know how wonderful your coffee is going to be.

Stupid walker-byers that don't know coffee...I pitty you...and your Folgers...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
God bless yelp.  I hadn't found good decaf since the Mountain View Farmer's market.  Then I found Philz.  Custom blend of french roast and ethiopian beans maybe.  Some sumatra thrown in?  Don't remember but it's awesome.  

Thank you yelp, you have saved my mornings.
author: Amy C.

description:
The way coffee should be..
I wish there was a Philz near my neighborhood or close by my work for my morning, afternoon, and after work coffee.  Delicious.  I never know how to order, so I say just give me the strongest and largest cup.  Perfection every time.
author: anita h.

description:
I just ordered a decaf drip coffee (Sumatra blend), and it:
1. tastes more like a thick, rich Americano than a drip coffee
2. tasted more like regular coffee than decaf.

I am officially won over. To top that, the staff are super friendly and really nice. If you take your coffee with cream and/or sugar, they add it for you, and they get it RIGHT. 

Other bonuses:

1. Free wi-fi (get password from cashier)
2. Attached laundromat (Sit n' Spin)
3. Lots of super-tasty-looking pastries
4. Outdoor seating
5. They sell hats (?!?!). Fedoras. $50. 
6. Pretty interior design.
author: Ashley M.

description:
oh ho! bless the hearts of those philz coffee going lesbians that hang out and talk to each other like strangers while their mangy obese dogs shed all over my vintage ensemble. i learn a lot about older lezbos and pray to all that's holy that it's not gonna be me there, in front of some semi-okay coffee shop talking about the most boring stuff like "remember that time we went to that wine tasting? yeah, that was cool" and then total silence for about 30 minutes.

the barista dude that is always working at philz in the castro is hands down the most friendly, the sweetest and most ready to serve! serve! serve! i swear, the boy has got to be a service bottom (pssst honey, if this is true, my high heel needs a polishing. you know how momma likes it).

the straight up on the philz is that it's passable coffee, decent atmosphere, and it's right around the corner. i'm lazy these days so heading to the mission to get four barrel or to blue bottle just isn't cutting it. i'd rather just lounge around next to the scares-me-every-fucking-time chipped face bulldog and mentally whine about the warm and minty caffeinated soup i'm slurping on. 

and that's my story.
author: Alysia A.

description: Best coffee. This location is much smaller with limited seating than the Philz establishments, rendering it 4, not 5 stars.
author: eDub W.

description:
Nice coffee!!! i only tried the arabian once, it is good!!! i like how they make filtered coffee!

did't have much experience about Philz! will go more!
author: Florence C.

description:
I had this for the first time on Saturday and i CANNOT wait to have it again.  i almost woke up a half hour early this morning to make time to go out of my way to get it.  it was absolutely delicious. this is one of those reviews you almost don't want to write because you don't want everyone else to know how good this place is and discover the secret!! 

all i can say is i am glad there isn't one in my hood or i would go broke on it.  no other coffee compares now! go phiz!
author: B H.

description: Hands down the best cup of coffee I have ever had in my life.  I'm typically a skinny vanilla latte kinda girl but this place blew me away.  I have faith that I can actually appreciate coffee rather than the sweetness I can add to it after having coffee here.
author: Daniella S.

description: I can not live without tasting this coffee everyday. I am so glad that this place has a location in my neighborhood. Great staff who try their best to make  everyone  happy. Their coffee is unique.You should come. You'll never go wrong with this coffee,,,,,
author: Hope S.

description: Hands down the best cup of coffee in town!  Possibly one of the best ever!  I frequent the castro and van ness locations, but well worth visiting the original in the Mission.  All have very different vibes.  If you are blessed to meet the owner Phil, he is a real delight.  The staff are passionate about coffee and helpful in selecting the right blend for you.  I am addicted to the Philtered Soul!
author: Susanna S.

description:
I had Philz coffee for the first time this week. I've been thinking about it every day since. I think I will make this a monthly or bimonthly splurge... hopefully it doesn't become an addiction because it's a bit pricey.

I just told the barista that I like medium roast, colombian beans, and that I wanted a decaf, and she handled the rest. Delicious, and totally worth savoring for the whole hour I was there.
author: Dina S.

description:
The very first cup of coffee I had here was ordered by someone else, it was very sweet and desert like. . .  it was good.

I returned a few weeks later, and attempted to emulate the experience.  No luck.  It was ok.  And the pastry I purchased was a day old (that I paid full pop for), yuck!!!

So the whole single cup brew coffee thing I think is a gimmick.  

Philz is good coffee . . . the place is pretty barren.  Free wifi though . . . so if you are apartment hunting and want to check the latest on Craigslist / check your e-mail for appointments and have some joe . . . hit Philz.
author: C M.

description:
Loved this place.

I don't understand why people would go to Starbucks when this gem is just down the street. I went in not knowing what to get, so I asked the Barista for his opinion. He was incredibly knowledgeable about the choices they offered and recommended a couple coffees he thought I would like.

Personable, tasty coffee, good prices, (and if you need to do laundry, theres a place right next door) what else could you want?
author: Rocky K.

description:
It was a typical Monday morning, I got my Peet's coffee, went to Corona Heights and stared at the view of the city. Except , while as was drinking my coffee it tasted different and didn't give me the jolt I so craved in the morning. It occurred to me that my coffee wasn't doing it for me anymore. So the next day I decided to check out Philz since everyone raves about it. 
I was very skeptical and was absolutely certain that people were just hyping this place up. This was my second time in Philz except I didn't get coffee the first time because I was flabbergasted that they didn't have vanilla lattes, so I left. 
Armed with my stainless steel cup and an appetite for caffeine I let the very nice barista hook me up....And did he!! OMG I've never had such fresh tasting coffee and the mint is genius. The warmnessof the coffee surged through my body and I suddenly felt energetic, optimistic and ready to conquer the world. My only problem is that Philz is not right next door to me, otherwise I would come here everyday. 

I had the #19 and it was amazing! You must try this place!
author: Molly M.

description:
"Regular soy or vanilla soy?" WTF? Who knew such choices were available!?!? Philz Coffee is fantastically and deliciously amazing. it's not served in a trying too hard to be PoMo space, with laptops attacking you in waves . . . Nope, none of that. The staff are very kind, and knowledgeable. They even offer an array of vegan donuts-- yum! I literally come here every chance I get, as you should too. :P

Their Mocha Tesora with vanilla soy, and added brown sugar is my favourite.
author: Federico V.

description:
My friend brought me here during a nice sunny Monday afternoon. I usually hate Mondays, which makes me a cranky crab. As a great way to kick off my spring break, we first get off the metro and walk into Philz. 
It's a nice small place, between a flower shop and a laundry mat. With a small line, and a couple of tables filled with people who were on their laptops, the place is over all really chill. They had a wide variety of pastries. I noticed that they had samosas there, which unfortunately I didn't try (but I want to next time!). I ordered a Mocha Tesora, medium sweet. As a first timer there, the barista guy was pretty patient with me.   When my drink was ready, he had me try it to see if it has satisfied my taste... and indeed it did! I love how they ask you how sweet you want it, and they let you try it first. I'd have to say that was the best mocha I've ever tasted, the fresh mint leaves that they add is also a really nice touch. I'll most definitely come back for more when I'm in the area.
author: Monina C.

description: Is as addicting as if one were and addict! Haven't stopped drinking Philz since I started 3 weeks ago! They have the Best Coffee !
author: Lady H.

description:
Do not get this place. All the hype about all the effort put into creating perfectly balanced blends of coffee and then what do they do? Recommend that you let them fill your coffee with heavy whipping cream--heavy effing whipping cream--and sugar. Folgers would taste good treated that way. If you think your coffee is so damn good, why mask the flavor? 

The one (and only, thank you very much) time that I went, the barrista asked if I wanted cream and sugar. I thought he meant, do you want me to leave room? so I said yes to cream because I like a little half and half in my coffee. Next thing I know I've got a cup of 3/4 coffee, 1/4 whipping cream and an oil slick floating on top.
No thanks.
author: Lisa S.

description:
PRODUCT: 4.5 stars
SERVICE: 3.5 stars
AMBIANCE: 2.5 stars

BONUS STAR: for a pretty darn strong cup of joe.

The coffee is made one cup at a time by drip (non machine) with a fresh filter each time.  

The selection is pretty solid.  There are at least a few dozen choices.  A connoisseur would probably notice the lack of single origin bean choices, but still, the beans are solid... mostly low acid.  The beans are ground on the fine side which really brings out the subtle differences.  The coffee is always strong.

I've had mixed luck with service.  Phil himself is pretty good.  Some of the other staff can be short.  Also, there are multiple locations.  Some are consistently better than others.  I've moved from SF and can't remember my favorite location so experiment out there and supplement my review!
author: Edward H.

description:
My roommate has been waxing poetic about this coffee place she stumbled across, called Philz (both locations), and about the banter she has with Phil at the Mission location and with Jacob at the Castro location.   She describes the coffee in terms usually reserved for talking about great sex or great art.

I figured that they probably had good coffee (--hey, it certainly had to be better than the coffee by the chain we all love to hate), but also figured that my roommate's enthusiasm was partly due to the fact that she simply likes to tell a good story.  

Well, I finally tried the coffee today, along with Jacob's banter, and I am a convert.  I'm not giving 5 stars because the place itself wasn't totally comfy and inviting (too cramped and busy), but I'll definitely be getting some coffee to go from Phil'z in the near future.
author: Eden H.

description:
It took me too long to finally go here...WAY too long.

Amazing coffee, amazing service and the round homemade looking aussie bite oat pastry thing compliments the coffee perfectly.

They make your coffee with love...and they get my love in return.
author: Nora B.

description:
This Philz is no longer under Phil's ownership- it is completely owned by his once co-owners. It seemed to happen overnight because I was completely taken aback when I saw the names have changed and the uberfriendly guy was not there to greet me. 

As far as I can tell, there is not that much of a difference. My favorite is the tesora ( i don't know the new name) - w/ cardaman, light sugar. About $4 for a cup- it's worth it if you want a nice buzz and something different. Not for everyday consumption. Stay away from the treats- they're a major disappointment. I'm not too keen on their mochas either- the chocolate tastes a little funny to me. 

I bring my friends from out of town here and they love it!
author: None o.

description:
I am definitely a lover of smaller coffee venues who make their own blend.
I went to heaven and came back when I had JAKOB'S WUNDERBAR its got great notes of cinnamon.
author: Victoria M.

description: It's like the southern front porch I never had, complete with the super rad wooden bulldog I never had. The coffee aside, I've run into the most interesting people and had the most stimulating spur-of-the-moment conversations right here on the bench in front of the sit n' spin. Everything from photovoltaics to erotic wrestling, to quantum consciousness, to cocoa hacking - musing with fellow bench sitters seems better with a freshly brewed Tesora or a Turkish blend in hand.
author: Alex B.

description:
Love the coffee there.. they take their time to make the coffee/tea..
have only tried three (philtered soul, mocha and Israeli tea).. coz i can't get over the taste of these three to try anything else.... ;)
Definitely worth a try at least once.. and once you do that... you are addicted for life ;)
author: hardik k.

description: Great coffee. Talented baristas. Just ask them for a suggestion. You will be very pleased. Take the plunge if you are into non fat. The make their coffees with manufacturing cream. It's OK to splurge. Go for it!
author: Alice P.

description:
Excellent coffee, who knew drip coffee could have so much flavor??  Try the cream.  I know, lots of fat - but they swore I'd love it and they were right.  Yum!  

I can do Starbucks, I prefer Peet's, but if I get a chance I drag my BF to Philz.  Crazy expensive at north of $3 for a cup of drip coffee, but to me it's better than my usual $4 latte...
author: Chase P.

description:
LOVE this location, have not been to the others. The mocha is great, all the hand brewed coffee is great, service always nice and accommodating(always explain the menu). About the same price, maybe a little more as Starbucks. 
They have some ok pastries to supplement the coffee. Parking is horrible so I only walk here from Noe or take the 24. Right next to a pretty flower shop. Nice to sit out on their patio and look at the flowers and watch people go by. If you must have a little adventure get a Philz and then walk up 18th and Guerrero and get a pastry at Tartine (if you can get in)! Also, just get your coffee and walk up to Dolores park, so pretty!
author: julie q.

description: Well, I'm a french press person so filtered coffee lacks the oils and crema and what is left is kind of light and foamy on top.  The barrista was great the cashier was snobby a woman.  I think I can find better coffee and service someplace else.  It wasn't bad-it just wasn't that good but it was one of the only places we could sit with a small dog.
author: Terri C.

description:
If I could only drink one kind of coffee for the rest of my life, it would be Philz.  Every cup is hand-made one at a time and I love the little mint leaf (?) they put in every cup.  The top is so frothy and they always seem to make it just how I like it, not too sweet and not too bitter.  

There's a bit of a wait (not terrible by any means) but it gives me a chance to look at all they're yummy pastries.  I notice the coffee tastes better when Phil himself makes it or one of his son's make it.  If they're not there, I recommend coming back when they are.  You know they have great coffee when all their advertisement is through word-of-mouth!
author: Tracy S.

description:
Oh, I loved it.  It was just down the street - coffee rich, full, lovely - each cup a work of caffeinated art.

Notice the past-tense.  

Arghhhhhhh!  What happened?  We went in for a weekend fix yesterday and the place is changed.  Some kind of power-struggle in Phil-land, and it seems Phil lost the battle. (?)  The name is obliterated on the store front, all the coffee names have been changed, and our favorite coffee maker (Joe) and his beautiful puppy (Ziggy) are nowhere to be found.  We left with coffee (same beans, we were told) , a profound sense of disorientation, and a LOT of questions.

Any insight on how this occurred would be appreciated.  The whole things seems shrouded in a strange mystery.   For now, we are mourning the strange disappearance of our familiar, delicious Philz.
author: yelposity o.

description:
FAN-F*#@%ING-TABULOUS!  

who knew that you could walk into a cute quaint little coffee shop and not lift a single finger to make your coffee perfect??? that's right the sensational baristas grind your beans, throw it into a filter and slow drip your flavor into a cup, THEN they actually add the cream and sugar to your liking.  like a good wine they present it to you to taste to make sure that it is to your liking...sweet or bitter...you choose!

the decision on choosing which coffee roast you are going to try is the hardest part of your visit here.  they have over 30 different roasts that all sounds absolutely delicious --- it's MIND BLOWING!  if the thought of choosing just one is daunting the kind barista will help you out with your decision.

love this place and you will too!
author: Preston N.

description:
This review is for their Chai only. I don't drink coffee, though everyone I've taken here who does loves it. I don't know why the Chai is so good, but I have a feeling the fresh mint they put in it has something to do with it. 
Also, Phil's son, Jacob I think he's called, is super cute and friendly.
author: Mari O.

description:
best. coffee. in. sf. hands. down.

mint mojito is a++++++++++++
all their house brews are a++++++++++
service is out of this world and an overall fun place to hangout.

phil is an EXTREMELY nice and geniune guy you will frequently see behind the bar.. he even once made me a drink he made up on the spot.... as i was waiting for mine. this is my perferred location, but i also frequent the one on berry in soma and jacob and the staff there are awesome as well.

once i get out of the pennisula and working in the city again, philz will have 110% of my daily visits and peets will be my distant second (sorry blue bottle, youre meh to me)

keep on keepin on phil and jacob!!!
author: Ryan L.

description:
Some of the best coffee I have had in the US.

Had a decaf Sumatra that was rich, nutty and delicious.

Donuts were actually pretty great too - moist without being greasy.

With the cream, it is actually too rich to drink a large on a regular basis.  I look at it as a special occasion place, rather than a regular date - don't worry Peets!
author: Andrew H.

description:
Favorites:

Dark: Jacob's
Medium: New Manhattan (to me, this is the most complex roast overall)
Light: Sooo Good
Decaf: Who the eff drinks decaf?

Best beans in the city. (Take that, Ritual and Blue Bottle!)
author: Daniel S.

description:
OH JOY OH JOY OH JOY!!!  Philz has reopened in the Castro.  I was driving down 18th Street today and there in the empty spot in front of the Sit & Spin was PHILZ!!  Same coffee, same blackboard menu, same owner.  I got me a big ole Jacob's Wunderbar and practically kissed the guy behind the counter.  (It's okay. It's the Castro.)  

The new address is 4023 18th Street next to the flower stand.  THIS IS THE BEST COFFEE IN TOWN!!  Hurrah!!
author: Dirk B.

description:
Best Coffee in SF. I love this coffee and love starting my morning off everyday with Philz coffee. If you bring your own cup in you get a large for the price of the small. (2.75) I also recomend getting the iced Jacobs wonderbar with cream topped with a mint leaf. OMG you will fall in love with this special brew. 
I go to the SOMA location...its dog friendly, computer friendly and ladies look out for Jacob the hottest barista in the city!!
author: Janine E.

description:
Coffee is perfect.
Owner is loved.
Staff is great.

extra plus++++ Local Art and Independent Advertisements adorn the vicinity.

How can you not like Philz?
This place is rad and I wish it was on every corner.
author: Mira T.

description: Didn't think I would like it....turns out it was one of the best cups of coffee I have had in the city. Was weary because it wasn't espresso based, turns out I was just being a misinformed snob.
author: Alex R.

description:
Phiz prides themselves on their original roast and the one cup at a time method. Doing a Pepsi challenge with a another cup of coffee immediately proves that Philz know how to make an excellent cup of coffee. The store is typical of a coffee shop in San Francisco with a hippie hipster feel. The corner the store sits on provides some good people watching in a busy part of the Mission. The staff is friendly and wants to ensure that your coffee is too your liking requesting that you take a sip before leaving their station. All this attention does have a downfall, in that it is not a grab and go type of place, and often the ordering can be a little hectic. The coffee is not the cheapest either, but sometimes you got to treat yourself and I imagine is comparable to a "gourmet" chain like $tarbucks. But if you really enjoy coffee and have some time to kill it is a great place.

The food ranges form breakfast burritos, scones, muffins and the like. The guy  preparing the food when I happened to go there a few times is not look the cleanest, but then again it is Sam Francisco so what  else is new. I will say that the original location is much less pretentious than the Berkley location and has a better vibe, but both locations make an excellent cup o' joe.
author: m p.

description: They do a great job and  coffee quality and flavor is awesome and of course since they make it then... fresh.  Only down side is you get a little attitude sometimes when your new and don't know what or how or order if there is any line at all, but not always, I am at 50% of my visits on this, but not any worse than StarBucks for saying the order or temperature, size and drink out of order and their  coffee sucks on top of it so I will only deal with any attitude for something this good.   It feels a bit like your at the old school record store and the "too cool" employees give you that look when you ask for something modern and progressive like your stupid and don't belong.  If they can improve the attitude, they could rule the coffee world.
author: Joseph F.

description:
my fave philz spot in the whole wide world! 
yay
im there with mocha tesora OR ether, or anything that might excite me much. 

with their lil pastries, im GOOD TO GOOOO! nom

also, you feel cozy and inclusive here.
the staff are the NICEST and COOLEST people you'll EVER MEET. =)
i feel like a family here, no kidding.
author: Marc K.

description:
Me and my wife love this place.  The coffee rocks and the staff is even better.  Its definately an experience.  We always look forward to coming in and grabbing a cup of Java. Get the special coffee, which is a treat. 

By the way... I work for Starbucks Corporate.
author: David K.

description: Really good coffee, but just tell me how much cream is in the shit, and I'll stop drinking it.  For now, it's my newest addiction.  And should we be at all concerned with the amount of waste going on with individual brews and no coffee mugs in sight?  I don't want to get eco-crazy on you, but it does cross my mind.
author: M M.

description:
Do you like hipsters with your coffee? If you are nodding your head then you should go here. 

Do you like good coffee? If you are nodding your head again then you should definitely go here.

Do you like friendly barista's? I think you get the point

I enjoy the funky, relaxed atmosphere, but it seems like whenever I go there is never a place to sit, though it is fun to sit outside and people watch. There are always entertaining things to see in the mission. 


I have heard that sometimes Phil makes an appearance, though I must admit I haven't frequented the place enough to experience his presence.
author: Emilie B.

description:
Every single cup is hand-brewed for you on the spot! The "hand-made" note is on their sign but I didn't know what this would actually mean. Well, you'll have to stop in to see!

It's simply wonderful...and yes, it's right across from the magnificent Samovar but they aren't similar enough for comparisons. 

You either want great tea and ambiance or you just want great coffee.

I had an Arabic coffee-- which was THE smoothest, roastiest, yummiest thing I've had to drink in a long while. The barrista did, however, add milk to it without warning. 

The Jordanian owners told me this was their first coffee business effort-- and, oh, what a success it has been!

The service is friendly but the space is a bit cramped. Needless to say, parking will be nearly impossible. If I lived in the area, this would be my go-to spot for sure. Try the Istanbul Treat...a non-coffee concoction for the senses! It has cardamom and a bit of this and that; the owner was throwing pinches of spices into the cup and the only one I could make out was cardamom! My partner had it with soy milk and after a few sips, I nearly walked back to get one of my own. Enjoy this unique spot!
author: OKAY O.

description: Love the green tea with mint at Phil while doing laundry at Sit n Spin.
author: Kurt M.

description: I don't know what you put in that Iced Coffee, but it was pretty much amazing and here I am a day later and who knows how many miles away in Seattle and I am craving another like crazy.  Please let me know if you decide to expand to the north!  Plus with a nice chill environment, great music, and free wifi, it's hard to have much else to ask for.  Thanks for making my day!
author: Matt B.

description:
this coffee kept me up for 48 hours. i wish i was joking, but i dont joke about stuff like that, or at all. i am completely serious when i say they have vintage pastries too.

you really don't believe me? go check it out for yourself.

also, they sell hats.
author: bailey g.

description: Very popular and very crowded (hard to find a seat.)  They don't have espresso drinks, just coffee, that is made to order.  But it is the best drip coffee I've ever had.
author: Aaron W.

description: I give this place a 4 because I am not a coffee lover, but I had some of the best chi tea ever! It was filled with Phiz special milk and honey, with a sprig of mint. Delicious... I hope to get back there soon.
author: Sarah B.

description: Wow, didn't know baristas could have such a bad attitude... and then the coffee itself didn't live up to all the hype.  I won't be returning, but I'm sure they don't care anyway.
author: Tracy B.

description: Excellent coffees, teas and pastries made one at a time, served with a smile in the heart of the Castro. Free wifi, outside seating, a Sit and Spin washateria and attractive staff make this a great place to meet a friend or work on your laptop.
author: Mark B.

description: Come here for serious coffee.  I don't see it as a really good coffee shop to hang out in, although lots of awesome dogs come by.  But the coffee is amazing (I'm not a big fan of coffee in general, but I really dig their coffee).  The baristas are amazingly helpful and friendly.  I love living right next to Philz Coffee.
author: William C.

description:
love this place - a little pricey, but the moroccan mint tea latte thingy (or as it turkish...hmmm)...is INCREDIBLE. Sweet and frothy and not like anything I've had in SF before.

nice outdoor seating to people-watch. Friendly staff.
The bulldog statue outside looks too real sometimes. lol.

Strong strong coffee. If you need a little pick me up after a day of city walking, definitely stop into philz. better than blue bottle by the way.
author: Tara S.

description: Not your ordinary cup of coffee, few coffeeshops can hold a candle to philz. Pricey sure, but if you're paying $3+ for your Odwalla you can afford to pay the same for the best coffee in the universe.
author: Jon U.

description: Not to add to the clamor, but my boyfriend, who obviously loves his coffee more than he loves me, drools when I mention Philz. I could be standing naked in front of him and he will still head for the door.
author: Arwen O.

description:
LOVE

LOVE

LOVE

All you need is love...and all I need is Philz.

NYT calls it the nation's best...I call it my little piece of heaven.

LOVE!!
author: Sonia P.

description: So good, I was intimidated to write a review. The best coffee of my life. I think it'd be the best coffee for most people I know, and I've been on the horn to let them know that. I've considered more than once, just cabbing their in the morning for a cup and cabbing back- which is so not me. It at once makes me relaxed and see all that's great in the world, and at the same time gives me the energy to fix all that isn't. I could be bribed with Philz- it's a miracle I haven't yet.
author: Jean W.

description: This is a little love-hate for me. First off, the coffee is superb. Hands down. But as an eco-guy, seeing a single filter wasted on just one cup of coffee bugs. Not sure what the happy medium is. At least they have organic doughnuts.
author: Jerry S.

description: MMM delicious. So after a few years hiatus from drinking coffee, philz has me coming back for more. Albeit their prices are a bit high, but they have a friendly staff and a convenient location, but the best of all, is that I can drink the coffee as soon as they hand it to me, and not have to walk around for 20 minutes with a full cup of coffee like an idiot waiting for it to cool down. I don't know how they do it, but it is amazing (not to mention the coffee itself is amazing) I haven't experimented too much since I've still got my caffeine training wheels on, but you can't go wrong with their house brew, which I think is called Tornero.
author: Allyson S.

description: I had forgotten how awesome Philz is. I used to go to the shop in the Mission, back when there was only one Philz. This place has the same great coffee. It's a bit more compact, but thoroughly enjoyable.
author: Dana L.

description: So, this place just opened up across the street from my house and while my loyalties lie with my favorite tea house, Samovar, Phil'z with their bright green facade has become a staple to begin my day.  The owner, Phil, is great and if you tell him it's your first time, he'll hook you up with the best cup of coffee you've ever had (at least one of them).  Don't make a request, just let him do his thing, fattening cream and all.  Each cup is handmade so don't go in if you've only got 30 seconds.  This cup is like a good Guinness pour, nice and slow but so worth the wait.
author: Rachel C.

description: His secret is ginseng and cardamon.  Don't say anything!  He'll kill you.
author: Susan K.

description: Philz coffee is one of the best cups of Joe I've had in a long time--and I'm picky. Having worked for coffee shops forever, its hard to find the perfect cup--but Philz does a pretty damn good job. Each cup is made individually, and comes out perfectly frothed with a little bit of soy or cream. They have so many different types to choose from---light to dark--as well as an iced coffee freshened with a sprig of mint. The service is great, and it is definitely a place I bring friends or people from out of town. Its worth the $3-$4 a cup. PS--if you bring in your own mug, no matter how big it is, you only get charged for a small....
author: Courtney H.

description: I've seen this place and it was so unassuming, I thought the banner that says best coffee somethin' or other was just a put on...but it's pretty accurate.  I thought I would never find a better cappuccino than blue bottle and I really haven't , but I found some equivalent coffee pleasure-- only 4x larger (and the same price).  I ordered a large thinking it would mean a double and he gave me 20 oz. of luv with a mint leaf on top!  They actually don't do espresso drinks they just do coffee "one cup at a time," but they mixed it so it'd be cappucinoish.  He asked if I want it w sugar so I guess they'll add that too...NY style, but with good coffee.  I've only had the one cup, but first impressions are the best 5 stars.  + cute barista (this factor did not influence my review in any way)
author: Elle L.

description: Great coffee that's brewed by the cup. It's at least $2.75 for a small and it takes a few minutes to get your drink, but it's well worth it. The employees are all very friendly and helpful with selecting a coffee since the menu is quite vast. This Philz is my favorite because it's less crowded than the one on 24th and Folsom and it's way less of a scene of hipsters in suspenders.
author: Rex D.

description:
This place is awesome! I came here for the first time (a shame it wasn't years ago) with friends from out of town. The two gentleman baristas were super friendly and informative as to what to order. I had their chai (sweetened with brown sugar, though they also offered honey). I kid you not, it was the absolute best chai I've ever had, anywhere. 

Plus, I was very satisfied with the non-corporate support I was lending to the small business chain. Well done all around! I CANNOT wait for future visits!
author: Jeremy K.

description: Philz beats Blue Bottle by a mint leaf in the battle for the best coffee in San Francisco. Don't call Phil a "barista" -- he is an artist, serving up delicious, small-batch roasted coffee brewed by the cup. While I love the Philharmonic Wow, I also suggest describing the kind of coffee you'd like and letting Phil mix up a custom combination just for you. And let Phil put some cream and sugar in your drink -- I hate the look of disappointment on his face when I ask for mine black.
author: Heather F.

description: Great coffee, I learned the hard way that they don't focus on espresso drinks but specialize in strong specialty flavored coffee. If you're looking for an espresso drink check out Ritual on Valencia or Blue Bottle on Linden in Hayes.
author: Phil M.

description: Wow! I had a soy latte here over the weekend and it was great! At first, I was skeptical about the handmade coffee. I thought it was just a gimmick but gimmick or not, the soy latte I had was excellent. It was perfect for a lazy weekend afternoon.
author: Barney M.

description: Pretty darn good.  I recommend the Philharmonic.  It has mint in it.
author: Brian D.

description:
coming home from luch and while driving down 18th i spotted this place.  i made the mister pull over so i could jump out and get my post-lunch cuppa joe.

their coffee is my new addiction.
author: Sheri N.

description: Oh Phil, you had my heart the moment you set my singular cup of coffee to brew, looked me soulfully in the eye, and said "it's all about patience." Not being a patient person, I momentarily held this laid-back philosophy close to my heart, where it stayed until the profound amount of caffeine kicked in and I shot like a bottle rocket around San Francisco for the rest of the day. Delayed gratification, if you will, at its best.
author: Jill C.

description: Super nice baristas working this evening. I had a small hot chocolate ($2.50) and it hit the spot. Though it was a powdered mix, the chocolate didn't taste like Swiss Miss and had a deep, chocolatey flavor. And not too sweet. Another plus is that it was served piping hot. Oh yeah, on my way to Philz, I had to walk by not one but TWO Girl Scout cookie sellers. Took all my willpower not to stop and buy seventeen boxes of Thin Mints. Mmm, thin mints...even better when you freeze them!
author: Nathalie L.

description:
liquid cocaine.

so the first time i went into philz, i was practically coerced by some die-hard afficionados and while i liked the coffee (i had their iced one), i wasn't all that blown away.  the thing is, it's hand brewed and if you like cream and sugar (which i do, though only a smattering of the latter), the mix it up for you, and it ends up  having a good but very "unique" flavor that, well, doesn't quite taste like any coffee i've ever had.

the second time i came was a couple of months back.  i had the "philharmonic" and was completely thrilled to be able to disappear into my cuppa simply bc i was on a bizarre pseudo date (we were supposed to go out, but then i flaked, and yet he ended up in my hood coercing me to go out anyway).  the philharmonic was key for that event bc the guy was just so effing *happy* i could barely handle it, but at least the extra jolt of caffeine helped me cope with his excessive effusiveness (in his defense, he'd just passed his phd quals, so maybe the boundless joy was somewhat warranted).

anyway, months passed and every so often i would get this feeling in my stomach, in my mouth, and in my brain...i would just randomly have this *need* for philz.  i can't explain it, but just two visits and somehow i'd be hallucinating about their coffee in the middle of the day.  hell, after i go for a run in the cold, when my ears are numb and my fingers about to fall off, i still feel the need to get their bizarrely milky iced coffee.

i don't quite get what's going on, but i like :).
author: Roshni R.

description:
everybody knows the coffee is amazing, that's old news.
now who loves jacob as much as i do?
author: shae t.

description: I want to give four stars because of the dinginess of the setting, but the coffee is so good that it doesn't matter. Wow! It was flavorful in an unexpected way, unlike any other coffee I've had, to the point of being something else, in a different category. It should be called something else.
author: Keith R.

description: Had the most wonderful mocha here yesterday. The bittersweet chocolate made it taste gourmet, authentic and amazing. My companion who hails from Italy, also said it was one of the best cups of coffee he ever had.
author: Elise B.

description:
I was a skeptic... I love my coffee in the morning, but I have never been someone who had to have my coffee from the same place everyday. It didn't matter where I got my fix. Philz changed that for me.  

Each cup is brewed individually and it shows. They're fast despite this.  Everyone who works there is friendly and quick. Bring cash and try and "its the best" large. I wake up now craving just this coffee and no other holds up next to it. Its a little upsetting that my standard has been set so high now when any coffee used to do the trick, but I'm hooked.

I've also always liked dressing my own coffee... let your controling nature go here. They know what they're doing! and I suggest you let them because you will not be sorry. "Light cream, light sugar" and they make it AMAZINGLY.
author: Kirsten S.

description: on an 85-degree SF morning, you gotta find an iced coffee, pronto!  I spotted Philz while wandering the Castro, and they delivered - it was amazing!  and I don't drink coffee often...  It was so delicious, I was tempted to order a second cup right away, but I knew I'd be totally wigged out so I resisted.
author: Katie C.

description: Phil is the lord of coffee!! Everytime I have a new visitor to the city Phil's is one of the first places I take'em!
author: Dulcinea G.

description: I don't know why I'm even wriing a review considering it's got almost a hundred reviews so far...but I just had to lay down my love for the philharmonic with cream and sugar.  the cardamom makes this the most delicious, mellow, rich late afternoon buzz treat ever.  and the guy who served it to me today had the most beautiful smile, and we talked for about a minute about the coffee, and how, gee, the world looked so much brighter and clearer - like it does after a hard rain.  Philz philharmonic - it's a mood enhancer.  Get some!
author: Jessica B.

description: I had a mocha here once while I was doing laundry at the Sit N Spin.  They brew it by hand here, which seems to be a very labor-intensive process, and the barrista was very concerned that I realized it was going to be brewed by hand, and whether I'd had coffee brewed by hand before, and whether I knew what to expect.  (I assured her that I was the adventurous type, and I was sure it would be fine, even though I'd never had hand-brewed coffee before.)  She asked if I wanted to try it with mint, and I said sure, why the heck not?  Generally, I'm not a huge fan of the mint/chocolate combination, but this was very, VERY tasty.  (Not as good as Ritual, mind you, but still pretty darn yummy.)
author: Angela B.

description: Best coffee in SF. The place gets packed but still feels super friendly. You order the kind of coffee in terms of what kinda bean. They grind it on the spot and then drip one cup at a time. They ask you if you want sugar and cream then wala, the most amazing cup of joe you'll find in the city.
author: Hyung L.

description: "sooooo goooood" is sooooooo goooood! You HAVE to try this lighter roast with cream! Rumor has it that Phil Jacob has secret ingredient inside the cream to make it very very delicious! Or try its classic philharmonic! Every drip is fresh from ground-up!
author: Cathy Y.

description:
How can this place have the best cappuccino in SF when THEY DO NOT HAVE A ESPRESSO MAKER. The make drip coffee by the cup and will put some foam on it if you want.

THAT is NOT a cappuccino.

Good coffee however.
author: Chompy S.

description: Best coffee I've ever had!  The exterior and intetior of this place is nothing out of the ordinary but the coffee is SO GOOD!
author: Grace L.

description:
You will reconsider what you think Is coffee after you have philz. 

I want philz in my mouth every morning
author: Jon R.

description: Philz Coffee MUST be experienced. Starbucks/Peets is a slap in the face compared to Philz. Philz is fresh and delcious and addictive. Try the Turkish blend or the Mint Mojito coffee. I also love the way they put fresh mint in every cup. What's better than mint? The workers are also so sweet and friendly, regardless of the location, which really makes a difference.
author: Hanan H.

description: I'm not a coffee drinker, "philzharomics" is amazing! Ask for "medium". With sugar - good. Their house cream - wow. One mint leaf - omfg!!!
author: Chris L.

description: I fancy Philz just about anytime of the day. I don't think I've heard anyone order a latte or a capp from this joint. And why the hell would they? The coffee is straight up solid. A hangover doesn't begin healing til' I've had my first cup of Philz. Good to note: Jacob is the drip master. He knows his beans.
author: Sommer N.

description: I'm very pleased to say that I have been to all Philz locations in the Bay, except for the new Civic Center.  Philz is literally my favorite cup of coffee in the world. Yeah, the world.  I've tried a lot of the menu, and my recommendations are Tesora, Philtered Soul and Ambrosia.  I guarantee that Philz surpasses anything they serve at Ritual, or Blue Bottle; it makes Peets taste like poopee-water. If you like coffee at all, you must experience Philz. Any location.
author: Emily M.

description:
i wanted to try a new coffee spot. i wanted to bring my mother. i was looking for something with a scene more modest than ritual, and more accomodating than blue bottle....so i found philz. 

there are obivous formalities here. you wait slightly to the left to order. slightly to the right to get your drink. wait no. you wait to the right to order, then wait for your drink and then pay. wait. ahahah. im not sure.  its sunday morning and i havnt had any coffee yet so im feeling graceless to say the least.

luckily, i chose the line that ended with a nice girl peering over the counter towards us, and didnt feel rushed when my mother wasnt sure if she wanted cream in her coffee or not. 

we sat outside next to a mop and a bucket, on a metal (brrrr cold) bench.  so the outside ambiance wasnt perfect, but the people watching was nice enough, and the coffee was strong.  so strong that  my attention became so amplified to everything around me that i forgot how cold my ass was. 

sorry my back pack was in your way, people. thanks for your patience, philz. i will probably be back some time.
author: coffeecake j.

description: Another Fiver for their second location that I've been to. It' s small compared to the Palo Alto location, but definitely has its charm. The coffee is amazing as always. This time I tried the dancing water. I loved it.  Another new discovery is a large Anesthesia to the upside combined with the dancing water, Drink half of it while its hot, hen when it gets too lukewarm from siting there (I'm a slow drinker), throw some ice in it. Voila...a brand new drink! It's strong enough,and with the perfect amount of cream that it won't be watered down. I love these guys,
author: Cherleen W.

description: Ok say I've already reviewed his other location, but I was SO EXCITED to see that they re-opened a Castro Philz. I was very sad when they closed the one down the street. Anyway, I took my bff from LA here the other day and just raved about how amazing this stuff was. Phil himself was there and he made our drinks even more amazing than I can remember. I told her she'd be awake till thursday. She tasted the Philharmonic without the mint leaf at first, then Phil demanded she give it back and then he poured 'love', literally, into her coffee then he dropped the mint leaf into it and she tasted again. She was wired for days and fell in love faster than a lesbian's first time at the lex.
author: Mama Jaz C.

description: I finally tried Philz after hearing about how great it was for ages. After one sip, I nearly spit my coffee out laughing at myself for even bothering. I should have known better.  I can't believe anyone would fall for this wretched gimmicky coffee pretending to be something it isn't.
author: Claire B.

description: Hands down- best coffee in the city. I order their Turkish brew and let them add in my my milk/sugar and they always know the right balance to put in. Also, their brownies are a perfect match to your beverage!
author: Luce T.

description: I tried Philz for the first time today, and holy crap! it was the best cup of coffee I have ever had, stateside at least. I am already trying to figure out how I am going to get my buns over to the Castro tomorrow morning for another cup.
author: courtney W.

description: So good! Best mocha I've ever had. Loved the chocolatey bits floating around in the coffee. Why don't all coffee shops grind their beans to order??? Come on, let's get with it.
author: Jenna M.

description: Coffee is pretty good and pastries tend to be monster-sized and upstanding flavor, but customer service at 18th st location is spotty.  When I get parking the night before nearby, I go to Phils for a pick-me-up morning.  HOWEVER, when I'm asked what I would like in my coffee, and I say a "splash of two percent" the response from the cafe server SHOULD NOT be "you should really have cream with that."  I admit I am one of those people who in the morning when I'm attempting to wake up I just WANT WHAT I WANT.  Save the sales-talk for people with nothing to do... and nowhere to go.
author: E L.

description: Checked this place out today, not many people there. There was an extensive menu of different coffees, which was rad. However, my large coffee was $3.50. That is pretty expensive for a black coffee. It was tasty, but nothing amazing. My girlfriend got a black tea and THAT was DELICIOUS!
author: Tim M.

description: cute place to hang out and really yummy coffee. gotta try the other 2 locations. next time i gotta try their mint mojito iced coffee.
author: Tay T.

description: i finally got me some Philz and it doth rock!  I wanted to hang out and have like 3 cups of coffee but i realized after my 1st double espresso coffee jobber that they leave their single brew setting on "TWEAK BITCHES"
author: Chard M.

description: I really hate it when people insist on one coffee shop being "the best." The amazing thing I love about coffee is that there are so many ways to enjoy it. It is, after all, an extremely diverse beverage, and I hold the greatest respect for my fellow growers, roasters, and baristas. That being said, almost any good coffee establishment does one aspect "the best." And godDAMN, Philz sure knows how to make a good cuppa joe. I mean, making coffee one cup at a time IS kinda their thing. For just a regular brewed cup of coffee, I know where to go. Props for their extensive list of choices, too. How can you resist coming back to try each one?
author: Adrienne F.

description: Oh my, the coffee there is INSANE. You can definitely tell they have been working on each and every brew they have behind the counter. For drinkers like me - light and sweet - they sweeten with brown sugar and a touch of heavy cream. Not to mention the smiley, smouldering, very chatty guy behind the counter - I love him and he knows his coffee. So try it out - I guarantee after your first cup you won't want anything else!
author: a. l.

description: OMG The best coffe ever!  They even let me bring in my part time puppy Sammy.   After a cup of Philz I can bring home the bacon and fry it up in the pan and never ever let you forget your the man!
author: Joe T.

description:
best coffee town. 
one cup at a time got to love it. 
and they make there own cream, oh so good.
author: Morgan G.

description: The staff at Philz was very happy-go-lucky, friendly, and willing to help a latte drinker out when it came time for the best cup of coffee I'd had in a loooong time. Thanks guys!
author: Wil E.

description:
My friend Keith brought me here about a year ago. My coffee habit has NEVER been the same! I love the coffee here. I started with the Philharmonic but moved on to the dark roasted Ether. It is the greatest cup of coffee I have ever had.

I now live in Washington DC and I really miss Philz. Every time I visit SF, I stock up on Philz beans so I can enjoy the flavor of SF on the East Coast.

You will never look at "FiveBucks" Coffee the same way after going to Philz and your taste buds will think that you have betrayed them!
author: Gordon M.

description: This is very very good coffee; but I wouldn't say it's consistently amazing across the menu, which is why it gets 4 stars. The first time I went there and had their iced coffee, I was absolutely blown away. But the mocha tesora was loaded down w/ cocoa powder, which I really did not want in a cup of coffee. Still, it's nice to see places that grind your coffee right as you order it.
author: Mark A.

description: Freaking ay I don't know what it is. The coffee here is good. Not phenomenal. I don't care if they hand grind one coffee bean at a time. The guy and girl that were working were so out of it they kept forgetting who ordered what and what beans were in the grinder... in the time that I was in line. They do have an interesting selection of beans but I don't see what the ruckus is. I guess I'm not a coffee person - I just drink the stuff to keep me going.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Philz. The coffee isn't exceptional. But I applaud the originality and the atmosphere. There are quite  a few drinks to choose from and I would recommend this place over most coffee houses. Nice neighborhood patrons too. Extra star for the nice muffins.
author: Becky S.

description: Yes, Philz near Dolores Park has become some oddly colored but similar concept one cup at a time coffee shop...but looks like Philz is actually just moving up the street a bit to the Sit and Spin laundry location.  You know, the one with the ceramic bulldog out front on 18th between Noe and Hartford.  Not sure when it's opening, but there was a "coming soon" sign up the other day.  Maybe more people will stray from Starbucks across the street now.
author: Pink ..

description: You can taste the quality at Philz.  Your cup is made to order, but they add the cream and sugar.  Very "Dunkin Donuts," but surprisingly, it works.  The coffee here has a taste I've never tasted before.  It's purposely crafted to be the best coffee you've ever tasted.
author: Eric S.

description: After all the hype I expected a lot more. I ordered a coffee with milk and sugar... except they put way too much sugar and not enough milk. The mint was a nice touch but I was completely turned off by the sweetness and coffee tasted burnt. I was in a hurry or else I'd have gone back, but now I probably won't ever. It was also way too expensive for a drip coffee.
author: Jon D.

description: Phil gave me a decent lecture on his 25 years of Turkish coffee mastery, all the details of it, when I first visited his coffee shop.  I found his bravado endearing, and I understood his pride when I first tasted of his brew, fresh mint leaf floating atop my crema (though Turkish coffee Malita-style was somewhat alarming to me- from my time spent in Egypt and Greece, I was used to the grounds settling at the bottom of my demitasse), while a lone pidgeon stooped and chattered from a wooden ledge above the couch.  Phil meant what he said.  I don't care how he does it: the man makes a mean cup of coffee.
author: Abendigo R.

description: WOW it's all hand made  - each cup is individually made with a filter = the best coffee EVER!
author: Bumble B.

description: Philz coffee is wonderful!  So fresh and so strong!  If you truly want a great cup of coffee and not a mocha-java-vanilla-low fat-extra foam-half caf-extra whip latte, then this is your place.  Don't be intimidated, the people behind the counter are very friendly and will help explain their coffees and their one-cup-at-a-time procedures.  I do wish that the space was a little better for hanging out.  It's a bit cramped, but great place to stop for coffee if you are on the go.
author: Shane C.

description: Fantastic Coffee!!  A bit decadent so I use this to satisfy my weekend fix.  Although the process can be slow, the service is fantastic & friendly and the product can't be beat.
author: Brent R.

description: Fabulous, fun and good/interesting coffee choices.
author: Jeff T.

description: Amazing coffee! I am a picky coffee drinker to say the least, but Philz "Ecstatic Iced Coffee" is so delicious. There is something about Philz that after you leave you find yourself wanting more later that day or the next. I love Philz! I'm officially addicted. The best part is, I have already gone 3 times in two weeks and each time my drink tastes exactly the same. Love it.
author: Kristen D.

description:
Tried Phil'z for the first time: the Tessora...a liquid dream in a cup.
I'm a convert: I hate to say it but Phil'z kicked Blue Bottle's ass!
author: Sara K.

description: what the hell is a vegan donut? Is that like a vegan rib?
author: niesha d.

description: Mocha Tessora. Two words. Five minutes well worth the waiting. (They grind your beans, brew the elixir, stir, and season all to order.) There are two kinds of coffee drinkers. Those who have love Philz, and those who will.
author: adrian c.

description:
EK's been all over this world, drinkin coffee as she goes. Sweden says they have the best, due to their charcoal filtering or some such, and I agreed. Until Philz.
Best coffee I've ever had. Ever.
There is a great range in taste on the menu. So if somehow (?) you got one you didn't like, I encourage you to describe to the staff what you do like and they're good at picking one that suits you
(yeah Elaina and Dave!)
author: E K.

description: Forget Blue Bottle- Philz is the best coffee in San Francisco. They take the fresh ground/one cup brewed at a time concept to a whole other level. Happiness is a Saturday morning stroll to Philz to get a Philharmonic.
author: Blake R.

description: Awesome yummy coffee!  Very comfy/laidback atmosphere and Phil's son who is usually working on Saturday mornings gives great suggestions. I love the 'mocha tesora', especially when I'm struggling to wake up on those early Saturday mornings for work, which is super conveniently right across the street.
author: Sierra S.

description: My #1 liquid crack study aid.  They should rename themselves "Finalz."  And open up a drive through window called "Midtermz."  Right underneath my house, ok Phil?
author: Molasses C.

description: The coffee here is one of the best that I've ever had. I was confused when I first came here because the menu didn't look like the typical menus I was used to from most coffee shops. I usually go for the sweet mochas, so seeing a menu of just straight coffee flavors (and no speciality menu with different mochas/lattes), I was lost... so I went for the only one on the menu that said mocha (I forgot what they called it). The barista was so cool to ask me where I wanted it sweet or bittersweet. To see that they brew each cup individually was a shock. And out came a rich, yummy goodness!!!
author: E A.

description: Today was my first time at Philz, and I must say the coffee was the best cup of coffee I've had in a while. I was a little confused at first on how to order, because it is much different than ordering the usual at your neighborhood Starbucks. I explained to the guy taking orders that I had never been to Philz before, and he was very helpful at explaining the ordering process, and helped me chose the Ether blend. I agree with many of the other reviews describing how confusing the set-up is in there. There wasn't really any line organization to order and pay, but once you get past that and are prepared to wait about 10 minutes for your coffee to drip, the cup of coffee will be well worth it. My only complaint was that I wished that it was a bit hotter.
author: Dan L.

description: i had blue bottle at the ferry building yesterday... and here i am writing a review about PHILZ. i have to say both are good, but philz is much better. i got iced coffee at both places, which in my opinion is harder to get right than hot. anyways, philz coffee was really good. pungent and strong without being bitter. freshly made. good temperature. not a fan of iced coffee in paper cups (as opposed to plastic) but i'm not complaining. good friendly service. clean. cute dogs outside. free wireless!
author: Shirley L.

description: This cup of coffee is literally orgasmic. Its just unbelievable. I can honestly say I have never had coffee this good ever - not even in Italy. I know now if I move back to SF I should situate myself walking distance to one of these.
author: Stacy H.

description:
wow this coffee is INTENSE! but AMAZING! im a serious coffee addict and philz satifies my cravings. 
the vegan donuts are super yummy too!
author: Chelsea H.

description: You know you're hooked when you give yourself an extra thirty minutes before work to go all the way out to the Castro for a cup of coffee. Philz has a large variety of roasts (made by the cup instead of the pot), and lets you choose something that fits your ideal strength or caffeine content. At first I thought it was a little expensive, but one small cup of the Morning Alarm roast puts me right up on my toes. Yelping them makes me want to go get some now...
author: Taylor S.

description: Delicious, rich, turkish-style coffee made a cup at a time. Each cup comes with a sprig of mint.
author: Netty L.

description: So glad this place is right down the hill from me.  Strong cup keeps you going believe me, and the baked stuff at the counter is always pretty tempting.  The turkish and the mocha are especially good here.  Pricey yes, but this IS the goodstuff.  Not so much on the atmosphere, but then there's no pretense here; it's about the coffee.  I'm getting into that .  . . nice eclectic crowd building.
author: Mark N.

description: Finally had a cup of Philz this morning.  Individually prepared cups of coffee, much like Blue Bottle.  Very strong, very tasty.  I think Blue Bottle may be a little better, but Philz is a pretty damn good alternative.  After my initial positive experience, I think I'll be patronizing Philz on a regular basis.
author: Andrew E.

description: Delicious drip that will make your jaw drop. I think their slogan should be "I can't believe it's not a latte." It's drip coffee, and it tastes like heaven. Plus they amount of grounds they use in the coffee is the same amount someone would usually use for a full pot. I'm a big fan of anything that caffeinated. Ever hear that fun line, "Drink coffee; do stupid things faster and with more energy."? There you go.
author: Michelle G.

description: Seriously the best coffee EVER.  Tons of choices.  Every cup individually made to order.  My fave is the ambrosia with a hint of sweetness and a earthy nutty undertone.  Once you go Philz you can never go back.  Totally addicting.  Btw I always top mine off with a lot of fresh mint.  Brilliant!
author: Dana K.

description: Moved into the area about 3 months ago and live just down street from Philz but never thought about going in for coffee.  Yesterday my bf and i decided to get a cup of coffee.  Jacob, the barista, was so friendly!  I love it!  Being it our first time there he made us a special cup...i think mine was house blend, i forgot.  He added the cream and sugar (i may ask to have less sugar next time)...it was DELICIOUS!  my bf tried mine and was like DAMN Thats GOOD!  So my bf had Jacob add cream and a little sugar to his.  It's just like Grandma's house don't worry about asking for something if you want it in your coffee. Many thumbs up!
author: Boryna M.

description:
Don't be fooled by the tacky neon green and yellow painted exterior, the mess of newspapers and wildly growing plants in this hangout that feels like it's plucked from Santa Cruz. (18th St. is actually much tamer than the Philz on 24th and Folsom).

This coffee is an experience, not a drink. Come when the world seems like it might end and you'll be smiling that Cheshire Cat smile on your way out. I opt for the Turkish Delight handmade coffee with fresh cardamom, served with a piece of Baklava, but if you're indecisive the brew crew here will help you to decide. 

Phil's son works at this location, and he pours out the coffee love even thicker than Phil, with a gorgeous smile to boot. He'll promise to make your cup "extra special"--and delivers on his word.

Oh, and one more thing: Phil, I've noticed that you hire a lot of really beautiful young crunchy-granola hippy gals, especially at the Folsom Street location. But I swear, I just come for the coffee.
author: Jackie C.

description:
BEST COFFEE IN SAN FRAN... 


please open one in the financial district!
author: Stacy N.

description: This is the most precious cup of coffee I've ever met.  Philz simple touches and creamy flavors will have you go  va vroom!
author: Josie A.

description: Best coffee I have ever drank.....period.  Nuff said.
author: Scott B.

description: Thee absolute, hands down best f*cking cup of coffee I've ever had.  I always get a large Tantalizing Turkish with cream & sugar (let them do the cream & sugar THEIR way).  This is not a cup of coffee you walk around with and drink just for the caffeine... oh no, this is a cup of coffee you should sit down for.  Really enjoy it and taste every drop.  Yum.
author: Amy S.

description: amazing coffee and customer service is great! they all know my name and my babies! I have been treated like gold since my first visit and if you read my other reviews you would know that matters to me
author: Kitty L.

description: When my boyfriend lived by the Castro, it was our weekly treat. Ohhh, how delicious the Coffee! It is like the port of wines. A dessert, really, not the average cup of Joe that you drink in the morning to wake you up. The service is always friendly and chatty. Yea, sometimes they forget who ordered what, but somehow they always know how to make it perfect for each person. If it is not, they don't hesitate to make it again until it is perfect. If you are looking for a place to grab your morning coffee when you're late for work, this is probably not the place to go. It takes time to make that perfect luscious cup, and you must be patient. Now my boyfriend and I live in the East Bay, and we are eagerly waiting for the new location on Shattuck to open!
author: Sheryll S.

description: In my two months in San Franciso, I have had many memorable moments. Perhaps the most memorable was when I first took a sip of the iced coffee at this cozy little cafe. No kidding. The coffee here is life changing. Everything about this place made me smile.
author: Natasha M.

description:
Don't believe the hype!  This place gets tons of business but it really shouldn't.  Phil used to be a kind of nice guy, although he never really fit in with the neighborhood and the fag culture around here -- I mean he is not the type who's gonna be singing with the drag queens as far as I have seen.  For a couple years I used to get coffee from him in his old location at Sanchez just because he's not a chain (and the only reason he gets one star in this review is because he is NOT NOT NOT McStarbucks, where no self-respecting San Franciscan should buy their coffee).

Alas, since Phil moved up the street things have gotten totally gross.  The place is always filled with straight people with attitude these days and the whole stumping-for-Gavin thing Phil did was totally bizarre.  What business does a local coffee shop have signing on to an uncontested mayoral campaign?  Weird.  And now he has a little certificate from the mayor in posted on his wall.  I mean come on.

A few specific problems:

1) The staff are rude and out of it, and too busy to chitchat or pay attention to you.

2) Pastries are foul and taste like vegetable oil.

3) Sources of the coffee are not identified.  Fair trade?  Organic?  Forget it at Philz!  Seriously, this guy gets all these props for his 40 unique blends but he doesn't tell us where the coffee is from or who farmed it.  These days, I want to know that my coffee isn't laden with pesticides or the blood of serfs to some global corporation.

3) Too many straight people for the Castro.  Gay people don't get to be the majority in much of the world -- can't we at least have gay coffeeshops in the one neighborhood we can call our own???

Phil, you need to hire more homo cuties and queerdos, you need to identify the sources of your coffee, and more than anything else, you need to be nice to people.

Everyone else ... try Spike's on 19th Street.  It's true, their average cup of coffee is not a fresh-brewed creamy drip sensation, but they're nice people, and they're queers, and that counts for a lot.
author: Jesse S.

description:
Hello, my name is Bianca and I'm a Philz Coffee addict....
So back when I lived in the Castro I discovered this gem of a coffee shop and in I went. I was overwhelmed by the choices, but went for the Mozart.
