As I waited for my hand dripped coffee, I could feel the shakes of anticipation for my caffeine fix starting, and the I saw, (to my calorie conscious horror), heavy cream and sugar being dumped into my coffee. I wrote it off as a one time deal and took a sip...HEAVEN! I don't normally use cream, I mean, I use  non-fat milk and splenda, but Philz Coffee has made me a convert....a fatter convert, but a convert none the less. 
The coffee here is really out of this world, and worth every penny. All the different blends are worth trying, and the little mint leaf they put on the top is such a nice touch. 
The service here is amazing, and every morning I went in, I felt like I was being greeted by an old friend, they asked about life,work my dates etc (obviously I come in too much). However, do not go here and expect fast service, this is handmade coffee, it is not Starbucks, so go and enjoy the experience for what it is.
author: Bianca L.

description: Aside from a few couches, a table and some chairs, Phil'z isn't a place to really lounge.  You come here for the coffee.  And as Phil's motto goes, it's made, "One cup at a time."  Still, for a plain, large cup of coffee, I think it's a bit pricey at $3.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Philz is the kind of place that is turning me into one of those "Peet's, really?" (eye roll) "and don't even get me STARTED on Starbucks" people.  In a totally non-snobby way, of course.  But really, the people at Philz are pleasant and they add your cream and sugar for you and it tastes delicious.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I'm trying to cut back on the joe, so it's really tough living right around the corner from the best coffee shop in the world. Damn them!
author: Sarah S.

description: I love this place (I'm a decaf ethopian kind of dude). It's tiny, but if you time it just right, you can snag a seat. [Insert hating on people who take up two seats in a crowded public space.]
author: David C.

description: Philz Philharmonic is my favorite coffee blend, hands down, and the fresh ground cardamom offered with it is also fantastic. Their chai with fresh mint rocks as well. The local coffee house ambiance in both the Castro and 24th Street locations is most enjoyable and the baristas are friendly and pleasant. Five Stars!
author: Paul E.

description: By far the best coffee in San Francisco. No nasty after taste or acid.  Don't be too Intimated by the long lines because the friendly girls behind the counter work really fast and are super helpfull and friendly which makes the line go faster than you think.  The owner Phil is always there and cool which gives you that real family owned business. There are tons of delicious flavors to choose from. Free Wifi, couches, tables and the best coffee in San Francisco, now what more could you ask for?
author: Hanna A.

description: What can I say that hasn't been said?  Awesome coffee.  Great alternative to Ritual, which I love, but I can't take those lines.  Friendly cute staff, great beans.  Go.  Yeah it's expensive for coffee, so what?
author: Al K.

description: PHILZ!!!!!!!!!!! I love love love coffee from Philz, so rich and creamy, great for caffeine addicts that love super strong coffee. For me, it's a special indulgence, don't think I could drink it everyday, but man, is it good! Warning: you'll be wired for hours after drinking a cup of Philz! Seriously, you'll want to run laps around the block. Better than crack!
author: Kelly L.

description: Can you say Mocha Tesora. I live in Marin and actually had a friend drive one out to me. Each coffee is hand-made-to-order, so it comes out perfectly. When they hand it over they ask you to try it 1st to make sure it's amazing (of course it always is). There is often live music and always great people watching. The scones are pretty yummy too.
author: Amy W.

description: The best coffee in the entire city, I try to come here as often as I can, which is almost once a week at least. Their coffee is expensive per cup but it's handmade and so freakin' delicious. The beans smell and taste amazing if you make coffee at home. I love the mismatched chairs and tables and how laidback it is, the line moves fast if you're waiting to order and get your coffee. The servers are really nice and friendly so if they're making anything fancy for you make sure to tip well. I like the Philharmonic and the Greater Alarm if you need to kickstart your day through coffee.  The Arabic coffee is good too. And they put a mint leaf in your coffee and ask if it's sweet enough for you as well. Philz is AWESOME! And I love my coffee and know how I like it too!
author: Gina R.

description: This coffee is fabulous...  I wish it was on my way to work, because I'd go there daily.  The coffee drinks area very interesting, and the owner is a real character -- try it at once!
author: robyn s.

description: My soy latte actually tasted like a latte, they have vegan donuts, and Phil is a super cool guy.  If I didn't live 45 miles away, I would get my coffee here every morning.
author: Jenn M.

description: Ok, so I was so in love with Philz when I first moved to the city. but now, it's lost it's sheen and shine. i'm not sure if I can justify spending so much on a cup of coffee. the problem is that there is inconsistency depending on who is making it for you. which kinda sucks. but for the most part, my turkish coffee comes out alright.
author: ray e.

description:
black gold ... OMG!  my niece turned me onto this place, cant wait to try them all - $2.75 for a cup, OUCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

what does the everyday stuff go for ... this is the weekend coffee after winning the lotto ...
author: tim y.

description: Went here this weekend. This is one of the best drip coffees I've ever had. The room was very chill with plenty of space and copies of the Onion around.
author: Justin C.

description: What happened to Philz Coffee?  Have to admit I haven't been in two years so I decided to stop in and get a cup of the Turkish. BLAH.  It had a bitter, burnt taste to it.  I was a big fan of Philz four years ago but now I think success has ruined it.  Too popular and too trendy.  Won't be going back.  Especially for a $3.00 handmade I'm sorry I will go to Starbucks.
author: Unemployed A.

description:
so my friends have been talking about this mint mojito iced coffee thing from someone named phil? i thought, whatever, it's coffee, i don't like coffee, it's bitter, it gives me heartburn, i gotta add all this cream and sugar shit to make it taste good, what a hassle!!! but the "mint mojito" part did raise an eyebrow for me, not both, just one, the other brow still thought "coffee...YUCK!" 

but...the following weeks after, everytime i went out with my friends [and somehow my little cousin knew about this place too? and she's not even in SF bay area, but yet she insisted on going there during her visit?] "let's go to phil's! i need coffee, mmmm mint mojito! I.NEED.IT!!!" this has been going on for a month.

*fast forward to today*
ton:i'm bored, let's go do something
me:let's not, i just got back from camping all weekend, i'm tired and it's hot"
ton:perfect! we can go to phil's
me:OMG! enough about your friend phil and his damn coffee, i don't care!
ton:ok you fuckin grouch! put a bra on and comb your hair, i'm picking you up in 10 minutes! you need a mint mojito coffee! or a nap, but i'm bored so i say coffee!

***sometime later, i walk into philz, magically the my grouchiness goes away and there's a smile on my face, and we haven't reached the counter yet. it was one of those "you-see-the-light" moments AAAAHHHHHHHH
i asked the barista, "what is this mint mojito thing everyone talks about? can you make me one of those?" he asks me small or large, i choose the small, cuz you know, I DON'T LIKE COFFEE, then he asks me how sweet i want it, i said "throw the whole jar of sugar in, i don't want to taste any coffee flavor" he laughs.

ton:don't mind grouchy, she's antisocial!

the barista then asks why i don't like coffee and i give him my reasons, he then says understands since he didn't like coffee before either then recommends some flavors i might like to try on future visits and promises the coffee will be nice to me. we had a whole conversation about coffee types, they way they make coffees compared to other places, what's different at their establishment, etc. [antisocial? HA!] he's done making my mint mojito coffee and asks me to taste it to see if i like it so he can make me another if i didn't. i took a sip, and my tongue said "oohhhh!" and both my eyebrows moved.

by the time we walk down the block, i am done with my coffee and i wanted another. WHY DID I NOT GET A LARGE?!!!! WHY WHY WHY? 

to all you non coffee drinkers, PHILZ IS THE SHIT! try the mint mojito, it'll make you wanna sing! and the baristas are super nice and helpful. if they can get this antisocial-people hating-non coffee-drinker to talk, smile, laugh and drink coffee, then PHILZ GOT SOME SKILLZ YOU KNOW WHAT I'M SAYIN?! it's a little pricier than say starbucks, but really who likes the coffee at starbucks? i'm also cheap people! i need to feel my money is worth it! and i can honestly philz is worth every penny!
author: Gaile C.

description: Came here after some tough budget negotiations. Damn this coffee is good.  I got the soooo good.  and it was f'ing good.   Aaron Peskin keeps calling me but I keep telling him he is out of office.
author: Jimmy T.

description: I flew down from Seattle to visit a friend and we stopped in here for a cup of joe...all I can say is "cup of heaven".  I want to fly back down just for the coffee.
author: Bec e.

description: Definitely worth checking out. Great place to take a visitor/newbie as well! I remember the first time I got a cup of coffee at Philz, it was pretty remarkable. The way they individually brew each cup and shake the cream before adding it in is the special treatment that is worth the time and money.
author: Christine L.

description: I'm a big time coffee lover so there isn't a better treat than this place. wide (seemingly endless) selection of delicious coffees made fresh and delicious one cup at at time. I make a trip across town just for a cup. Its hard to have any issues, except that making great cup-at-a-time coffee takes time. some days you question just how long you will wait for that cup of scrumptious rocket fuel. At Philz, its actually pretty long. Be patient if you're there at a busy hour!
author: Matt M.

description: This is the way coffee is supposed to be.  This is my new go-to place for coffee when I'm in SF.
author: Brian R.

description: My husband and I were out taking a leisurely walk and we wanted to stop and get coffee.  Starbucks was crowded as usual, and I thank GOD it was.  I turned to him and suggested we go elsewhere.  We ended up at Philz and this was probably THE best cup of coffee we have had outside of our home.  We will for sure keep coming back here.  The selections are awesome, the fact that each cup is brewed fresh and especially for one customer only is great too.  My cup was a dark brew, balanced and not too acidic.  My husband had a dark chocolate mocha-type drink, and it wasn't overly sweet.  They must have a magic wand behind the bar because my cup of coffee was very creamy in texture.  I don't know what they did, but it was quite excellent!
author: j v.

description: over rated, big $, takes too long, surely servie, dirty.
author: Robert P.

description: I actually have no idea what I've had here.  I've always just asked them to make me something good....  and I've never been disappointed.  Always go out of my way to make a stop here when I'm in SF.  Love it.
author: Roz B.

description: I can't disagree. It's hands down the best cup of coffee I've ever had in San Francisco (Kate's Kitchen being my second favorite). I'm not a patient man, but I'll gladly stand in line to get one of these delicious hand made concotions. It helps that the place is across the street from my girlfriend's house, so I can grab one of these and feel slightly more perky on those morning walks of shame.
author: Tal K.

description:
I first went into this coffee house because of the promise of an authentic Turkish coffee. The owners were very welcoming and the coffee was good.

This time, I was greeted by different servers,all of whom were equally friendly and more: they took risks with their costumers, something chainy coffee houses would never do.

"What do you like? " was the question shot at me together with a big, warm smile. Once you and the person serving you in any capacity build some amount of trust, I don't believe you can go wrong.

The result? A delicious, strong, different, unique, commendable cup'a coffee :-)

Do try it if you have not done so already.
author: Nena G.

description: Another reviewer  said that the first time I went, the owner's son would promise to make it extra special, and that it would be. She was right! I love that. 5 stars because the mocha tessora was fantabulous. I don't even know how to describe it. Let's just say that it could drive me to become a coffee snob and inspire a really dull movie about, amongst other things, cheating, pre-wedding jitters and oh yes, coffee.
author: Grace C.

description: Philz gets 5 stars on the coffee alone. Factor in the so-so ambiance and too-cool-for-you staff, and you get a still very memorable experience worthy of 4 stars. The 24th St. place is funky, but intentionally so...fitting right in with the neighborhood. If you're not in-the-know (a regular), the staff can be a little snooty, but you got to hand it to Phil for the product. If you're used to Starbucks or Peet's or Coffee Bean...be prepared for a serious buzz. No kidding. Especially on an empty stomach. Actually, I don't recommed the empty stomach scenario if you'll be driving. I'll definitely return to this unique place - and be recommending it to friends and fellow coffee drinkers.
author: J. R.

description: this is some serious cawfeee.  I love it.  #17 is aromatic and good.
author: Emm C.

description: The coffee is really great here and it's very close to Mission Dolores Park, so nothing better than grab a cup of 'Tesora' (one of my favorites)  and walk into the park to enjoy it!
author: Steve E.

description: Mmmm, mmmm, mmmm, I love Philz!  I normally order a #4 Jacob's Wonderbar w/cream.  They hand pour each cup and the flavors are so smooth and complex---makes all other coffee taste "like" coffee, but you know it's not because it's not Philz.  Staff are always super friendly.
author: TC C.

description:
Everyone at work has been raving about Philz for a while now, and today was my first taste. I absolutely love it and will now stop making fun of my coworkers for bringing multiple cups in to have throughout their shift. Every aspect of my first visit to Philz was great: the baristas were friendly and introduced themselves, there was no line (which surprised me), and the iced coffee was amazing! They have a cup of fresh mint on the counter, so I added some to my coffee (which I've never done) and I will now always do this! My only complaint is that I only got a medium...

I will definitely be back!!!!!
author: Annie L.

description: I was never a big coffee drinker! and wow within 1 experience my life has forever changed. Going to Philz and truly getting the full experience..they really know their beans its not just any cup of Joe. Exceptional service, incredibly neighborhood friendly...we love dancing to the beats when they are being served for our ears... but this coffee is for the true coffee lover and I must say go with the way they make it their creme and sugar is outstanding and they know how to mix just perfect. I am always more and more blown away by my experience there who knew coffee could be so amazing! my eyes are now wide open.
author: amy g.

description: I have honestly never had a better cup of coffee.  Ever.  I am out in the Richmond, but do not doubt the lure of Philz!  I will trek across the city just for that yummy cup of tantalizing turkish!
author: Violet S.

description:
this is my third time back to Philz, I have to say, i am kind of disappointed. 

The good: 
still, one cup at a time does make every cup of coffee fresh and good, and you can't beat that. A large selection of coffee for me to choose, so it can satisfy my curiosity! Service is very friendly. 

The bad: 
I went there in a Sat afternoon, my friends and I were the only customers when we got there, and it took us more than 10 mins for 4 drinks. Its not because of "one cup at a time"; it's simply because there were only one guy working on that afternoon, and after we got there, couple customers came after, and he was trying to help them at the same time, and he mass up the order and we ended up waiting a long time. 
Inconsistency: thats right! Their coffee "bean" may be consistently good quality, but a good cup of coffee also has other elements, such as sugar and cream, which Philz likes to put for us, and this is the problem. Even they asked me before they put the sugar and cream, I still got different taste each time from Philz, because its actually really hard to measure for us what is "light sugar" and what is "light cream". I also feel sad for my friends, it was her first time, and she doesnt have good experience. She ordered 2 ice coffee, and they tasted completely different, one is perfect, and one is super sweet.  

conclusion: 
I probably will go try couple more times, but I have to say my sanctification drops every time after I go.
author: Kevin T.

description: What is there to say that hasnt already been said? Tasty coffee, great service and a nice intimate location. Maybe more comfortable furniture like in the flagship shop on 24th would be an icing on the cake? A small piece of advice: If you dont want to get addicted to coffee, I would strongly advise you not to try it at Philz!
author: Dmitriy S.

description: Best cup of coffee i've ever had, but its so strong. It's like nothing that starbucks have ever seen.
author: Tiffany D.

description: They've just MOVED! Philz is now located at 4th street and Berry in Mission Bay. They are close to the Giants ball park. It's a bit more swanky now, but still awesome coffee, and ambience! You can take the T line or the N to Mission Bay from the Castro.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: philz coffee is my life blood   yea   love it
author: spiritsf a.

description: Best coffee ever, simple as that.  I dont need to write a fancy, long, or funny  review to state a basic fact.
author: Jocie H.

description:
Best coffee in the nation.
Baristas are very welcoming and eager to explain things to you.
author: Jan M.

description: I'm a tough critic when it comes to coffee and this is by far the best coffee I have ever had.  I make my own coffee with a single drip filter and finally found a place that makes coffee the same way.  The people who work there really know what they are doing and make awesome suggestions on what to drink.  Any chance I get I will grab a coffee from Philz.  I'm making my way through their menu and nothing has disappointed yet.  Over $3 for a cup of coffee but completely worth it!
author: Katie S.

description: A new kind of coffee.  Fits nicely between turkish espresso, strong filtered, with a touch of steamed latte on top. Free internet. A zillion varieties. Hand made. Talkative staff.  Bad decor. Genuine.
author: Geronimo G.

description:
I randomly stumbled upon Philz one day while walking around 24th street. I was very very surprised by the Philz clientle. 24th is a very hispanic area and Philz  is pretty much yuppies, hipsters, and hippies.

Positives

- the coffee is amazing. Probably the best coffee I've ever had. I take all of my friends there when they come into town

- Still "relatively" undiscovered

Negatives

- It's a bit pricey for a cup of coffee. 3 bucks for a small "Jacobs". It's hard to justify spending 3 bucks a day when you can get $B for less than 2.

- I have to admit the people working the counter are a bit snobby and unfriendly. At $Bs I feel like people always say hi and smile.

- The coffee bar setup is confusing and chaotic. I've definitely been skipped or unintentionally ignored by workers.


Overall, this place rocks. I highly recommend it.
author: Chad R.

description:
this place rocks my socks. if you're bored of french roast and colombian...this is the place for you. they individually brew each cup of coffee. they make their own unique flavors full of spice and everything nice. my personal favorite is the philharmonic, which comes out all frothy and they even add a mint leaf.

grab a cup and chill inside, outside or at dolores park, which is just a quick walk away.
author: selma s.

description: Hands down, the best cup of coffee I could ask for. They put so much energy and pride into each cup, it just has to be.  As custom as it gets. Even better than Blue Bottle, which does it the same way, but I feel that it's a bit inconsistent.  Five stars confirmed (as well as lifetime loyalty) when we took some friends by a few weeks ago a few minutes after they closed and Phil let us in and hooked us up.
author: Val U.

description:
The last 100 hours of my life have been pretty...shall we say...intoxicating. And when I say Intoxicating, what I really mean to say is that I have been living off a steady diet of alcohol. I guess thats what a booze cruise to Mexico with a bachelor party will do to you. So you can imagine that not only am I a bit groggy, cranky, in need of sleep, I am completely annoyed at my friend for dragging me with her to do laundry. Seriously, I need some f*ckin sleep.  But since I am such a wonderful man; I painted on a smile, dropped some Visine in, did a quick scrub of the chompers to rid them of the moss they grew and I headed out to Sit and Spin to watch my freind do laundry. WTF am I doing here? 
Like most of my distressful moments in my life, I try to find the silver lining. Philz Coffee is just that. In fact, I am writing this review while sipping what might possibly be the greatest Chai I have ever had. Perfectly spiced, not overly sweet, no lame syrup flavored squirt from a bottle. This is the real sh*t. Cool little shop, good tunes, friendly staff and great drinks. This place would have been PERFECT if it wasn't for some dude spewing crazy nonsense about how some other dude could change the molecular structure of river water by meditating over petri dish samples of it ...f'n weird. But hey, you cant choose the customers right. I love Ritual Roasting Company, but I have to say I think I might start an affair with Philz.
author: Diego C.

description: This coffee is seriously good. Not knowing anything about Philz the first time I wondered in I asked for an espresso, as this is not an option at Philz the barista was very nice about explaining what they're all about: They specialize in blends (not single origins beans) and brew each cup to serve. As a black coffee fan I tried a small cup of one of the darker roasts. After it brews the barista tosses the liquid from cup to cup to aerate it and get the temperature down a bit, I don't know how much this ultimately does, but it was a great tasting coffee. Even though I don't like milk or sugar in my coffee after tasting Abby's I realized that cream and sugar are the way to go at Philz. They adjust the sugar exactly to your liking, stir in some hand shaken cream, and top it off with a fresh spring of mint. I know its got to be bad for you, but its freaking delicious. They just opened a location on Van Ness so I'm sure I'll be stopping by more often.
author: Alex D.

description:
Where to begin...

The first time I came here, I was meeting friends. I had no idea what I was in for. The selection of roasts and blends is pretty large, and I spent a while gawking before settling on a small Julie's Ultimate.

"Cream and sugar?" asked the friendly man brewing my coffee. I normally do milk but no sugar, but for some reason said "Um, sure." Paid, thanked him, took a sip...

And nearly started crying. It was the most perfect cup of coffee I had ever tasted. Then I sampled my friends' orders, all equally perfect. And I've since introduced new people to Philz; they all agree.

It's not a big place, but there are tables outside and it's a great spot to sit and chat and people-watch.

The pastries and breads and such look really, really good too, but I haven't tried any. I'm always too focused.
author: Nicole A.

description: I love Philz, it is the best coffee in the city. I lived on 24th street for many year's and swore by it. I was so happy when Phil choose to open his shop in Castro, he's a good man his coffee, is obviously his passion. It's a great pop in coffee shop, my partner and I stop in grab a cup and go to Deloris Park, very romantic, try it out sometime, sure you'll come back for more.
author: Aaron D.

description: I totally totally got hooked to the coffee at this place...but i started getting really jittery and excited after the coffee...in the end i stopped having any coffee at all because my friends could not handle me after a cup of coffee from Philz
author: saroj y.

description: Have to say they have the best coffee with a bullet, I tried a lot of theirs (Tesora and Turkish were my favorites). Places in Spain, Italy, etc don't have anything on their roasts. This place in Shibuya, Tokyo was close, but really miss the daily stops to Philz. Open up in Minneapolis.
author: Emm C.

description: This is easily some of the best coffee I have ever had. You've gotta try the Dancing Water blend if you go!
author: David B.

description: Best coffee in the city. Also the best 7 layer bars - umm so yummy. Plus the guy behind the counter never makes me feel like an idiot for asking what he would recommend and I love that they add the cream and sugar for you - I have a tendency to over-sweeten and with the fabulous coffee here it is completely unnecessary. Seating always seems to be good and you can even bring your pup and seat out front if that's your style. Parking is never too terrible to find either, since yes I do drive in just for this coffee.
author: Ashley H.

description:
More caffeine than any other coffee I've had.
Tremendously addictive.
Very friendly servers. I needed something sweet and creamy; one made one for me and waited until I sipped and approved to charge me.
I have to limit my visits, because the caffeine makes me feel like my skin is going to vibrate off. But the coffee's really good. 
They've served it lukewarm a few times, though, so you might want to ask for it hot.
author: Meg B.

description: First of all, I was so impressed with the taste of the coffee! It is incredible. Then, I met Jacob & Greg--it became obvious that they have a passion for what they do. Never will you get this quality at Starbucks. I love the fact that this is a local business an worth supporting. Despite the growing demand for the product and the "rush hour" line---I really do not mind waiting a couple minutes because I know they really care about how much I enjoy the coffee AND my experience there. Many other local businesses can take a lesson or two from this outstanding business--just by focusing on what the customer wants and simply delivering--its a winning combination. There is currently no competition for what is being offered at Philz--they took a chance by not following the herd and I am happy that I took a chance to try it- now I am hooked!
author: Don P.

description: Best cup of coffee I've ever had in my life. Server (I can't remember his name) was very knowledgable and very friendly. I will be back, again and again and again.
author: Randall K.

description: Yes, coffee is very very strong to the point of not being able to drink it although it is an original trend setting idea they have. They also use heavy whipping cream which does not bode well with me or some heavier sort of super fattening cream. The guys that own it are super awesome and friendly.
author: Annie A.

description:
i'm sold to their New Manhattan!  (very similar to blue bottle's crack coffee)
they have so many options...if you're confused, just ask
author: binh l.

description: I can be found at Philz at least twice a week. I always get the chai and it's amazing. They make it just how I want it and are always really nice even though I'm demanding! Philz is the best coffee/tea house in the city and the Castro location is by far my favorite.
author: Cara L.

description:
I like to take my outa town friends here.  They love the shit.  So do I.  

I say skimp on cream and sugar on all your coffees from now on so you don't feel bad asking for it here.  It's soooo good that way.  or fuck it altogether, but get it with both.  You won't regret it.  Everyone that tries to order without tastes my cup and goes back cuz it is soooo goood.

Try the chilled coffee on hot days.  Deee-lish.
author: sabrina y.

description: Best coffee in town, hands down. Philz harks of old San Francisco in a way that makes this native feel right at home. It's personal and poetic. I'll have a large, but hold the mint sprig. Cheers!
author: V C.

description: Philz has amazing coffee. And Jacob is the friendliest barista I've ever met. He makes _the best_ cup of joe I've ever had. I don't care for the atmosphere though. It's very small, not a lot of places to sit, and lots of families with noisy kids going in and out in the mornings. Although, I suppose that can't be helped since the parents are drawn to the _amazing_ coffee. I would have given this place 5 stars if Jacob was still there regularly.
author: Damon K.

description:
*Philz' coffee is amazing! 
 Jacob's wonderbra is by far my favorite!!!!  if you haven't tried it yet - - -go out and do it soon!
*The two gals who work there are always so great! cheerful!  and ready to recommend coffees that will fit my taste.
*2 complaints that make it a difficult place to stay in once i've gotten my coffee are: 
 #1  the arabic music.   though fun & completely appropriate in other atmospheres,  it is way too loud & not conducive to my morning  &/or afternoon coffee.
#2  WHAT HAPPENED TO THE COUCH?!?!?!  i like to sit & chat with friends while drinking my yummy jacob's wunderbra, but it's just not cozy without a couch, thank you very much.
if i'm going to meet friends for coffee, now, i will choose another location.  
in conclusion...no couch & loud arabic music makes for a nasty place to visit with friends, but  beautiful baristas & jacob's wonderbra make my day happy!
author: janice s.

description: San Francisco is a food mecca, and my favorite gastronomical experience during my last visit was the daily cup of Philz.  The use of cardamom, the smooth drip - a heavenly delight. Never am I so envious of non-New Yorkers - those who live in the Castro and can frequent Philz regularly, lucky you!
author: Muna K.

description: you don't simply drink philz coffee.  it actually makes out with you.  that is how good it is.
author: Samantha W.

description: I am certainly not a coffee snob but since I drink my coffee straight-up black, I tend to taste things that my over-loading sugar-addict friends cannot taste in a coffee.  For example - Starbucks?  Its crap.  Seriously, the coffee itself is not quality enough to charge what they do but sometimes you need a double shot espresso in a jiffy and that's the only place around.  Where was I?  So I checked out Philz yesterday and I'm not gonna lie, I walked in with full judgmental guard up.  I hate trying something after too many people have told me, "you gotta try it, you'll love it"  ... sets the expectations way too high.  Anyhow, the hottie behind the counter must've picked up on my simmering bitchiness and could not have melted me faster with his charming smooth talk.   Jacob?  you're absolutely yum-licious.  Anyhow, he whipped up a fantastic cup of something and there it was, I became a believer.  Now, I don't think I'll ever wake up at "3am dreaming about our coffee" like the cute boy promised but I certainly will take another lazy-day stroll down there for their solid coffee.  Oh and p.s., if you're sensitive to caffeine, be careful here ... I am utterly immune and by that I mean, i can follow a 6-pack of red bull with a nap which I recognize is odd ... but this cup at Philz had me more than a tad jittery and saying to my friend, "um, i need to eat now ... i think I'm having a seizure."  Do with that what you will.  Two very enthusiastic thumbs up.
author: Sarah K.

description: Grab a perfect cup of coffee from Philz and walk to Dolores Park in the morning :)
author: Ashley K.

description: good cup of coffee. only draw is the service is not always good.  at times they greet you like a friend and sometimes a cold shouldr. none the less good coffe.
author: brian l.

description: Awesome coffee! A friend recommended the place and I'm glad he did. In my opinion, Philz coffee quality is right up there with BB. It's hard to make an apples-to-apples comparison because Philz includes the mint leaves and "special" cream, but the coffee is great. The folks working there are equally great. When I told them it was my first time, they slowly explained all the steps involved in preparation  and helped me pick out the perfect blend. They also asked how sweet/non-sweet I like my coffee so they could completely customize it for me. They even had me taste it before paying to see if I wanted them to adjust anything. Wonderful experience and coffee. I just hope these guys keep growing/spreading across the city.
author: Joe C.

description: The best coffee on the planet. Get a philharmonic with cream, sugar, and mint. You won't regret it!
author: Brett S.

description: When I first moved to san francisco 9 months ago from DC, one of the things I looked forward to was exploring the neighborhood coffee shops and figuring out which one would become my favorite.  At times I felt like goldilocks because despite all the options nothing felt quite right. Cafe Flore is a nice space but the coffee is weak. Starbucks, give me a break, it's like bear hunting season on weekends and let's just say I wasn't issued a permit! Tartine is great, if you want to wait in line for 20 minutes and take everything to go. Samovar has every imaginable permutation and preparation of tea, but unfortunately no coffee. it's also a little on the formal side. who wants table service at a neighborhood cafe/tea shop? Where's a girl to go for a good cup of coffee in the neighborhood. Philz was just right! Yummy coffee, check. Friendly staff and good service, check! Comfy leather chairs, fun big band and swing music, check and check.
author: Milgo G.

description: Love Philz!  Im new the the place but everything Ive tried has been wonderful.  Canopy of Heaven, Dancing Water, and the Mocha-- all delic!  Staff is super cool too
author: reg h.

description: still love philz but the only drawback is the disorganization.  I was there on sat morning when it was fairly mobbed, but it was unclear where to get in line to place an order, or even if there was a line.  Once I got my order, I then had to wait in line with about a dozen other people to pay, during which time it would have been possible to completely consume my drink while waiting for my turn with the single cashier, who was also busy making bagel sandwiches and performing other tasks.  Not the most efficient system!
author: David T.

description: Good, tasty coffee. It's a bit pricey though, but definitely worth trying if you're a coffee fan.
author: Paul H.

description: Awesome coffee, great hot chocolate, and cool brewers! Love this place to come and play around on my computer.
author: Chris D.

description: i stopped by philz after seeing the big banner. coffee is okay, but not worth the price. why would you put a piece of mint in the coffee? ever try drinking coffee while having the mint block the spout? i rather have a latte at tartine's for the same price and maybe splurge on a real pastry on occassion.
author: Sun K.

description: It's difficult to rate Philz's coffee because I don't think I've actually ever tasted  the coffee -- through the loads of cream and sugar that is. I've tried several times in the last few weeks -- hot coffees, iced coffees, dark blends, light. While I do like the independent neighborhood feel of the place (and free Wifi) they just don't understand what "very little" or a "tiny bit" of cream means. Part of the whole gimick (I mean experience) of Philz is that they blend your cup of coffee to order so you don't have much control over how much sugar and/or cream you get.  Yesterday I said "just a tiny bit of cream, no sugar." As I watched the employee make my drink, I cringed when I saw her put in --I swear -- probably 1/3 cup of cream. The result: warm creamy coffee-like beverage. I'm also over their whole pretentious mixing of the coffee: water in, then take the cup it flowed into and pour it into another and back and forth. It literally takes at least 5 minutes to get a cup of coffee there.
author: Mark V.

description: OK.. I don't even drink coffee. Ever. However, last weekend I was introduced to Philz and was totally blown away! Seriously, I didn't think coffee could taste this damn good. I mean, it was smooth, perfectly sweetened and smelled ah-mazing! I am most definitely going back soon for  delicious cup of "it's the best".
author: Nicole L.

description: i usually go to the 24th street location, but i was in the area today and decided to pop in for some philz.  i was already highly caffeinated and decided to get chai instead of coffee.  there was just one guy working at the counter, and he was super friendly, offering suggestions for blending the dif coffees in order to make the perfect brew.  i still stuck w/ the chai with vanilla soy, and it was tasty, but i do think i like the coffees here better.
author: Helen T.

description: yummy!  scrummy!  bo-bunny!!  By far the most delicious coffee in sf.  Try a cold, refreshing, ice coffee with cream and sugar, and maybe you'll be lucky enough to have it made by the tall, dark and handsome hunk......hhhhmmmmmm.
author: Pammy S.

description: I don't even drink coffee and I love this place. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and it is just a pleasure to stop by.
author: Michael H.

description: I just moved to this city and love that there are so many different types of coffee shops to choose from, unlike the DC area where you can choose from Starbucks or Starbucks.  However I've only been to 4 coffee houses in SF with Cafe Organica being my favorite and being only a block from my house (although it looks like they're closed now - boohoo) so my review might not be completely legit.  Although Philz isn't that close to my house I went ahead and made the bike ride anyways (all on a friend's recommendation) and not only was Phil's son (who run's the 18th st. shop) friendly he promised me the best cup of coffee I've ever had...I ordered the mocha and he made it exactly how I liked it...not too sweet and strong, and yes, possibly the best cup of coffee I've ever had.  It was so strong I couldn't even finish it but it was damn good coffee.  Also, try the hot chocolate....tastes like liquid chocolate...soooo money!!!  I'll be back there for sure.
author: David C.

description: I stumbled upon Philz by accident a few months ago and I've been hooked ever since. I drink a lot of coffee so when I taste an exceptional cup of joe, I really take notice! Yes, at peek times, a line tends to form and if you're in a hurry, you'll just have to either be super patient or go somewhere else. Its a small price to pay for the best coffee in SF...no, the bay area...maybe even dare I say...the world? ok, maybe not that great but its pretty darn good. I wake up in the morning dreaming of a philz coffee. I'm that sick. I've been to both locations (there's another one on 24th and folsom) but I prefer the 18th since its smaller and on my way to work. The staff is extremely friendly and always helpful if you're unsure of what coffee you want. For a non-espresso type beverage, the price is definitely up there. 3-3.25 for a large cup-o-joe but its definitely got more of a kick than any espresso drink I've tasted. Definitely worth the money I shell out on a daily basis. Coffee Lover? This is the place for you.
author: Richard K.

description: As a amatuer coffee drinker, all I know is that I like drinking my coffee black and I know that I don't 90% of black coffee that I drink.  A co-worker has told me about this place for some time so we finally get a chance to go there.  WOW.  I have never been more impressed with a single cup of black coffee.   As we are walking in, none other than Phil himself was there to greet us and shake our hands in welcome.  He explained that he removes the acid from the coffee which gives it the ultra smooth flavor.  He then prepared a sample of very strong black coffee which he instructed me to sample like wine.  Its the first cup of coffee I have had in a long time that I would say is the best cup of black coffee I have ever drank.  My only complaint was that I like my coffee very hot (when I say hot, I mean near boiling) and my cup was hot, just not piping.  Other than that, if you seek the best single cup of regular black coffee in the city, I HIGHLY recommend this place.
author: Eli Z.

description: i am not a coffee person and i crave philz coffee, i always get the iced coffee. sometimes they put mint on top which i love, i am always a little sad when they don't but the coffee is still bangin.
author: Adrienne G.

description: The best coffee in the city and excellent service once you make it to the front of the line. Highly recommend. I use their beans to cold brew my coffee and love it. I also treat myself for one of their cups that they make every now and again. Love it!
author: B L.

description: I don't live in San Francisco but am tempted to move there just for Philz!  Great staff--friendly and very knowledgeable.  Overall, I'd give 10 out of a caffeinated 10 to Philz!
author: Diana W.

description: I am alittle weary of giving this place 4 stars, but I could not justify giving it three (if that makes any sense whatsoever). I went here with a friend who said it was "the best coffee" he's ever had. Upon hearing such a statement, and due to the fact that I need to have my peets every morning, I decided to try it out (hence I was already biased towards peets...). Anyhow, getting there, it was cool that they make your coffee personally (i.e. grind, filter etc etc). Knowing that all this hard work goes into a cup of coffee is great, you feel like you're an A-list celebrity. Logistically it does not make sense whatsoever (yes the coffee is good, but when you want your cup right away, would you want to spend 40minutes waiting for them to make it for all of the other customers before you get yours???). Anyhow, we were the few who entered so such a predicament did not happen. Getting to the coffee. It was good, mine was actually too sweet, but it sufficed (i ordered mine with cream and sugar). (it almost reminded me of the days when i couldn't handle legit coffee, and I would go to Cumberland farms and get incredibly super sweet/fake cappuccinos from the machine). Hmmm, I guess I'm rambling. Ok, to sum it up. If you don't like coffee, but someday decide to try it, this is the place. Anyone can drink coffee here. I still stand by my Peets though (sorry!!!).
author: Cameron R.

description: I am not a coffee connoisseur by any means but I do like a good cup every time. I can care less who picked the beans and from where and what kind of soil etc etc. I'm sure it is for a lot of people, but not for me. I first tried Philz at some event where they were handing out free samples. Immediately I thought "this is a really good cup of coffee". Months later i stumbled upon this location as I drove by. I walked in and was intimidated by the huge menu of different coffee  blends. The second time I came, I noticed the description sign of each coffee blend posted right in front of the cashier. I picked one at random and gave my order to the person behind the counter. (I'm not sure if they get offended being called baristas) being that this place is comforting, unpretentious and knowledgable about their craft. Baristas make me think of Starbucks and... yeah. The man asked me how sweet I like my coffee and if I wanted cream - they make it to your liking. They even asked me to taste it in front of them just to make sure before I left. I assume all  coffee is made drip so I don't mind waiting a bit. I try to stop by whenever I'm in the area for a great cup of coffee.
author: Lee O.

description: definitely the best coffee I've had in the city so far.  i prefer this place to ritual roasters and blue bottle for coffee, but I still like ritual for their americano.
author: Eddie K.

description: lovely, delicious, coffee. they have a great selection of beans and roasts to choose from. my favorite is the turkish blend with ground cardammom. the place is comfortable, filled with the usual friendly boehemians of the mission. my vote for the best place to get a cup or a pound of coffee in the city.
author: BaniAndJai W.

description: Get the tesoro.  Best coffee I've ever had.  Everything else just tastes bad now.  I don't know how coffee can possibly be this good.  Phil spoon fed me and gave me free baklava.  There is a lot of traffic coming in and out (especially at the 18th and Sanchez location), so it's not easy to study without earplugs.  Free wireless is always good.
author: Donna F.

description: In the interests of full disclosure, a friend of mine works here and I would probably not write a negative review of the place even if one were justified... but fortunately, one is not. I rarely drink coffee, but stopped in here a couple of weeks ago and let him mix me some concoction that may well have been the best-tasting cup of coffee I've ever had - one which might turn me into a full-fledged, stained-teeth, foul-breathed java junkie if I'm not careful. Definitely the standard against which all future cups of coffee will be compared.
author: Rick A.

description: Worth every penny.  Frothy, steamy, yummy.  Phil really knows how to make his coffee.  Great attention to detail - I really like the mint leaf on top.  But...I tend to get my coffee and go.  I just don't find the decor very appealing.  Second rate furniture that's cramped in.  But, the coffee, the coffee makes it all worthwhile!!!
author: G P.

description:
great great coffee, as mentioned by many. philharmonic blend is a dependable standby. for those non-coffee days, the chai is tasty, although it has a strange goop that forms at the bottom. 

one of my favorite bakery snacks is the oat and dried fruit disk thing. not usually a health nut but this is mighty flavorful.

striking -1 star because of a very messy pour. dripped all over the shirt at work before i had a chance to notice that it was all over the place. petty? perhaps... but annoying, too.
author: jj w.

description: This place makes THE BEST COFFEE EVER (especially if your cup has been brewed by Jacob Jaber, co-owner with his dad, Phil).  You'll have an oralgasm, guaranteed!  Peet's; Ritual Coffee; Blue Bottle; none of them even come close to Phil'z, but treat them as an acceptable alternative if you can't get to Phil'z.  'Nuff said.
author: Sun L.

description: what up phil! ya coffee wakes me up before i go go buzzin like WHOA! yadadamean fo sho yadadamean fa sheezy. i dont think they know thats my word! but its all good as long as they know philz baristas be hand stirring coffee grinds instead of using espresso machine robots to spit out your coffee. phil is a coo cat and he always laid back smokin that cigaweed hee hee hee its all good baba baby! ONE CUP AT A TIME FO LYFE!!
author: Peter Q.

description: The Best cup of coffee I've EVER had!  It was wonderful!!!! They make each cup individually! AMAZING!!!!
author: Kristen C.

description:
First, let me say that the coffee here is excellent--better than anywhere else that I've tried in San Francisco or elsewhere. I'm not a coffee snob, but I've been to Ritual Roasters and other similarly popular places, and Philz beats them hands down.

The baristas at Philz also work really hard to satisfy their customers. They take their time and give lots of TLC to each beverage.

Why did I only give them 3 stars? Because while they all do a superb job, some of the baristas there have a serious *attitude* problem.

I happen to really like iced coffee, and while they have many delicious coffee blends, only one of them is pre-made in iced form. I tried it and it was wonderful, so when I went back I asked if I could get one of the other blends iced. The barista said that I could but it would take a bit longer. I said that was fine. So while the guy was making my iced coffee I got a lengthy reprimand about how inconvenient it was for him to make iced coffee beverages per customer, and how much longer people would have to wait if everybody ordered one. The next time I went there I ordered another blend on ice, and I got the same kind of flack from a different barista. When she was done she gave me a dirty look and said sarcastically, "I told you it would take a long time." Frankly I didn't mind the wait, as I'm a firm believer in the old maxim that "quality takes time." What I did mind was the extra sass that I got on the side.

IMHO if it's inconvenient for them to serve other blends on ice then they should just charge more money or say that they don't offer that service. Making your customers feel guilty for ordering a time-consuming beverage is a crappy way to do business.

3 stars out of 5 for good coffee with a bad attitude.
author: Jay L.
